loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. is determined to eradicate poverty from her family by working hard. She hopes to achieve this goal with the help of Kiva . She is a widow and the bread winner of the family. She is 54-years of age, has 4 children and lives in Afro Media Lagos State Nigeria. She sells frozen foods like chicken, turkey and fish, a business she started in 1999. She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to buy more cartons of frozen food.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food

loans.name: Yakoubou

texts.fr:
Yakoubou F. is 28 years old, married and the father of one. He lives and works in Adéta, Togo, a town located about 150 kilometers from the capital. To earn a living, Yakoubou purchases used motorcycles to repair and sell. The majority of people in this area do not own a car, and so, many people use motorcycles to get around because they are less expensive and easier to maintain. Motorcycle maintenance is a profitable enterprise because it is a service that is always in demand. With this loan, his second with FECECAV, Yakoubou would like to purchase another motorcycle to repair and sell. With the profit he will see, Mr. F. would like to improve the standard of living of his wife and child.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Yakoubou F. est âgé de 28 ans marié et pére d’un enfant. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, Togo, une ville située à environ 150 kilomitres de la capitale. Pour gagner de l’argent, Yakoubou achète les motos usées pour les réparer et les revendre. La majorité des personnes ici ne possède pas de voiture, donc beaucoup de gens utilisent les motos pour déménager parce qu’ils sont moins chers et plus faciles à maintenir. La maintenance des motos est une entreprise bien profitable parce que le service est toujours demandé. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, Yakoubou désire acheter une autre moto pour réparer et revendre. Par les profits qu’il va gagner, Monsieur F. va améliorer la qualité la vie de sa femme et de son enfant.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle to repair and sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Señora Ana María P. Pérez is 45 years old and has three years of secondary education. She has five children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She lives in the district of Salaverry, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru.

Señora Ana sells food from her kiosk to people in her neighbourhood and to passers-by. She also sells cakes and pastries. In the past she delivered food and provided board and lodging to workers from various factories. For the last 15 years she has been working in her current business and tells us that before becoming a member of the Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción”, she was selling such small quantities that she didn’t have much capital. Now she feels happier because the profits she has earned have allowed her to expand and improve the business. In the afternoons she sells fuel from her house—oil, kerosene, alcohol, and other types.

From the Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” she obtained her previous loan with which she bought tables and chairs in order to provide better service and more comfort to her clients. With the S/.1300 loan, which she will pay back in six months, she will buy ten containers of kerosene and oil. Señora Ana’s dream is to own a large restaurant in the centre of Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria; tiene 5 hijos y 1 aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Ana se dedica a la venta de comida en su kiosco a personas de su barrio y a todos los transeúntes, pero además vende pasteles y postres, anteriormente repartía comida y daba pensión a algunos trabajadores de diferentes fabricas ya hace 15 años que se dedica a este negocio nos cuenta que antes de ser socia del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” vendía en menor cantidad ya que no tenía mucho capital, ahora se siente muy contenta porque los créditos que ha recibido le han permitido crecer y mejorar su negocio. Por las tardes vende combustible en su casa como: petróleo, kerosene, alcohol y otros.

En su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” obtuvo su anterior préstamo con el que compró mesas y sillas para brindar mejor servicio y comodidad a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/.1300 que cancelará en seis meses comprará:diez baldes de kerosene y petróleo. La señora Ana sueña con tener un restaurante grande en el centro de Salaverry.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more kerosene and oil

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mahudjro Sekanme Group

texts.fr:
The current micro-project concerns the transformation of palm nuts into red palm oil. This project is the initiative of the women's group MAHUDJRO de SEKANME in the D’APKRO-MISSERETE community. The group was created in 1995 and is composed of seven very active working women. The micro-project will enable the increase of the group's production capacity, the making of a profit, and the improvement of living conditions of its members. Also, the geographic situation of this group's community is an asset for this business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ce micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin MAHUDJRO de SEKANME dans la commune D’APKRO MISSERETE. Ce groupement a été crée en 1995 et est composé de 7 femmes très actives pour le travail. Le micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager de bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres. Aussi la situation géographique de la commune de ce groupement est elle un atout pour l’exercice de cette activité.

loans.use: To buy four tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Benny Margarita

texts.es:
Señora Benny Margarita Álamo P. is 27 years old and has one son who is still dependent on her. She lives in the neighbourhood of Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad department, Peru.

She started out by selling frozen treats like snow cones in the summer. In the afternoons she sold fruit desserts, stuffed potatoes, oatmeal, and fried bread. She slowly saved enough to open a small store that she still has, and from where she sells a wide variety of products such as groceries, candy, and drinks. Just before the school year starts, she sells school supplies, and she also prepares lunches for the local children. In addition to these activities she is responsible for looking after a family-owned internet place.

Her first loan of S/. 300.00 obtained from the Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Auroras en Acción” was used to buy a liquidizer so that she could make juices, and she also bought fruit at wholesale prices. With the S/.1000.00 loan she will buy more stock for her store, as well as school supplies at the beginning of the school year. She plans to pay back the loan within six months. Her biggest dream is to expand her store and to buy a mobile van from which to sell hamburgers in the evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Benny Margarita Álamo P. tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella.Vive en el sector Aurora Díaz en el distrito de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio se inicia vendiendo marcianos en temporada de verano, por las tardes vendía mazamorra, papa rellena, avenas y cachangas. Poco a poco fue ahorrando para poner una pequeña bodega que ahora la tiene con mayor variedad de productos. Vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y por campaña escolar aprovecha en vender útiles escolares. Además prepara loncheras para los niños de su barrio. Aparte esta encargada de administrar el alquiler de cabinas de Internet que es un negocio familiar.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Auroras en Acción” lo invirtió para comprar una licuadora la cual le ha servido para preparar jugos y también compro frutas al por mayor. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será canceldo en un periodo de seis meses comprará más mercadería para surtir su tienda, además de útiles escolares aprovechando la campaña escolar. Su mayor sueño es implementar su tienda y comprarse un carrito sanguchero para preparar hamburguesas para vender por las noches.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Señora Bertha P. T. is 42 years old and has five years of secondary education. She has four children, but only two of the younger ones are still dependent on her. She lives in the neighbourhood of Aurora Díaz, district of Salaverry in La Libertad department, Peru.

When she began her business, she was selling clothing for men, women, and children. Her neighbours, acquaintances, and friends asked her for loans which they didn’t always pay back on time. As a result she gradually began to lose her capital and finally decided to quit the clothing business. She decided to prepare stuffed potatoes in the afternoons, at the beginning selling them from house to house. As time passed and she became better known, people started to come to her house to buy the prepared food.

She belongs to the Community Bank “Jerid—Camino al Exito”, from which she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00. With this money she bought a range of underwear. She will pay off the new loan of S/. 800.00 in six months. With it she will buy a bag of potatoes, a can of oil, and disposable plates and forks. Her greatest dream is to open a hardware store with a full range of products that she can sell at low prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha P. T. tiene 42 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos menores aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Aurora Díaz en el distrito de Salaverry en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Cuando inicio su negocio vendía ropa para dama, caballero y niños. le hacían pedidos sus vecinos, conocidos y amigos pero a veces no le cancelaban a la fecha y poco a poco se descapitalizaba así que decidió dejar ese negocio. Tuvo la idea de prepara papa rellena por las tardes, al principio ofrecía de casa en casa con el tiempo se ha hecho conocida ahora la gente la busca en su casa para comprarle sus preparados.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Jerid- Camino al Éxito” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró una variedad de ropa interior. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará un saco de papa, un bidón de aceite, platos y tenedores descartables. Su mayor sueño es poner una ferretería con todos sus implementos en donde ofrezca productos a precios cómodos.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 45126

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo A., 58 years old, is a kind woman who lives in Villa Venezuela. She is a widow and has four grown children, whose ages range from 19 to 32. To help her children get ahead, she started working from her house more than 30 years ago as a seamstress. She started her business by purchasing a used sewing machine, which she still owns, with her savings.

Her children married and became independent, and she now lives alone in her humble home with walls made of zinc. Her dream is for her business to prosper and to make improvements to her small house. She seeks a loan for the working capital necessary to purchase fabric to make clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amparo A. de 58 años de edad, es una amable mujer que habita en Villa Venezuela, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, de 32 y 19 años, para sacar adelante a sus hijos desde hace mas de 30 años trabaja en su casa de habitación como costurera, negocio que inició comprando una máquina usada con sus ahorros, la cual aun conserva. Sus hijos se casaron e independizaron y ella quedó sola viviendo en una humilde casita cuyas paredes son de Zinc, su sueño es que su negocio prospere y pueda mejorar su casita. Solicita un préstamo para capital de trabajo ya que necesita comprar telas y hacer ropa para la venta

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for her sewing.

loans.name: Mahuna Goulo Group

texts.fr:
This micro-project focuses on the conversion of palm nuts to palm oil. It is the initiative of the all-female group MAHUNA de GOULO in the commune of AKPRO MISSERETE. This group was created in 1997 and is composed of 9 women. This micro-project will allow the group to increase its production capacity, to obtain profits, and to improve the living conditions of its members. This is a group that is experienced in the business of processing palm nuts. In addition, the geographic situation of the commune allows this group to obtain palm nuts to process.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin MAHUNA de GOULO dans la commune D’AKPRO MISSERETE. Ce groupement a été crée en 1997 et est composé de 9 femmes. Ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager de bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres. C’est un groupement bien expérimenté dans le domaine de la transformation des noix de palme. Ainsi la situation géographique de la commune lui permet d’avoir les noix de palme à transformer.

loans.use: To buy 4.8 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Elvia Domitila

texts.es:
Señora Elvia Domitila M. D. T. is 54 years old. She currently lives in Licapa, Paiján district, Ascope province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She has six children, one of whom is still dependent on her. The others are adults and help her with various expenses. Señora Elvia has three years of secondary education.

For a long time she has sold beauty products and with the profits she gradually bought merchandise such as clothing for adults, underwear etc. She has a market stall in the township of José Carlos Mariátegui- Licapa. She also delivers her products to her friends and neighbours who make weekly payments. In addition she sells herbal medicines.

She heard about the Manuela Ramos institution through the governor of Paiján who formed the Banco Comunal “Manos Unidos” where Elvia obtained her previous loan of S/. 1700.00. This loan was such a great help to her that she was able to invest in her business and earn some profits. A short while ago she used her savings to rent a plot of land where she has sown asparagus, a project that is still in progress.

She plans to pay back the S/. 1700.00 loan within four months. The money will be used to buy two containers of seeds and herbiciD. to be used as plant medicine. She is going to put in 20,000 seedlings. Her greatest dream is to have successful harvests and sell her produce to various factories.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elvia Domitila M. D. T. tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad - Perú; tiene 6 hijos, 1 depenD. D. ella, los demás ya son mayores y le ayudan a cubrir algunos gastos. La señora Elvia estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria.

Hace mucho tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta D. productos D. belleza y con las ganancias que le dejaba fue comprando poco a poco mercadería como ropa D. adulto, ropa interior, etc. ella tiene un puesto en el mercado del Asentamiento Humano José Carlos Mariátegui- Licapa aparte reparte su mercadería a sus vecinas y amistades para cobrar semanalmente también venD. medicina natural.

Se enteró D. la existencia D. Manuela Ramos por medio D. la Gobernadora D. Paiján; formó el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donD. obtuvo su anterior préstamo D. S/. 1700.00, el cual le fue D. mucha ayuda ya que pudo invertir en su negocio y D. esa manera tener utilidades con los cuales fue ahorrando hace poco rento un terreno en el que va ha sembrar espárrago, aun esta en proceso.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1700.00 para pagarlo en 4 meses comprará dos tarros D. semilla, yerbicida que sirve como medicina para las plantas y sembrar 20000 plantas. Su mayor sueño es tener un gran éxito con las cosechas, vender por las diferentes fabricas.

loans.use: Elvia will use the loan to buy agricultural products

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Señora Irene is 48 years old and has completed high school. She lives in the neighbourhood of Aurora Días, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department. Currently Señora Irene makes soft toys and cloth bags that she sells in the store located in her house. She also sells perfumes, gifts, ornaments etc. Formerly she was a housewife, but then she took a course offered in the local community hall. She decided to put into practice what she had learned.

With a former loan she obtained from the Banco Comunal “JERID – Camino al Éxito”, she bought the items necessary for making the soft toys: eyes, fabric, pearls etc, and some tools. Everything went well.

Irene will use this loan of S/. 1000.00 to travel to Lima to bring back clothing, kitchen items (cups, plates, glasses etc) and toys. She plans to pay back the loan within six months. Irene belongs to the mothers’ group “Purísima Concepción”. Her greatest dream is open a bookshop or a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irene tiene 48 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, vive en el sector Aurora Díaz del Distrito de Salaverry, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Actualmente la señora Irene se dedica a confeccionar peluches, carteras tejidas los cuales vende en la tienda que tiene en su domicilio a parte de eso vende perfumes, regalos, adornos, etc. Anteriormente ella solo se dedicaba a su hogar pero aprovecho un curso que dictaban en el comedor de su zona desde allí pone en practica lo aprendido.

Con su anterior préstamo que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “JERID – Camino al Éxito” compró el material que necesita para confeccionar los peluches como: ojitos, tela, rellenos, perlas, etc. y sus herramientas, el cual le ha ido muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 que cancelará en seis meses viajará a Lima para traer ropa, utensilios de cocina (tazas, platos, vasos, etc.) y juguetes.La señora Irene pertenece al club de madres “Purísima Concepción”, su mayor sueño es poner una librería o una tienda de ropa.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jessica Jackelin

texts.es:
Jessica Jackelin P. C. is 31 years old and she completed four years of high school. She has 2 school age children that depend on her. She lives in the township called “Aurora Diaz” in the Salaverry District, in the Province of Trujillo, in the Department of La Libertad.

She has turned her home’s living room into a small store where she sells groceries, vegetables, beer and soft drinks. She purchases all the products she sells from a wholesaler in the city of Trujillo because she is able to find the products at a lower price and is therefore able to increase her profit margin. She began her small business by selling calling cards and little by little was able to purchase groceries and expand her store.

Jessica is a partner in the communal bank called “Las Auroras en Acción.” Through this bank she was able to obtain her previous loan that she used to purchase basic products and and other products that have sold well due to the Christmas season.

With the S/.1,000.00 loan that she will repay within 6 months, she plans on buying groceries and school supplies to take advantage of the new school year.

Jessica dreams of expanding her business by selling clothing and gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jessica Jackelin P. C. tiene 31 años de edad, estudio hasta el cuarto año de secundaria. Tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano “Aurora Díaz” del Distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad.

Ha ambientado la sala de su casa para poner una pequeña tienda en la que vende abarrotes, verduras, cerveza y gaseosas. Todos los productos que vende los compra en un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo porque consigue los productos a menor precio lo que le permite tener mayor margen de utilidad. Su negocio se inicia primero con la venta de tarjetas telefónicas poco a poco fue comprando abarrotes y fue ampliando su bodega.

La señora Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” en este banco comunal obtuvo su anterior préstamo con el que compro productos de primera necesidad y panteones, el cual ha tenido muchas ventas por campaña navideña.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00 que cancelará en 6 meses comprará: abarrotes y útiles escolares ya que aprovechara la campaña de colegio.

La señora Jessica sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, desea vender ropa y regalos.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maura Eudelia

texts.es:
Maura Eudelia R. C. is 41 years old and she studied two years of high school. She has 3 children, but only one is dependent on her.

She lives in Chongoyape, in the district of Paiján, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

She began her business by selling soft drinks and sweets. Her neighbors wanted to purchase a variety of products which she did not carry so she decided to save, and with much effort was able to slowly build a store with an extensive supply of products. Currently, she carries a variety of products including basic products, soft drinks, beer and some desserts.

She obtained her first loan of S/.300.00 from the communal bank called “Manos Unidas” and bought 44 lbs of rice, 10 lbs of sugar, noodles and a “little bit of everything” to add variety to her store.

With the S/.1,000 loan that she will repay in 6 months, she plans on purchasing: one sack of rice and one of sugar, cooking oil, 10 cases of beer and some cases of soft drinks.

Maura Eudelia is the president of the Mother’s Club “Maria del Carmen.” Her biggest dream is to expand her business and have the resources to help her son get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maura Eudelia R. C. tiene 41 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos,pero solo uno aun depende de ella.

Vive en Chongoyape en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio lo empezó vendiendo un poco de gaseosas y golosinas, sus vecinos querían comprar otros productos pero no contaba con estos productos, decide ahorrar y con mucho esfuerzo poco a poco fue ambientando una bodega en la que cada día la fue surtiendo mas. Actualmente tiene variedad productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, cervezas y algunos postres.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” compro 20 kg. de arroz, 10 kg. de azúcar, fideos y de todo un poco para tener variedad en su bodega.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará: un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, aceite, 10 cajas de cerveza y algunas cajas de gaseosa.

La señora Maura Eudelia es presidenta del Club de madres “Maria del Carmen”, su mayor sueño es ampliar más su negocio y obtener más utilidades para sacar adelante a su hijo.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mahuna Lissekon Group

texts.fr:
This micro-project focuses on the conversion of palm nuts to palm oil. It was initiated by the all-female group MAHUNAN of LISSEKON, specifically in the commune of AKPRO MISSERETE. This group comprises 6 women who are very active workers. This dynamic group was created in 1995 and has been involved in this business since then. This micro-project will allow the group to increase its production capacity, to obtain higher profits, and to improve the living conditions of its members. Finally, the geographic situation of the commune is an asset for this type of business activity.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est initié par le groupement féminin MAHUNAN de LISSEKON précisément dans la commune D’AKPRO MISSERETE. Ce groupement compte 6 femmes qui sont très actives pour le travail. Il s’agit d’un groupement dynamique et crée depuis 1995 et exerce cette activité jusqu’aujourd’hui. Le micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager de bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres. Ainsi la situation géographique de la commune est un atout pour l’exercice de cette activité.

loans.use: To buy 10 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Antoinette A. is 32 years old and married. Her boutique is located in Adéta, Togo, a town about 150 kilometers from the capital. To make money, she purchases traditional skirts and kitchen utensils to resell. These are popular items and always in demand. This is Antoinette's first loan with FECECAV and with it she will be able to expand her stock selection and to see her business grow. She would like to use the loan to purchase more traditional style skirts and aluminum plates and bowls in the town of Lome which she will take back to Adéta to resell. She would appreciate the opportunity to improve her standard of living and to expand her business with this loan.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Antoinette A. est âgée de 32 ans et mariée. Sa boutique est localisée à Adéta, Togo, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de la capitale. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle achète les pagnes et les ustensiles de cuisines pour revendre. Ces produits sont populaires et toujours demandés. Ce crédit est le premier pour Antoinette à FECECAV et elle attend d’être capable d’augmenter son stock et d’agrandir son entreprise. Elle désire utiliser l’argent pour acheter plus de pagnes, d’assiettes et des bols en aluminium de Lomé pour revendre à Adéta. Elle apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie avec l’agrandissement de son entreprise.

loans.use: To purchase more traditional skirts and aluminum plates and bowls.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy A. is 31 years old, she is currently majoring in accounting at one of the local universities in the city of Trujillo.

She lives in Chongoyape, district of Paiján, province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

Her business began with the sale of women’s and men’s clothing and she received orders from neighbors and acquaintances. She frequently traveled to the city of Lima to bring back exclusive wholesale merchandise. Later she began selling beauty products for the cosmetic line “L´ebel,” with time she has become well-known and has many customers.

She is part of the communal bank “Manos Unidas” where she obtained her first loan of S./300.00with this money she purchased clothing at wholesale prices.

With the S./300.00 loan that she will repay in 6 months, she plans on buying beauty products to complete some orders and have products in stock.

Her ultimate dream is to successfully finish her professional schooling and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy A. tiene 31 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de contabilidad en una de las universidades de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Vive en Chongoyape, Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio empezó con la venta de ropa para dama y caballeros, tenia pedidos de vecinos y conocidos, constantemente viajaba a la ciudad de Lima para traer modelos exclusivos al por mayor. Posteriormente se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de productos “L´ebel”, con el tiempo se ha hecho conocida y tiene mucha clientela.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro ropa al por mayor.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará productos de belleza para cubrir algunos pedidos y para tener en stock.

Su mayor sueño es terminar con éxito su carrera profesional y tener su propio negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy Chávez García is 39 years old and lives in a township called Aurora Diaz in the Salaverry District, in the Province of Trujillo, in the Department of La Libertad. She completed her third year of high school and has 2 children that depend on her.

Nancy prepares and sells lunch and during the summer she sells gelatin desserts and other products outside her house. She has also built a pool in her yard that she rents to children in her neighborhood who are looking for summer entertainment.

Nancy is one of the founding partners of the communal bank “Las Auroras en Acción” and was one of the most diligent in gathering women to form the communal bank.

The loan she obtained was very useful because she invested her money in pool repairs so that she can run the pool during the summer. Thanks to the loan her business has done well.

With the S/.1,300 loan that she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy basic products and more ingredients for her lunch business that is part of the Mother’s Club “Purisima Concepción.” She is very happy that she has been able to serve her community.

Nancy’s big dream is to set up her own restaurant where she can serve breakfast and lunch.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy Chávez García tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el sector llamado Aurora Díaz del Distrito de Salaverry, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

La señora Nancy prepara y vende almuerzo, también en tiempo de verano vende marcianos y gelatina afuera de su casa. Además ha construido una piscina en el patio de su domicilio en el que alquila a los niños de su barrio que deseen divertirse en verano.

La señora Nancy es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” fue la más empeñosa en reunir a otras mujeres para formar el banco comunal.

El préstamo que obtuvo le fue de mucha utilidad ya que lo invirtió para reparar su piscina de algunas imperfecciones, el cual le serviría para trabajarlo en verano. Gracias a eso le ha ido muy bien en su negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/.1, 300 que pagará en seis meses comprara productos de primera necesidad y demás ingredientes para cocinar para el comedor al que pertenece “Purísima Concepción” ,se siente muy contenta de poder servir a su comunidad.

La señora Nancy tiene un gran sueño es poner su propio restaurante en el que ofrezca desayunos y almuerzo.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase ingredients to make her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nancy Azucena

texts.es:
Nancy is 43 years old, and she finished secondary school. She has four children, but only three of them still depend on her.

Thanks to having taken courses in cosmetology she was able to start her first business. She installed a beauty salon in her house, located in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, in L. Libertad. After this, she dedicated herself to making nets, and idea that came to her through her husband’s fishing. Currently, Nancy conducts both activities, but has put more of her focus on her handmade fishing nets.

With her previous loan, obtained in the group “Las Auroras en Acción”, she bought the necessary materials to make her nets and it has gone well for her as they are in constant demand.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, to be repaid in six months, she will buy mesh, thread, cable, and lead to make nets of various sizes.

Nancy is a member of the “Purisima Concecion”, and dreams of having the biggest boat to give to her husband so he can attain a larger catch to offer at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

L. señora Nancy tiene 43 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene un total de 4 hijos pero solo 3 dependen de elL.. Gracias a que tomo cursos de cosmetología pudo iniciar su primer negocio colocó una pequeña peluquería en su casa ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo departamento L. Libertad, después de eso se dedica a L. confección de redes por idea de su esposo que se dedica a L. pesca; actualmente L. señora Nancy se dedica a las dos cosas pero le ha puesto mayor énfasis a L. red artesanal. Con su anterior crédito que obtuvo en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Auroras en Acción” compró todos los materiales necesarios para elaborar redes y le ha ido muy bien ya que le solicitan siempre. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 el cual será cancelado en seis meses comprará redes, hilos, cabo, plomo para L. fabricación de las redes de diferentes tamaños. L. señora Nancy es socia del club de madres “Purisima Concepcion”, sueña con tener un bote mas grande para dárselo a su esposo de manera que obtenga mayor pesca para ofrecerlos al mercado.

loans.use: Purchase mesh, thread, cable, etc., to make fishing nets.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Marilu

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Marilú R. D. O. is 34 years old and finished school up to the sixth graD.. She has four children, three of whom still depend on her. She lives in Chongoyape in the Paijan district of the Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú.

Her business began with the raising of small animals such as pigs, roosters and chickens, and she later incorporated into her enterprise the sale of beauty products ordered by her friends and acquaintances. Currently, she sells animals at the Paijan market and she also offers her catalog products.

With her first loan of S/. 300.00 obtained from the communal bank “Manos Unidas” she bought well-balanced feed for her animals.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, to be repaid in six months, she will buy beauty products to have in stock and to pay for her orders.

Her biggest dream is to open a store from which she could offer her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Marilú R. D. O. tiene 34 años D. edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado D. primaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero tres aun dependen D. ella. Vive en Chongoyape en el distrito D. Paijan en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio se inicio con la crianza D. animales menores como chanchos, gallinas y pollos, posteriormente se incorporo al negocio D. la venta D. productos D. belleza le hacen pedio sus amigos y conocidos. Actualmente venD. animales por el mercado D. Paijan así también ofrece sus productos D. catálogo. Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” compro alimento balanceado como alimento D. sus animales. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará productos D. belleza para tener en stock y para pagar sus pedidos. Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda en la que allí pueda ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Rossy Paola

texts.es:
Mrs. Rossy Paola P. L. is 27 years old and has a high school education. She has one dependent child and they live in the Aurora Díaz neighborhood of Salaverry, located in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru.

Rossy started her business by selling undergarments to friends and acquaintances and later a friend suggested that she also go and sell in Viru, located about 50 minutes from the city of Trujillo. She sold items made of plastic including tubs, buckets, strainers and ladles. Now she cooks in the mornings and sells the food to her neighbors. Also, in the afternoons she sells items like costume jewelry and hair barrettes in the streets, in addition to making porridge.

Rossy is a member of the “Jerid – Camino al Exito” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan. With that money she traveled to the city of Trujillo to buy undergarments at the wholesale market. With this loan of $450, which she plans to repay in six months, she will buy all of the provisions necessary to prepare different stews. She will also invest in the construction of her house where she will create space to install a kiosk from which to sell her products. Her greatest dream is to open a restaurant in the center of Puerto Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rossy Paola P. L. tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio empezó con la venta de ropa interior por su vecindario, le hacían diversos pedidos sus conocidos y amigos, posteriormente una amiga le recomienda ir a vender a la provincia de Viru a unos 50 minutos aproximadamente de la ciudad de Trujillo, ofrecía material plástico como tinas, baldes, coladores y cucharones. Actualmente prepara comida por las mañanas y ofrece a sus vecinos. Así también por las tardes sale de sus casa para ofrecer por las calles joyas de fantasía collets, ganchos de pelo, etc. Además de preparar mazamorra. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Jerid – Camino al Éxito” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero viajo a la ciudad de Trujillo para comprar ropa interior al por mayor en el mercado Mayorista. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual pagara en seis meses, comprará todos los víveres necesarios para preparar diferentes potajes, además invertirá en la construcción de su casa en donde ambientara un espacio para instalar un kiosco en el que venda sus productos. Su mayor sueño es poner un restaurante en el centro de Puerto Salaverry.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Rodríguez D. Gutiérrez is 62 years old and has a second graD. education. Of her nine children, three are still dependents. She lives in Saucipe, located in the Paijan district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Peru.

35 years ago she started what today continues to be her business. She raises chickens and ducks which, after becoming the ideal size, she sells in the market in Paijan and to her neighbors who place their orders ahead of time. Besides that, in her free time she makes sweaters, rugs, bedspreads and tablecloths.

Santos is a member of the “Manos Unidas” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan which she used to buy well-balanced food for her animals. With this loan of $425, which she plans to repay in six months, she will buy 20 newborn chickens and ducks along with food, supplements, medicine and vitamins to nourish and strengthen the birds. Her biggest dream is to build a farm with all the implements and a larger number of birds.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Santos Rodríguez D. Gutiérrez tiene 62 años D. edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene en total nueve hijos pero solo tres aun dependen D. ella.Vive en Saucipe en el distrito D. Paijan en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad- Perú. Hace 35 años que se inicio en el que actualmente sigue siendo su negocio. Se dedica a la crianza D. pollo y patos el cual después D. haber adquirido el tamaño ideal lleva a vender por el mercado D. Paijan y por su vecindario el cual le hacen pedidos anticipadamente. Además en el tiempo que le queda libre teje chompas, tapetes, colchas y manteles. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro alimento balanceado para sus animales. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1100.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará 20 pollos y 20 patos recién nacidos, un saco y medio D. crecimiento, engorD., medicina y vitaminas para nutrir y fortalecer a las aves. Su mayor sueño es construir una granja con todos los implementos y una cantidad mayor D. aves.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and ducks along with food and supplements for them

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 45140

loans.name: Ayidego Ahouandji Group

texts.fr:
The group AYIDEGO was created in 1992 in the small village of LISSEKON. It specializes in the conversion of palm nuts and manioc. It is composed of 5 dynamic women who work to improve their quality of life through wealth-bringing initiatives and the creation of revenue-generating business activities. They are asking for a loan of 400,000 francs ($975), which will allow them to buy 8 tonnes of palm nuts. This loan will allow the members of the group to increase their production capacity and improve their quality of life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement AYIDEGO est crée en 1992 dans le petit village de LISSEKON. Il est spécialisé dans la transformation de noix de palme et du manioc. Il est composé de 5 femmes dynamiques qui oeuvrent pour l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie à travers des initiatives porteuses de richesse et de création d’activités génératrices de revenus. Le crédit sollicité est d’un montant de 400 000 francs et permettra d’acheter 8 tonnes de noix de palme. Ce financement permettra aux membres de renforcer leur capacité de production et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy 8 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Mikpamahu Ahouandji Group

texts.fr:
MIKPAMAHU AHOUNDJI is a group involved in the conversion of palm nuts into palm oil. It is composed of 4 women who have been working together since 1996 in the village of AHOUANDJI. This group has developed a micro-project to transform 4 tonnes of palm nuts into oil, a plan which has been submitted to our micro finance institution. The financing of this micro-project will allow this group to increase its production capacity and improve the living conditions of its members.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

MIKPAMAHU AHOUANDJI est un groupement de transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme. Composé de 4 femmes, elles travaillent ensemble depuis 1996 dans le village de AHOUANDJI. Ce groupement a élaboré un micro projet de transformation de 4 tonnes de noix de palme en huile de palme qu’il a soumis à notre institution de micro finance. Le financement de ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production de ce groupement et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres.

loans.use: To buy 4 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es:
Sheila is 34 years old and lives in the Miguel Gutiérrez neighborhood of Managua with her artist/painter husband and three children from a prior marriage. She and her husband have been together for a few months – a second chance for this young woman.

Sheila works very hard to take care of her house and has the support of the father of her children. For 13 years she has operated a business selling clothing and shoes. She caters to her clients in her home and at their houses. If her clients are interested in purchasing her products, she offers them easy payments. Sheila is requesting a loan to increase her working capital – she needs to buy wholesale clothes for her business.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Sheila, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la colonia Miguel Gutiérrez junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos producto de su primer matrimonio, su esposo es un artista Pintor y tienen algunos meses de estar juntos en esta segunda oportunidad que esta joven mujer se está dando.

Ella trabaja muy fuerte para mantener su casa y recibe el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, desde hace 13 años tiene un negocio propio de venta de ropa y zapatos, atiende a su clientela en su casa y a domicilio, si las personas se interesean por sus productos les ofrece facilidades de pagos. Solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo, necesita comprar ropa al por mayor para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale clothes for her business

loans.name: Edjromede Tchian Group

texts.fr:
In the struggle against poverty, our micro-finance institution works to help groups or people wanting to improve their living conditions. Among these groups, we have been particularly impressed by the group EDJROMEDE of TCHIAN. This group has existed for 2 years and converts palm nuts into palm oil. They have access to the network of palm nut cultivators, which allows them to obtain a supply of nuts easily. This group is in need of a loan of 880,000 francs ($2125) to buy 17.6 tonnes of palm nuts in order to produce oil and related products, which are sold on site or in the local markets. Out institution has a strong interest in these women.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, notre institution de micro finance s’emploie à aider des groupements ou personnes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie. Au nombre de ces groupements nous avons été particulièrement impressionné par le groupement EDJROMEDE de TCHIAN. Ce groupement existe depuis 2 ans et fait la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme. Il est en réseau avec les producteurs de noix de palme ce qui lui permet de s’approvisionner facilement. Ce groupement a besoin d’un crédit de 880 000 francs pour l’achat de 17,6 tonnes de noix de palme pour produire l’huile et produits dérivés qui sont vendus sur place ou dans le marché de la localité. Ces femmes suscitent un grand intérêt pour notre institution.

loans.use: To buy 17.6 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Vivoten Lissekon Group

texts.fr:
This project focuses on converting palm nuts into palm oil. It is the initiative of the all-woman group Vivoten de Lissekon. This is a very motivated group made up of seven members who have been working together for over 10 years. They have benefitted from one loan through the Income-Generating Activities Project (PAGER), which they finished repaying five years ago. They are located in an area where there is no microfinance institution to offer them help. Accordingly, this funding will help them produce 900 liters of oil so that they may record a profit and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le présent projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin VIVOTEN de LISSEKON. C’est un groupement très motivé composé de 7 membres qui travaillent ensemble depuis plus de 10 ans. Ils ont bénéficié une fois du crédit par le biais du projet PAGER qui est venu à terme il y a 5 ans. Ils sont dans une localité où il n’existe aucune institution de micro finance pouvant les accompagner. Ainsi, ce financement va les aider à produire 900 litres d’huile afin de dégager un bénéfice pour améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy 7.2 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis is a very enterprising mother, happy and modest at heart. Since her daughter was born, she had in mind only the idea of going forward together with the person who arrived in this world to fill her life with happiness . So it is that, with much greater reason and force, she decided to dedicate herself to the purchase and sale of seasonal fruits, taking advantage of the tranquility of her business. In addition to this work, she decided to dedicate herself to crafts, beautiful knitted sweaters and vests made by hand that, after finishing them, she offers to her neighbors, friends and family members. The desire that this diligent and loving mother holds in her heart is to offer her young daughter and opportunity to study so that, in the future, she can be a professional with a future promissory . With this dream in mind, Gertrudis tries to put forth her best effort and exert herself in her everyday tasks, now with her eye on the income she makes through her business of commercialization of fruits. She has in mind increasing the variety of her merchandise; it is because of that that she turns to you to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

Gertrudis, es una madre muy emprendedora, alegre y humilde de corazón, desde que nació su niña solo tenía en mente salir adelante junto a la persona que llegó a este mundo para llenar su vida de alegría y dicha, es así que con mucha más razón decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de frutas por temporadas, aprovechando la tranquilidad de su negocio adicionalmente a esta labor decidió dedicarse a la artesanía, tejido de hermosas chompas y chalecos en forma manual que luego de terminarlas los ofrece a sus vecinos, amistades y familiares.El deseo que alberga en su corazón esta diligente y amorosa madre es brindarle estudios a su pequeña niña, para que en el futuro pueda ser profesional con un porvenir promisorio.Con ese anhelo en mente doña Gertrudis trata de poner su mayor esfuerzo y empeño en sus labores cotidianas, ahora viendo los ingresos que está obteniendo con su negocio de comercialización de tunas; tiene pensado aumentar la variedad de su mercadería, es por ello que recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: An increase in capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi B. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. To earn some money for meeting family needs, she makes food and sells it to people. She is a specialist in making traditional foods, such as "pâte" and "foufou" that are consumed by many. She cooks in Adèta, a city located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Ms. B. hopes to buy yams to make foufou, corn to make pâte, and animals (agouti, goats, chickens, and sheep) and fish to make sauce. She is on her third loan since the second has been paid back, and she got the loan for the business for which the request was made. By meeting customer demands and thus clearing a larger profit, she is able to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Essi B. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle prépare de la nourriture revend à la population. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation des aliments traditionnels tels que la pâte et le foufou qui sont consommés par de nombreuses populations. Elle prépare à Adèta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce crédit, madame B. Essi espère acheter des ignames pour faire foufou, le maïs pour faire la pâte et les bêtes ( agouti, chèvres, poulets et moutons ) et les poissons pour faire la sauce. Elle est à son troisième crédit puisque le deuxième a été bien remboursé et elle a affecté le crédit à l’activité pour laquelle la demande était faite. Pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits elle peut améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make restaurant meals

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 50 years old and lives in Ticuantepe, an area outside Managua that is known for agricultural production. He lives with his wife, who works as a cook, and their son, who is pursuing his studies.

Francisco works in agriculture and fruit sales. For 19 years he has planted 2.5 manzanas (more than 4 acres) of pineapple. His experience has helped him improve his product. He is requesting a loan to buy the supplies his crops need to remain healthy. Because of the high cost of these products, he has always bought them using credit and, in doing so, has ensured a good harvest. The harvest in turn allows him to pay back the money he has borrowed.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Don Francisco de 50 años de edad, habita en Ticuantepe, un fresco lugar de características agrícolas, vive acompañado de su señora quien trabaja como cocinera, y un hijo quien aun se encuentra estudiando.

Don Francisco se dedica a la Agricultura y el comercio de frutas, siembra 2 ½ manzanas de piña desde hace 19 años, su gran experiencia le ha ayudado a ir mejorando su producto. Solicita un crédito para comprar los insumos que su cosecha necesita para mantenerse sana, por el alto costo de éstos siempre los ha comprado por medio de créditos y así ha garantizado su cosecha; y su cosecha a la vez garantiza el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies to maintain a healthy pineapple crop

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is a native of the district of Capachica. As long as she has been situated in the city of Juliaca she has dedicated herself to numerous activities to generate income and so help her husband with the household expenses. Some years ago, with extreme dedication and diligence, she decided to open her small grocery store, which is a very competitive store due to the variety of products that it offers. She was feeling quite content because everything was going well with her business and her family life; unfortunately, however, several months ago, she suffered the terrible loss of the youngest of her two daughters. This fact caused this mother to feel a great heartache and deception, but now she is trying to overcome and rise above this difficult situation. It is because of this that she has been thinking about the well-being of her only daughter, Luz Delia, and of her beloved spouse and has decided to start over with big plans for her family and her business. With this goal in mind, Flora turns to you to request a loan. She is certain that your generosity will help to turn her dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

Flora es natural del distrito de Capachica, desde que radica en la ciudad de Juliaca se ha dedicado a innumerables actividades para generar ingresos económicos y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, hace algunos años con suma dedicación y diligencia decidió abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, tiendita muy concurrida por la variedad de productos que ofrece.Se sentía muy contenta porque todo marchaba bien en su negocio y vida familiar, pero desafortunadamente hace algunos meses sufrió la penosa pérdida de la menor de sus dos hijas, este hecho hizo que esta madre sintiera un gran dolor y decepción, pero ahora trata de superar y sobre llevar esta difícil situación, es por ello que ha pensando en el bienestar de su única niña Luz Delia y de su querido esposo y decidió empezar de nuevo con grandes planes para su familia y su negocio.Con esa aspiración en mente Flora recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo, está segura que vuestro generoso aporte cristalizará sus anhelos.

loans.use: An injection of capital to promote her small grocery store and reinforce her work.

loans.name: Rosalina Fernando

texts.en:
Rosalina is 39 years old and originally from Manjacaze in the Gaza Province. She has been married since 1994 and has 5 children: a 21-year-old girl, a 18-year-old boy, a 16-year-old boy, a 14-year-old boy and a 3-year-old girl. All her four oldest children are attending secondary school.

Rosalina didn’t complete primary school. She studied until 6th grade and stopped when she got pregnant. At that time, Rosalina left Manjacaze and went to the capital city Maputo to live with her older brother. A couple of years later, she met her future husband who was already living in Namaacha, the village bordering Swaziland where she still lives nowadays.

In 1990 Rosalina started to sell pots and pans at the Namaacha open market, an informal market that is opened twice per week: Wednesdays and Saturdays. Rosalina works at her own stand from 7:00am to 4:00pm. Rosalina makes around MTn 300 per day, and in the end of the month, when people have more money to shop, she can make up to MTn 500 in one day. Rosalina does not count on the help of employees; she buys her merchandize in Maputo and sells at the market on her own. Rosalina is able to save around MTn 500 per month after paying all her expenses and the schools fees.

Rosalina heard about Hluvuku during a conversation with some friends at the market. Her first loan of MTn 8,200 was paid ahead of the scheduled term and without difficulties. This second loan of MTn 15,000 will also be used to buy merchandise and increase the level of inventory at her stand. Rosalina intends to buy larger pots that are more expensive and that she was never able to buy due to capital constraints.

In the future Rosalina would like to open a store where she would be able to sell her pots every day of the week and consequently increase her monthly income.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora is a very happy and enterprising mother dedicated to her family, from a very young age she has been selling cosmetic products. She has become one of the most beloved and popular persons inside her environment. This is why she found in this business the way of generating an extra income to support her husband with the expenses of her home. At present, thanks to her patience, warmth and especially to her persuasive gift for sales, she has managed to obtain big quantity of orders. Now seeing that some beauty cosmetics are on sale or have good credit terms, Nora wants to acquire them to have them in stock, in order to be able to sell them at any time and this way increase her sales, but she doesn’t have the sufficient budget to carry out her plans. With this project in mind Nora is asking for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora, es una madre muy alegre, emprendedora y consagrada a su familia, desde muy joven estuvo dedicada a la venta de productos cosméticos, convirtiéndose en una de las personas más queridas y populares dentro de su entorno, es así que encontró en este negocio la manera de generar ingresos extras para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente, gracias a su paciencia, cordialidad y sobre todo a su don persuasivo para las ventas, está logrando obtener gran cantidad de pedidos, ahora viendo las facilidades y las ofertas con las que llegan algunos cosméticos de belleza Nora desea adquirirlos para tenerlos en stock, a fin de poder venderlos al instante y así aumentar sus ventas, pero no cuenta con suficiente presupuesto para concretar sus planes. Con este proyecto en mente Nora recurre a ti persona para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase her working capital to acquire a bigger quantity of products.

loans.name: Ruth Belina

texts.es:
Ms. Ruth L. is 46 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. She is single and has two grown children who work in the tax-free economic development zones and help her out financially. She has managed to provide a better life for her children by selling homemade food and nacatamales (traditional Nicaraguan tamales) on the weekends for the last 30 years.

Now that she no needs to take care of her children, Ruth would like to open a small café. She is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs for making food and nacatamales. (Nacatamales are a typical dish in Nicaragua that many families eat on the weekends.) Her current food sales help cover her expenses, but she doesn’t want to rely on her children anymore and has always liked to work.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Doña Ruth L., de 46 años de edad, habita en Laureles Norte, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos mayores que trabajan en Zonas Francas y le ayudan económicamente. Sacó a sus hijos adelante vendiendo durante 30 años comida casera y Nacatamales los fines de semana.

Ahora que no tiene más obligación con sus hijos quiere poner un cafetín. Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos de alimentos para elaborar sus comidas y nacatamales que es un plato típico de nuestro país el cual muchas familias acostumbran comer los fines de semana, con esta venta esta señora se ayuda en sus gastos ya que no quiere ser carga de sus hijos y siempre le ha gustado trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for preparing food

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Madame Jeanne P. is 38 years old and married. She operates a hair salon in Adèta, a city located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She styles hair, does braids, and washes the hair of many women in town. Her hair salon is very popular in this city. For this reason, she wants this loan to enlarge her beauty shop. With this first loan in particular, she wants to buy beauty products (hair extensions, weaves, wigs, liquid soap, etc….) in order to meet customer needs. She has tried her luck to improve her life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Jeanne P. est âgée de 38 ans et mariée. Elle opère en salon de coiffure à Adèta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle coiffe, tresse et lave les cheveux de beaucoup de femmes dans la localité. Son salon de coiffure est très populaire dans cette ville. Pour cette raison, elle désire ce crédit pour agrandir son établissement de beauté. Spécialement avec ce premier crédit, elle veut acheter les produits de beauté (mèches, tissages, perruques, savons liquides etc.…) afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle a tenté sa chance pour améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady B., age 59, is married and the mother of six children, one of whom she is looking after, in addition to her grandson. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne in Ziguinchor for six and half years. She buys "boubou thioub" (traditional dyed cloth), gems, and shoes in Ndiassane and Dakar, and she resells them in Ziguinchor. With her income, she helps to support her family. Khady has always honored her commitments. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Khady B., 59 ans, mariée, mère de 06 enfants dont 01 en charge en plus de son petit fils est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle achète des boubous thioub (boubous en tissus teintés), bijoux et chaussures à Ndiassane et Dakar et les revend à Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Khady a toujours respecté ses engagements. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy boubous thioub and shoes for retail sale

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino has a small electronics workshop, he works with his younger brother who assists him and who is also studying information technology. His brother’s help and knowledge will help Faustino offer a better service to his clients by implementing his know-how. Faustino is single, lives with his brother in the Zona de Rio Seco of the Ciudad de El Alto The loan will be destined to buy a computer, which will be used as a working tool for the workshop. This is the second loan for Faustino with Kiva ,the evaluation carried out qualifies him to have the loan approved.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Faustino posee un pequeño taller de electromecánica, trabaja con su hermano menor que le sirve de ayudante y esta estudiando computación, de esa manera brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementará sus conocimientos. Faustino es soltero, vive con su hermano en la Zona de Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El monto del crédito será destinado para comprar una computadora, la cual será usada como herramienta de trabajo en el taller. Este es el segundo crédito de Faustino con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar la solicitud de préstamo del cliente.

loans.use: To Buy a Computer

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta D., age 51, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne in Ziguinchor for four and half years. She buys cloth and shoes in Ndiassane to resell them in Ziguinchor. With her income, she helps her husband take care of family-related needs, such as schooling the children. Binta want to build up her business. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Binta D., 51 ans, marié, mère de 03 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne à Ziguinchor depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle achète des tissus et des chaussures à Ndiassane pour les revendre à Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille comme la scolarité des enfants. Binta veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 62 years old, and this is why many institutions do not want to offer him a line of credit. But Carlos is in good health and has all the desires to continue working. His main source of income is in the transportation sector. Carlos has a vehicle with which he travels through the area between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. Is with this activity that Carlos supports his two children and wife, their home is located in the Zona Exaltación of the City of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his car and buy new tires. This is Carlos’s second loan with Impro, the evaluation carried out qualifies him to have the loan approved.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 62 años de edad, por esa razón muchas instituciones no quieren otorgarle un crédito. Pero Carlos esta en perfecto estado de salud y tiene toda las ganas de seguir trabajando, su principal fuente de ingreso es el transporte, tiene un vehículo con el que recorre el tramo entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto. Con dicha actividad mantiene a sus dos hijos y esposa, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Exaltación de la Ciudad de El Alto. El monto del crédito será destinado para comprar un motor nuevo y cambiar los neumáticos del vehículo. Este es el segundo crédito de Carlos en Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance of vehicle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy is a merchant of cereals and delicacies, products that she sells in the zone 12 de October of the city of El Alto. Her husband has a store of lubricants located in the Zona Cosmos 79 of the same city, these are the activities that generate the income for this couple. This income is mainly used to support their children who currently study at the Universidad Estatal. The loan will be destined to buy wholesale merchandise and therefore, meet the demand for cereals and delicacies. This will be the tenth loan for the couple with Impro and the second with Kiva, their on-time repayments and bona fide behavior allow the approval of another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucy es comerciante de cereales y golosinas, productos que ella comercializa en la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto. Su esposo tiene su tienda de lubricantes de su domicilio ubicado en la Zona Cosmos 79 de la misma ciudad, dichas actividades son las fuentes de ingreso principales de este matrimonio, las cuales cubren la manutención de los dos hijos que cursan estudios en la Universidad Estatal. El crédito será destinado para comprar mercadería al por mayor y satisfacer la demanda de cereales y golosinas. Este el décimo crédito de la pareja en Impro y el segundo con Kiva, el buen comportamiento y la fidelidad de ambos clientes permite la aprobación de otro préstamo.

loans.use: To Purchase Whosale Merchandise

loans.name: Sante Se Riches Group

texts.en:
Paulin lives in Trou du Nord, Haiti with her four children (ages: 10, 12, 14, 16). With this loan, Paulin wants to buy fish to sell from a small wooden stand on the street. Over the past couple of weeks, there has been increased distress in Haiti because of continually increasing food prices. Paulin said that she will use her profits solely to feed herself and her children. Her goals for the future are to continue sending her children to school and to have her own house.

Esperanza would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders that will support these men and women, and we look forward to watching them grow as individuals and as a community. God Bless!

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell on the street and in the local market.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni is a hard-working, enterprising young woman and very friendly. Since she was a young girl, she felt a big desire to have her own cosmetic center where she tries to highlight the presence and beauty of the persons who request her cosmetician's services. She started taking care of the people nearest to her, but after her relatives and friends saw how she was a perfectionist, extremely dedicated and patient, urged her to open her own beauty salon. At present after observing the limited space of her beauty salon and the big quantity of clients, she wants to extend and to implement her services for major serviceability. For this she needs a loan of $300, money that she will invest in buying beauty supplies to start implementing her services. You can make this happen!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Yeni es una joven hacendosa, emprendedora y muy amical, desde niña sintió un gran deseo de poseer su propio centro cosmético en donde trata de resaltar la presencia y belleza de las personas que solicitan sus servicios de cosmetóloga. Inició atendiendo a las personas más cercanas a ella, pero al ver que era sumamente detallista dedicada y paciente sus familiares y amigos la animaron a abrir su salón de belleza. Actualmente observando el reducido espacio de su salón y la gran cantidad de clientes que posee tiene pensado ampliar e implementar sus servicios para mayor comodidad, para ello requiere obtener un préstamo por el monto de 800.00 soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de artículos de belleza para terminar de implementar sus servicios. En tus manos está posibilitar su petición.

loans.use: Have a working capital to improve her beauty salon.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45160

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Mrs Clemencia has always stood out for the talent that she has in her hands. She makes the most beautiful and fine works of embroidery in thread or laces depending on the requests of her clients. This talent that characterizes her, has in fact made each one of her works be very well valued, requested and recognized in her hometown of Juliaca. Thanks to the profits from this work, she is managing to support without limitations her dear family, and at the same time she has the satisfaction of seeing the happy faces of her clients with the final work that she offers them. Now with the big quantity of requests of her products, she needs to acquire raw materials to keep on embroidering her beautiful banners, pennants and other decorations with extreme patience and fine applications that only Mrs Clemencia can do. With your valuable contribution Mrs Clemencia will keep on making the most beautiful works.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Clemencia, siempre se destacó por el talento que posee en las manos, ya que realiza finos y hermosísimos trabajos de bordado en hilo y encajes de acuerdo a las solicitudes que le plantean sus clientes. Este talento que la caracteriza a hecho de que cada uno de sus obras sean muy bien valoradas, solicitadas y reconocidas en su ciudad natal Juliaca, gracias a las ganancias que obtiene con este trabajo está logrando mantener sin limitaciones a su querida familia, al mismo tiempo tiene la satisfacción de ver los rostros complacientes de sus clientes con el trabajo final que les ofrece. Ahora con la gran cantidad de solicitudes doña Clemencia requiere adquirir materia prima para seguir bordando sus preciosos estandartes, banderines y demás decoraciones con suma paciencia y finas aplicaciones como solo doña Clemencia suele hacerlo.Con vuestro indispensable aporte doña Clemencia seguirá realizando hermosísimos trabajos.

loans.use: Increase working capital to buy a bigger quantity of raw materials.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45161

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda is a very popular and enterprising lady. Since she was a young girl, she has always tried to generate her own income to support her humble parents with the expenses of her home. So after she concluded her secondary studies she decided to work selling seasonal products. Now, for this season she is selling a big variety of gifts for weddings. She buys the products wholesale in the city of Tacna and she sells them in the city of Juliaca and other bordering little towns. Thanks to this small business she is managing to cover her basic needs and at the same time, support economically her dear parents. Gumercinda has many plans with her business and she is certain that with your support she will be able to increase her working capital and increase her profits in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana GabrieL. Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Gumercinda es una dama muy popular y emprendedora, desD. niña siempre ha tratado D. generar sus propios ingresos para apoyar a sus humildes padres con los gastos D. su hogar, es así que cuando concluyó sus estudios secundarios decidió dedicarse a L. venta D. productos por campañas. Ahora, por esta temporada oferta una gran variedad D. regalos para matrimonios, mercadería que trae al por mayor D. L. ciudad D. Tacna y ofrece en L. ciudad D. Juliaca y demás pueblitos aledaños, gracias a este pequeño negocio está logrando cubrir sus necesidades primarias y al mismo tiempo apoyar económicamente a sus queridos padres.Gumercinda tiene muchos planes con su negocio y está segura que con tu apoyo podrá aumentar el monto D. inversión e incrementar sus beneficios en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase of working capital to be able to offer a bigger quantity of products.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Balbina is 23 years old. She is a young woman who has just formed her family with a big desire of progress and she wants to offer the best in herself in order to improve her living conditions and being able to offer tranquility and well-being to the children that she wants to have. Now, she decided to work creating handycrafts, using the valuable knowledge that her mother taught her. She makes beautiful chullos (Peruvian Andean hats), gloves and scarves that are sold wholesale in the market San Jose of the city of Juliaca. Recently, after noticing the increase in the demand of her products, Bablina decided to extend and increase the variety of her production, but she still doesn’t have enough working capital to invest in raw materials. Let’s help Balbina make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Balbina de 23 años de edad, es una muchacha que acaba de formar su familia con muchas ilusiones de progreso y brindar lo mejor de sí para mejorar su condición de vida y ofrecer tranquilidad y bienestar a los hijos que desea tener. Ahora plasmando los valiosos conocimientos que su madre inculcó en ella decidió dedicarse a la artesanía, y elabora hermosos chullos, guantes y chalinas que son vendidos al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca, hace poco observando la cantidad de solicitudes Balbina decidió ampliar y aumentar la variedad de su producción, pero aún no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir en materia prima. Solidaricémonos con Balbina para concretar sus planes, vuestro importante aporte permitirá cristalizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Increase of working capital to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a very young man who already has the responsibility of supporting a family of four members who depend on his handcrafted work. He has been manufacturing carpets and blankets for the past 5 years. They have a lot demand and he commercializes them in the area where he lives. Due to the pressing needs that Víctor and his family are going through, has led him to offer his products in the capital of his country. He has noticed that the demand and the selling prices are higher in this city according to the innovation of his products. He has in mind to increase his working capital to obtain a bigger profit and to stabilize the economy of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor, es una persona muy joven que tiene ya la responsabilidad de mantener una familia de cuatro miembros los cuales dependen de su trabajo artesanal, desde hace 5 años viene dedicándose a la fabricación de tapices y mantas de mucha demanda y muy comercializadas en la zona que habita. Las duras necesidades que atraviesa Víctor en su familia lo ha llevado a tener que ofertar sus productos en la capital de su país, ha observado que la acogido y costo en esta ciudad se incrementa de acuerdo a la novedad de sus productos y tiene en mente incrementar su capital de trabajo para obtener mayores ganancias y estabilizar la economía de su querido hogar.

loans.use: Increase working capital to be able to increase his production.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45164

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a very active woman and worries about making her business successful which is why she dedicates the majority of her day to making weavings and mantles which reflect the area where she was born. These products are highly sought after by tourists all throughout Peru. For more than 10 years, Rosa has dedicated herself to this work thanks to the teachings of her parents who provided her with all that was necessary for her to perform and succeed in this work. She wishes to increase her production and to take her products to Lima and other places near her town. She has also thought of installing a small sale space in the town square during festival days when the number of visitors increases.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.
