ROSA, es una dama muy activa y preocupada por hacer de su trabajo un negocio próspero y por ello se dedica el mayor tiempo de sus días a elaborar tapices y diversas mantas típicas de la zona donde nació y productos que son muy solicitados en los alrededores del Perú por los turistas.Desde hace más de 10 años, Rosa, se dedica a esta labor gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres quienes le otorgaron lo necesario para poder trabajar y desempeñarse en esta labor.Desea incrementar su producción y trasladar su mercadería a la ciudad de Lima y a los lugares más cercanos a su localidad, también tiene pensado instalar un pequeño espacio de ventas en la plaza de su localidad para los días de feria y fechas festivas en el que se incrementa la suma de visitantes.

loans.use: Capital to increase production and profits

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo is very admirable as a father and an artisan because after he supported his wife so that she could go work outside of the country he had to suffer from her disinterest and abandon. His wife never returned home and for this reason Alfredo had to take on the difficult task of educating and raising his little children whose mother didn't think twice about leaving them. His artisan work helped him to feed and educate his children and now he works in partnership with his brother in order to increase his production and start to sell his products in other cities in his beloved country, Peru.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

ALFREDO, es una persona muy admirable como padre y como artesano debido a que después de que apoyó a su esposa para que pueda ir a trabajar fuera de su país tuvo que sufrir el desinterés y abandono de su pareja quien no regresó desde aquel día por esa razón Alfredo tuvo que asumir la difícil tarea de educar y criar a sus pequeños hijos a quienes su madre no le importó dejar.Su desempeño artesanal le ayudó a alimentar y a educar a sus hijos y ahora se encuentra trabajando con su hermano en sociedad con el propósito de elevar su producción e iniciar la comercialización de sus productos en otras ciudades de su amado Perú.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more raw materials.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a stay at home mother and also dedicates herself to making weavings which she makes in her home every afternoon after preparing food for her family. This work is not easy and requires a lot of patience and creativity as well as a lot skill in dying and mixing colors. Her work has given the opportunity to offer her children a better education and she wishes to continue with this labor since her clients are pleased and have referred her throughout the city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

CARMEN, madre de familia dedicada al cuidado de su casa y de sus hijos, pero de igual manera a la producción de telares que produce en el taller de su casa y en el que todas las tardes después de preparar los alimentos de su familia, se entrega completamente, este trabajo no es sencillo y requiere de mucha paciencia y creatividad, además de mucha habilidad para matizar y combinar los colores para el acabado final. Su desempeño le ha dado la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus hijos educación superior y desea continuar con esta labor ya que se ha incrementado la satisfacción de sus clientes y recomendaciones por toda su ciudad.

loans.use: Capital to increase production

loans.name: De L'union Group

texts.en:
Estime is a strong-willed and determined woman who lives in Trou du Nord, Haiti with her 5 children (ages: 13, 15, 17, 19, 21). She currently works as a seamstress, but wants to use this loan to change her business into a place where she can sell clothes as well.

With this loan, she will buy fabric to make clothing that she can sell, and she may also buy some used clothing for her business. Her goals for the future are to open a small classroom for children in her community, and to see her business grow.

We are excited that you can join us in watching Estime and the rest of her group excel over the next 6 months. God Bless!

loans.use: To purchase fabric and used clothes.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania L. is an enterprising young woman, who at 30 years of age is married and has a husband dedicated to litigating in the courts, though they do not have children. Despite the fact that her husband helps her economically, for four years she has had an eatery, a business that she was able to set up thanks to their savings.

She offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. She requests a loan to buy basic grains and meat in the market because her place is full each time with more customers and she wants to prepare to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Una joven emprendedora es la señora Ivania López, quien a sus 30 años es casada y su esposo se dedica a litigar en los juzgados, aun no tienen hijos. A pesar que su esposo le ayuda económicamente ella desde hace 4 años tiene una comidería, negocio que pudo montar gracias a sus ahorros. Ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Solicita un crédito para comprar en el mercado granos básicos y carne ya que su puesto de venta ahora se le llena cada vez mas de clientela y quiere prepararse en aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Buy basic grains and meat for preparing meals

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
From a young age Veronica has dedicated herself to making handcrafts. She was introduced into this business through her parents who taught her and helped her develop her abilities. She now sees the results of her work and her dedication in making weavings has given her the opportunity to contribute to her home and thus to improve the quality of life of her family members. To maintain this, her continuous work is necessary which is why she is asking for a loan in order to purchase a more prime material to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

VERÓNICA, desde muy joven se dedica a la artesanía, actividad que heredó de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron lo necesario y quienes le ayudaron a desarrollar sus habilidades en torno a esta actividad.Su desempeño ahora tiene resultados y su dedicación para la elaboración de telares le ha otorgado la posibilidad de contribuir con su hogar con la mejora de la calidad de vida de sus miembros. Para mantener este hecho cada vez es más necesario su desempeño continuo por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para elevar su producción.

loans.use: Capital to purchase more prime material

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever has always been immersed in handcraft work as his parents dedicated themselves to the production of very creative handcrafted mantles. Now that Ever has his own family, he is in need of money necessary to relaunch his business and use the teachings of his much loved parents. He is determined to put forth great effort in this business and will also involve himself in other businesses to benefit his new and loved family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Desde siempre Ever estuvo inmerso en el trabajo artesanal debido a que sus padres desde siempre se dedicaron a la producción de diversos mantos artesanales llenos de mucha creatividad.Ahora que Ever, ha conformado su propia familia, se encuentra en la necesidad de inyectar una suma de dinero necesaria para reflotar su actividad y las enseñanzas de sus amados padres. Está decidido a esforzarse mucho y ha interactuar también en otras actividades en beneficio de su nueva y querida familia.

loans.use: Injection of captial for business

loans.name: Lucydania

texts.es:
Lucydania is a humble and exemplary woman that makes a living making beautiful weavings on a wooden loom. Her daily efforts and dedication have given her great satisfaction and an immense list of orders. However, her daily labor can be interrupted by the damage of her old and loved loom. She wishes to acquire a new loom and a greater quantity of prime material to successfully fill the orders of her demanding clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

LUCYDANIA, es una humilde y ejemplar mujer que se gana la vida fabricando bellos telares con la ayuda de una máquina a base de madera adquirida para este fin, su dedicación y esfuerzo diario le han otorgado más de una satisfacción y una inmensa lista de solicitudes; sin embargo su diaria labor puede verse interrumpida por los desperfectos que viene teniendo su vieja y amada máquina. Desea adquirir una nueva y mayor cantidad de materia prima para cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of a new loom and prime material

loans.name: San Jose De Viñaca Group

texts.es:
The San Jose D. Viñaca Communal Bank is a young bank that formed 6 months ago. It is in it’s second loan cycle with 22 associates. The associates of the Communal Bank are from the community of Viñaca which is located about 40 minutes from the city of AyaC.. It is in a small valley where the Chicco river flows. The people dedicate themselves for the most part to cultivating vegetables.

The associates run different businesses like selling groceries, raising animals, agriculture and selling vegetables.

The associates need different loan amounts such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles… making a total of 9150 soles of loans in the Communal Bank.

Their loans will be invested in paying laborers and buying seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, sugar, rice and noodles.

The dreams of the associates are that their businesses improve, to have more capital and to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal San Jose D. Viñaca es un banco joven que tiene 6 meses D. formación, inicia el segundo ciclo con 22 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal son D. la comunidad D. Viñaca que esta ubicado a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. AyaC., es un pequeño valle por donD. fluye el río Chacco, los pobladores en gran mayoría se dedican a la agricultura D. verduras.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, crianza D. animales, la agricultura y la venta D. verduras.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, haciendo un total D. 9150 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. semillas, abonos, pago D. peón, insecticidas, azúcar, arroz, fideo.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus negocios mejoren, tener más capital y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: To pay laborers and buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, sugar, rice and noodles.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 45173

loans.name: Maryuri Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maryuri is a young woman 32 years of age. She is married and has a small daughter of 2 years. Her husband is actually in the United States and supports her economically for the sustenance of her daughter.

Maryuri works in a duty-free zone of Managua as a machine operator. At the same time she is dedicated to selling jewelry on foot chiefly in her workplace. The dream of Maryuri is to be able to build her own house, to be able to be established with her daughter and in that way to be able to have a better quality of life.

The business of jewelry sales was started with her own savings and she hopes to be able some day to have a fixed location and sufficient inventory to form her business. She requires the loan to buy more jewelry and thus to supply her merchandise to be able to continue offering them to her coworkers.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maryuri es una joven de 32 años de edad. Está casada y tiene una pequeña niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo actualmente se encuentra en Estados Unidos y le apoya económicamente para el sustento de su niña.

Maryuri trabaja en una zona franca de Managua como operaria máquina, al mismo tiempo que se dedica a vender prendas de forma ambulante principalmente en su lugar de trabajo. El sueño de Maryuri es poder construir su propia casa de habitación para poder establecerse con su hija y de esa manera poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El negocio de las ventas de prendas las inició con ahorros propios y espera poder algún día tener un local fijo y suficiente inventario para formar su negocio. Requiere el préstamo para comprar más prendas y así surtir su mercadería para poder seguir ofreciéndola a sus compañeras de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale to her co-workers.

loans.name: Allpachaca Group

texts.es:
The Allpachaca Communal Bank is a young bank that was formed 1 year ago. It is starting it’s third loan cycle with 17 associates. The associates of the Allpachaca Communal Bank are from the community of Allpachaca, which is located about 4 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The people are dedicated to agriculture and the raising of animals, especially dairy cattle for the production of milk.

The associates work in different businesses like selling clothes or groceries, agriculture and the majority of the associates are dedicated to raising dairy cattle and the production of cheese.

The associates need different loan amounts such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles… making a total of 6300 soles of loans for the Communal Bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying sugar, rice, oil, fertilizers and food for the cattle.

The dreams of the associates are to have more cattle, to improve their businesses, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Allpachaca es un Banco joven que tiene 1 año D. formación, inicia el tercer ciclo con 17 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal Allpachaca son D. la comunidad D. Allpachaca que esta ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, donD. los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza D. animales en especial D. ganado vacuno para la producción D. leche.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, abarrotes, agricultura, y la gran mayoría D. socios se dedican a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, producción D. quesos.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 6300 soles D. préstamos del Banco Comunal.

Sus préstamos seran invertidos en la compra D. azucar, arroz, aceite, abono y alimentos para el ganado.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener más ganado vacuno, mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, fertilizers and food for the cattle.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45175

loans.name: Julissa Vanessa

texts.es:
Julissa has belonged to the Generosity Communal Bank for about 2 years. In her Communal Bank she learned to save and also the loans that she has obtained have helped her very much.

Julissa is married, 27 years old and has 2 children ages 5 and 3 years. Julissa and her husband sell pots, bedspreads, covers, dishes, three-piece suits and everything their clients ask for. They carry out their sales on foot to the workers of the different institutions of the city of Ayacucho. Their products are acquired in the city of Lima.

Julissa needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of pressure cookers, sets of covers, sets of dishes and frying pans.

Her savings will be used for the purchase of her house. Julissa’s dreams are to have a stable business, to have sufficient income to pay for the education of her children and to be a great businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Julissa pertenece al Banco Comunal Generosidad hace 1, 2 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, además que los préstamos que obtiene le ayuda mucho.

Julissa es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos de 5, 3 años, Julissa junto a su esposo venden ollas, cubrecamas, cubiertos, vajilla, ternos y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, sus ventas lo realizan ambulatoriamente a los trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Julissa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas a presión, juego de cubiertos, juego de platos y sartenes.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la compra de su casa. Los sueños de Julissa son tener un negocio estable, tener suficiente economía para solventar los estudios de sus hijos y ser una gran empresaria.

loans.use: To buy pressure cookers, sets of covers, sets of dishes and frying pans for resale.

loans.name: Tania Doris

texts.es:
Tania has belonged to the Generosity Communal Bank for 2 years. In her Communal Bank she has learned to share and now she has many friends.

Tania lives in a shared home and is 23 years old. Tania and her husband are bakers, a traD. that her husband learned from his parents. They work in his father’s bakery, making biscuits. They sell them wholesale to different stores in their area.

Tania needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of flour and tin pans for baking the bread.

Tania says that, upon joining her Communal Bank she began to save for her certification, which she has already achieved. At present she is saving to buy land and a house.

The dreams of Tania are to have her own house, a pretty car, and to have a modern oven with all the necessary machinery.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Tania pertenece al Banco Comunal Generosidad hace 2 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a compartir y ahora tiene más amigas.

Tania es conviviente y tiene 23 años, Tania junto a su esposo son panificadores, actividad que su esposo aprendió D. sus padres, ellos trabajan en el horno D. su padre, elaboran biscochos y sus ventas lo realizan en las diferentes tiendas D. su zona al por mayor.

Tania necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. harina y latas para el horneado del pan.

Tania cuenta que al ingresar a su Banco Comunal comenzó a ahorrar para su titulación el cual ya lo realizó, actualmente esta ahorrando para comprar un terreno o casa.

Los sueños D. Tania son tener casa propia, un carro bonito, tener un horno moderno con toda L. maquinaria necesaria.

loans.use: To buy flour and tin pans for baking the bread.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Teresa H. is 47 years old and requests a loan to invest in the construction of an annex (bedroom) for her 18 year-old daughter and, if possible, to change part of the roof of her house, which was built several years ago by a Spanish project in the Bº Madrid. With previous loans she constructed other annexes for her other children. She has a total of four children, of which two study, one is outside of the country and the other is one year old.

Maria Teresa is well-recognized in the city for her support to those most in need; with much effort she was able to graduate as a lawyer and currently works for MIFAMILIA where she continues helping the disadvantaged.

She has paid off all of her loans responsibly and she intends to continue working with AFODENIC because of the good service and attention that they give her and because her dream in life is that each one of her children has their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Teresa H., de 47 años, esta solicitando un credito para invertirlo en la construcion de un anexo (dormitorio) para su hija de 18 años, y si es posible cambiará una parte del techo de su casau casa, ya que tiene varios años, pues fue construida por proyecto español en el Bº Madrid. Con los creditos anteriores construyó otros anexos para otros hijos, pues tiene un total de 4, de los cuales 2 estudian, 1 está fuera del pais y otro tiene 1 año de edad.

Maria Teresa es una persona muy reconocida en la ciudad por sus cualidades de apoyo a los mas necesitados, con su propio esfuerzo logró graduarse de abogada, actualmente trabaja en MIFAMILIA donde continuará apoyando a los desprotegidos.

Todos sus creditos los ha pagado con responsabilidad y piensa continuar trabajando con AFODENIC por el buen servicio y atencion que se les brinda, porque el sueño de su vida es que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propia habitacion.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (construction of a room)

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.es:
Primitiva, Maximiliana and Gregoria have belonged to the Generosity Communal Bank for 8 months, 8 months and 3 years respectively.

Primitiva lives in a shared house, is 38 years old and has 5 children. Primitiva travels to the open-air market every fortnight where she buys cheeses that she sells wholesale in the Playa Grau market. In addition, Primitiva washes other people’s clothes.

On the other hand Maximiliana is married, 50 years old and has 7 children of which 6 live with her. Maximiliana sells food on foot in the Nery Garcia market.

Gregoria lives in a shared house, is 43 years old and has 4 children. Gregoria travels to the open-air market 2 times a week where she sells fruits, popcorn, and bread and buys cheese, eggs, and cereals; products that she distributes to stores.

Primitiva, Maximiliana and Gregoria need a loan of 600 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles respectively; money that will be invested in the purchase of cheese, corn, meat, chicken, eggs, noodles, fruits, bread and cereals.

The dreams of Primitiva, Maximiliana and Gregoria are to buy land, to have a home of their own, that their businesses grow and that their children have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Primitiva, Maximiliana y Gregoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Generosidad hace 8 meses, 8 meses y 3 años respectivamente.

Primitiva es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Primitiva viaja a la feria cada quincena donD. compra quesos y lo venD. en el mercado Playa Grau por mayor. Además Primitiva lava ropa ajena.

Por otro lado Maximiliana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Maximiliana venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Gregoria es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Gregoria viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana donD. venD. frutas, canchas, pan y D. las ferias compra queso, huevo, cereales, productos que reparte a tiendas.

Primitiva, Maximiliana y Gregoria necesitan un préstamo D. 600 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. queso, maíz, carne, gallina, huevo, fideo, frutas, pan y cereales.

Los sueños D. Primitiva, Maximiliana y Gregoria son comprar un terreno, tener casa propia, que sus negocios crezcan y sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: To buy cheese, corn, meat, chicken, eggs, noodles, fruits, bread and cereals.

loans.name: Marlinda's Group

texts.es:
Emilia, Marlinda and Herminia have belonged to the Generosity Communal Bank for 8, 8, and 4 months respectively.

Emilia is married, 49 years old and has 3 children. Emilia sells flowers in the Nery Garcia market. She acquires her products from the producers in the Muyurina valley.

On the other hand Marlinda is a single mother. She is 28 years old and has 2 children. Marlinda sells vegetables in a rented stall of the Nery Garcia Market.

Meanwhile Herminia is married, 38 years old and has 6 children. Herminia and her husband are dedicated to growing vegetables in the city of Andahuaylas. They carry out their sales in the same area.

Emilia, Marlinda and Herminia need a loan of 400 soles, 800 soles, and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of flowers, lemons, tomatoes, chili, onion, fertilizer and insecticides.

The dreams of Emilia, Marlinda and Herminia are to build their own houses, to have a store, to buy a stall and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia, Marlinda y Herminia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Generosidad hace 8, 8 , 4 meses respectivamente.

Emilia es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Emilia vende flores en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los adquiere de los productores en el valle de Muyurina.

Por otro lado Marlinda es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Marlinda vende verduras en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Herminia es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Herminia junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras en la ciudad de Andahuaylas, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo terreno.

Emilia, Marlinda y Herminia necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores, limones, tomates, ají, cebolla, abono y insecticidas.

Los sueños de Emilia, Marlinda y Herminia son construir su casa, tener una tienda, comprar un puesto y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy flowers, lemons, tomatoes, chili, onion, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Bertha and Delfilia have been members of the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for 6 years, 4 years and 8 months, respectively.

Carmen is 35 years old and married with 3 children. Carmen and her husband have a spice and grocery store, which is located on a street near the central market of Ayacucho.

Bertha is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She sells food and drinks in her village of Huascahura, which is located 15 minutes from Ayacucho. Bertha also sells sweets at various social gatherings. She also travels to fairs where she buys lamb meat which she later divides and sells to her customers.

Delfilia is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She is a street vendor of sweets in the main park in Ayacucho.

Carmen, Bertha and Delfilia need a loan of 1,200 soles (about $450), 800 soles (about $300) and 400 soles (about $150) respectively. They will use the funds to purchase cinnamon, ají chile, beer, soft drinks and sweets.

Carmen, Bertha and Delfilia’s dream is for their children to have professional careers. They also would like to have a business place of their own, expand their business and build a house.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Carmen, Bertha y Delfilia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 6 años, 4años, 8 meses respectivamente.

Carmen es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de especerías y abarrotes, ubicada en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Bertha es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Bertha vende comida y bebidas en su pueblo de Huascahura que se encuentra a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Bertha vende golosinas en las distintas fiestas sociales y también viaja a las ferias donde compra ganado ovino, luego de beneficiarlo la carne lo reparte a sus clientes.

Mientras que Delfilia es casada, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Delfilia vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el parque principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Carmen, Bertha y Delfilia necesita un préstamo e 1200 soles, 800 soles, 400 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, ají, cerveza, gaseosas y golosinas.

Los sueños de Carmen, Bertha y Delfilia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un local propio, mejorar sus negocios y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of cinnamon, ají chile, beer, soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.es:
Nancy and Edith have been members of the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for 1 year and 4 months, respectively.

Nancy lives with her boyfriend, is 23 years old and has a 6-year-old daughter. She sells breakfast made of grain products such as soy and maca (Peruvian ginseng) in a small marketplace in her neighborhood. She also has sold sweets near a school entrance for the last 3 years.

Edith is single and 28 years old. She has run a beauty salon on a busy block in Ayacucho for the last 2 years.

Nancy and Edith need a loan of 400 soles (about $150) and 1,000 soles (about $375), which they will use to purchase liquids, dyes, peroxide, display cases and tables, in order to sell more products.

Nancy and Edith’s dream is for their children to have professional careers. They also would like to expand their business and have several branches.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Nancy y Edith pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año, 4 meses respectivamente.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 6 años, Nancy vende desayunos elaborados con cereales como soya y maca, sus ventas lo realiza en un mercadillo de su zona . Además Nancy vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio, actividad que realiza hace 3 años.

Mientras que Edith es soltera y tiene 28 años, Edith tiene un salón de belleza en una cuadra concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Nancy y Edith necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de líquidos, tintes, oxigenta, vitrinas y mesas para vender más productos.

Lo sueños de Nancy y Edith son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener sucursales.

loans.use: Purchase of liquids, dyes, peroxide, display cases and tables

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.es:
Marianela and Erlinda have been members of the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for one year.

Marianela is single and 22 years old. She is a street vendor of sweets and sandwiches at Sucre Park in Ayacucho. She also sells apples during Holy Week, a period of high demand.

Erlinda lives with her boyfriend and is 26 years old. She has a small shop where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. She also is an Anthropology student at the university.

Marianela and Erlinda need a loan of 400 soles each (about $150), which they will use to purchase pecans, rice and sugar.

Marianela’s dreams are to study at the university and expand her business. Erlinda’s dreams include finishing her studies and having a baby.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Marianela y Erlinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año.

Marianela es soltera y tiene 22 años, Marianela vende golosinas y bocaditos de manera ambulatoria en el parque Sucre de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Marianela aprovecha la demanda y vende otros productos como manzanas en Semana Santa.

Mientras que Erlinda es conviviente y tiene 26 años, Erlinda tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne. Además Erlinda estudia en la Universidad la carrera de Antropología.

Marianela y Erlinda necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pecanas, arroz y azúcar.

Los sueños de Marianela son estudiar una carrera profesional, aumentar su negocio, mientras que los sueños de Erlinda son terminar su carrera y tener un hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of pecans, rice and sugar

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesentia, with the help of her loving parents, plants a variety of vegetables and raises guinea pigs in her home. Yesentia and her parents spend long hours traveling to obtain the products that they sell every week at their local market. A couple of weeks ago, Yesentia decided to register for classes to earn a technical degree. Her parents support the decision and will try to contribute so that Yesentia can achieve her goal. In spite of the multitude of activities, this enthusiastic young woman has not neglected her business and is asking for a loan to increase and improve her products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

YESENIA, con ayuda de sus amorosos padres mantiene un proyecto de siembra de diversos vegetales y crianza de cuyes en su hogar, ella y sus padres se entregan a largas horas de interminable jornada para obtener los productos que comercializan semana a semana en la feria local de su ciudad.Ha decidido inscribirse y estudiar una carrera técnica hace un par de semanas bajo la mirada complaciente de sus amados padres quienes han decidido esforzarse para contribuir con la cristalización de la meta que se ha trazado, Yesenia.A pesar el cúmulo de actividades que desarrolla esta entusiasta joven no ha descuidado su negocio y solicita un préstamo con el fin de mejorar sus productos y elevar el número de los mismos.

loans.use: Increased capital to raise her production.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Alejandro dedicates 100% of his energy to his daily work in agriculture because it earns enough to sustain his beloved family. He grows a variety of vegetables that he sells in the markets of his city and nearby towns. There is strong demand and hundreds of households await his visits in order to stock up on the products of this working father. Alejandro is asking for a loan to improve the quality and quantity of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

ALEJANDRO, otorga el 100% de su energía a su labor agrícola diaria, debido a que de ella obtiene el sustento diario para su amada familia. Cultiva diversos vegetales que comercializa en las ferias de su ciudad y en los pueblos aledaños a ella, tiene gran demanda y centenares de mas de casa esperan su visita para abastecerse de lo que este trabajador padre les ofrece.Desea mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos y para este fin solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increased capital to improve the quality and quantity of his vegetables.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 45185

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is a young worker who loves art, and therefore shapes his energy and dedication into each of his pieces. After much sacrifice Luis opened a store two years ago, and sells paintings and other artwork that he creates himself. He is very happy with his work and would like to increase his working capital. With this money he will improve his store as well as the quality and variety of the products that he sells to thousands of tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

LUIS, es un joven trabajador que ama con mucha fuerza su actividad artesanal y por esa razón plasma su esfuerzo y dedicación en cada uno de ellos; con mucho sacrificio ha podido instalar hace un par de años un pequeño espacio de venta continua en el que oferta pinturas y objetos fabricados por él.Esta muy satisfecho con su labor y desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para mejorar su establecimiento y la calidad y variedad de los productos que oferta a miles de turistas.

loans.use: Improve the quality and variety of the beautiful pieces that he sells

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45186

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy is an enthusiastic young man with strong desires to better himself. At an early age he performed odd jobs in order to maintain his own well-being in spite of his family’s economic instability. Some time ago he observed that due to the construction of new homes, there was a demand for a variety of tools. He saw the opportunity for a niche job, and rented a truck so that he can quickly transport all of the tools that his clients need. He also contacts expert distributors so that he can make good purchases. He is continually fulfilled by work in the expanding construction market and hopes to continue working on national construction projects in his town.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Fredy es un joven entusiasta con muchos deseos de superación, desde muy joven se dedicado a laborar en diversas actividades para procurarse bienestar debido a la inestable economía de su familia. Hace poco ha observado la demanda de diversos implementos de construcción debido a la construcción de nuevas zonas de vivienda y ha visto en esta demanda un buen nicho de trabajo, por esa razón alquila un camión para transportar cada uno de los implementos que solicita su cliente en corto tiempo y los contacta también con los distribuidores expertos para que este pueda hacer una buena compra. Las satisfacciones van tocando día a día su corazón y desea seguir trabajando en esta labor ya que ha notado que el mercado se ampliará aún más, con la llegada de constructoras nacionales a su localidad.

loans.use: Loan to rent another truck.

loans.name: Dilma

texts.es:
Dilma is the principal breadwinner for her family, ensuring the health and security of her husband, children, and elderly parents. Dilma owns a guinea pig farm and earns a substantial amount from selling these animals. The high demand for guinea pigs has led Dilma to ask for a loan to expand her market and acquire more animals in order to make her farm the best in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Dilma, es la principal fuente de ingresos que provee bienestar y seguridad a su amado hijos y a sus ancianos padres, posee un criadero de cuyes y semana a semana obtiene sustanciales ganacias gracias a al comercialización de los mismos. La gran demanda de sus productos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su mercado y adquirir mayor número de ejemplares con el objetivo de convertirse en la mejor criadora de cuyes de su ciudad.

loans.use: Acquire a larger quantity of guinea pigs.

loans.name: John

texts.es:
John is an excellent father who makes use of every opportunity presented to him. By selling firewood, he now earns enough to maintain his home. While walking in search of firewood, he has discovered onions that are also in demand. John decided to plant these onions in his fields, which had been set aside for other vegetables a short time ago. He would like a loan to buy the necessary supplies to keep the new crops safe and free of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

John, es un ejemplar padre de familia que aprovecha cada una de las oportunidades que se le presentan y ha obtenido de la venta de leña ganacias suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, también ha observado en sus largas caminatas en búsqueda de este artículo la demanda de cebollas y ha decidido sembrar este vegetal en sus campos de cultivo destinados a otros vegetales hace poco tiempo atrás.Desea obtener un préstamo para adquirir los insumos necesarios para mantener a su nueva siembra de cebollas a buen recaudo y libres de plagas.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to care for his new onion crop.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45189

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
“As you can see I have a wood fence at the entrance of my residence. I would like to place a protective wall at the front of my house, to give more security to my dwelling, since I have family and it is necessary for protection. I request 450 dollars for its construction. “

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

“Como pueden ver tengo una cerca de madera a la entrada de mi domicilio, me gustaría colocar una barda en el frente de mi casa, para darle mas seguridad a mi vivienda, ya que tengo familia y es necesaria su protección. Solicito 450.00 dlls para su elaboración.”

loans.use: To build a protective wall at the front of his house.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angela A. C. has a business selling shoes and small gifts at the Mercado Victoria in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. Angela has 4 years of experience selling in the market and had other small businesses before this current one. She now has many loyal customers.

Angela is 45 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents and works hard to take care of them. Her dream is to save enough money to buy her own stand in the market.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Angela is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN ($525) to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her stand with her best selling items.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her stand in the market with her best selling items.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo S. C. has a business selling cheese, olives, and honey in the Mercado Victoria in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s been selling her products in the market for 12 years and now has many loyal customers. Consuelo also owns a grill and sells barbequed meats in front of her home at night .

Consuelo is 38 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children. She lives with her mother and the two take care of each other. Her current goal is to save enough money to buy a permanent stand in the market so she doesn’t have to pay rent.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Consuelo is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN ($525) to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy higher quality cheeses, olives, and meats to sell.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy higher quality cheeses, olives, and meats to sell.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
“I want to build a slab wall on the patio of my house to give protection to my family and at the same time to protect the dwelling in the times of heat from the rays of the sun that enter, thus to have more comfort in the home. The loan that is requested is of $700 dollars. “

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

“Quiero construir una losa en el patio de mi casa para dar protección a mi familia y así mismo proteger del los tiempos de calor con los rayos del sol que entrar ala vivienda y poder tener un mejor confort en el hogar, el préstamo que solicito es de $700.00 dll"

loans.use: To build a slab wall to protect the house from the heat of the sun.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Delia Dalila

texts.en:
Delia Dalila V. F. has a business selling a variety of plastic goods. She lives in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region, but sells her products at different markets all over the La Libertad area. She started her business with the sales of plastic bowls and now has over 20 products to offer her many loyal clients.

Delia is 42 years old, happily married, and has 2 children. With the support of her husband, Delia works hard to make sure her children will have more opportunities in life than she had. One day, she would like to have her own store and send her children to a university.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Valerosas II, Delia is requesting a loan of 500 PEN ($200) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her supply of best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her supply of best selling plastic products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena Gutierez S. has a general store in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. Elena sells products that her neighbors use most often, such as soda, sugar, oil, fruits, candy, rice, shampoos, butter, and more. The store is in her home, which has a nice central location.

Elena has 6 children and is happily married. Of her 6 children, 4 still depend on her. Her husband travels for work so she is happy she can stay at home and spend time with her family. Her goal is to educate her children.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Valerosas II, Elena is requesting a loan of 800 PEN ($300) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her shelves with her best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her shelves with her best selling products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 45195

loans.name: Margarita Micaela

texts.en:
Margarita Micaela V. G. sells and helps manufacture custom shoes and boots in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She works with her husband, who is a master cobbler. They can make any style shoe but prefer working with leather. Margarita and her husband specialize in top quality cowboy-style boots for men and women. They have taken orders and have exported custom boots to Paris and Miami.

Margarita is 70 years old, happily married, and has 9 children. She is in wonderful health and loves her work. She has a lifetime of experience making shoes and has many loyal customers. She loves running her business and helping her family. Many of her children help manufacture or sell their products.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Valerosas II, Margarita is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN ($450) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy materials such as leather to manufacture more shoes and boots.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy materials such as leather to manufacture more shoes and boots.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.en:
Maria Juana V. D. M. has a business manufacturing shoes in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. Maria and her husband specialize in shoes for children but have the ability to make whatever style. Maria has a lifetime of experience and many loyal customers. She usually travels to Shiclayo, a region to the north, to sell her shoes.

Maria is 52 years old and happily married with 2 children. She has worked hard, saved, and planned her entire life so her children would have more opportunities than she had. Both of her children are attending University.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Valerosas II, Maria is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN ($450) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy leather and synthetic materials.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy leather and synthetic materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nicolasa Jesus

texts.en:
Nicolasa Jesus Y. R. has a business selling cosmetics in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s a representative for Avon and has 3 years of experience. Over the past 3 years, she has acquired around 50 loyal clients and learned how to maximize her profits. For example, whenever Avon offers discounts on certain products, Nicolasa snatches them up so she earns more when she sells them.

Nicolasa is 43 years old, happily married, and has 2 children. She loves the independence she has gained and being able to help her family financially. The possibility of being able to send her children to University is what drives her to succeed.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Nicolasa is requesting a loan of 2300 PEN ($850) to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her most popular products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her most popular products.

loans.name: Michel

texts.es:
“I have an unfinished construction in my dwelling. I need to put in windows and doors and plaster the walls. That is why I request this loan of 1200 dollars to be able to finish the construction of my home. “

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar en mi vivienda, necesito colocarle las ventanas, puertas y enjarrar sus paredes, es por eso que Solicito su apoyo con” $ 1,200.00 dlls para poder terminar la construcción de mi vivienda”.

loans.use: To put in windows and doors and plaster the walls of his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman with 3 children, ages 9, 5 and 2 years old. Christina has been a fish seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 10am to 20pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Christina now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and is a widow with 7 children, ages 5 to 21 years old. Mary has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Nati's Pendeza Group

texts.en:
Nati is 46 years old and is married with 4 children. She has been a clothes seller since 1994. Every day, Nati works from 7:30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Nati now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in chicken sales, clothing sales, charcoal sales, and tailoring.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jasmini

texts.en:
Jasmini is 35 years old and is a single woman with one 12-year-old child. Jasmini has been selling used clothes since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Jasmini now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Saumu's Jasiri Group

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 5 years old. Saumu has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Gudila, who sells clothing.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with 4 children. She and her husband also take care of one other child. Since 1996 Salome has owned a small beauty salon and she also sells clothes. Every day, she works from 9am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240.

Salome now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. Since 1995, Prisca has sold clothes and she owns a small beauty salon. Every day, she works from 7am to 6.30pm at her business.

Prisca now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Neema's Shalom Group

texts.en:
Neema is 31 years old and is divorced with 2 children. Neema has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Pamela and Caroline, who have businesses dealing in millet sales and chicken sales.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is 22 years old and is married with one child. Blandina has sold cereals (millet) since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Blandina now hopes for a loan to buy more cereals for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cereals (millet) for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old and is married. Helen has worked as a tailor since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Helen now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
The aim of this micro project is to convert palm nuts into red palm oil. It was created by Rosalie K., well-known in her area for palm nut processing. She has operated this business since 1985 in Agadon, in the Akpro-Misserete township, in collaboration with several other women whom she deems active and experienced in the field. This is not Mrs K.’s first experience of loans, as she has previously benefitted from some MFI-qualified NGO loans. This has enabled her to attain an acceptable level of activity but she feels it is insufficient, hence the request for financing in order to boost her economic activity and especially to contribute to the development of her nation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ce micro projet a pour objectif de procéder à la transformation des noix de palme en huile rouge. Il a été concocté par K. Rosalie reconnue dans sa localité dans la transformation des noix de palme. Cette dernière mène cette activité depuis 1985 à AGADON dans la commune D’AKPRO –MISSERETE avec la collaboration de quelques femmes qu’elle juge activent et expérimentées dans le domaine. Dame K. Rosalie n’est pas à sa première expérience de prêt car elle en a bénéficié dans certaines ONG à vocation IMF. Ceci lui a permis d’atteindre un niveau acceptable mais qu’elle juge insuffisant d’où la recherche du financement pour rehausser son activité économique et surtout pour contribuer au développement de sa nation.

loans.use: To buy 3 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Whitnes's Peace Group

texts.en:
Whitnes is 24 years old and is married with one 3-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Whitnes has been a fruit seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Whitnes now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit (avocados, mangoes,oranges) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Caroline and Mary, who sell food and snacks (bites) and maize.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruit  for her business.

loans.name: Bihusi

texts.en:
Bihusi is 25 years old and is married with two children. Bihusi has been selling fruit since 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Bihusi now hopes for a loan to buy more mangoes, bananas and oranges for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
I am Margeret S. from a small city, Mian Channu, Pakistan. I own a three-room mud brick house here in Mian Channu. I am a mother of three: two boys and one girl. There is no school in my village, therefore I have enrolled my eldest son in a nearby village school.

My husband trades sheep and goats. He has been in this business for the last four years. With the current loan we will buy a few more sheep for our business.

I would like to borrow in a group with several other women: Zareena wants to expand their paint business; Hanifa B.’s husband trades livestock; Razia wants to expand her family’s grocery store, and Munira B. wants to start a grocery store. These women are needy and require loans to improve their income.

loans.use: Buy a few more sheep for their business

loans.name: Nonvignon Ahouanligodo Group

texts.fr:
This micro project focuses on converting palm nuts into red palm oil. It is the work of the all-woman association Nonvignon. This group of women came together in 2004 following government social measures aimed at helping impoverished members of the population through revenue-generating activities. It currently has three members and is located in the township of Akpro-Misserete in Ahouanligodo. On the border of the political capital Benin, this township abounds in natural resources. The funding of this micro project will enable the group to increase its production capacity, record a profit and improve the living conditions of its members.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’œuvre de l’association féminine NONVIGNON. Ce groupement féminin a été crée en 2004 suite aux mesures sociales du gouvernement en vue d’aider les couches de la population démunies à travers des activités génératrices de revenu. ll compte actuellement 3 membres et est situé dans la commune D’AKPRO – MISSERETE à AHOUANLIGODO. Frontalière avec la capitale politique du BENIN, cette commune regorge d’énormes richesses. Le financement de ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager des bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres.

loans.use: To buy 3.6 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Katherine's Group

texts.en:
Katherine resides in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan, with her family consisting of her husband and four kids: three boys and one girl. Katherine is a lady health worker and provides health services to the people of her community while her eldest son runs a grocery store in a nearby busy market and her husband is a farmer. They would like a loan to improve their grocery store.

Katherine has few other members in her group: Noora will use the loan to expand their little grocery store; Suriya wants to buy wood; Sakina and Mukhtara both want to buy cattle for their businesses.

loans.use: Improve their grocery store

loans.name: Fausta's Inoth Group

texts.en:
Fausta, the group leader, is married with 3 children. Fausta owns a small poultry business, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fausta now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens to increase her poultry flock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who inlude sellers of vegetables, fish, and used clothing, as well as a pastoralist.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chicken  to increase her poultry stock.

loans.name: Roze's Group

texts.en:
Roze B. is married and a mother of two boys. She has been living in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan, for the last twelve years. Her husband has been trading livestock for the last five years. They are requesting a loan to improve their livestock trading; this way their income will increase and they will renovate their house.

Roze B. has several other members in her group: Nasreen B. and Rozeena B. both require buying animals for their livestock trading; Elizbeth will use the loan to improve their farming, and Mariam B. needs to start a grocery store. In this group loan, the funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in their own or their household businesses.

loans.use: Improve their livestock trading business

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Anifa is 27 years old and is married with two children. Anifa owns a small shop, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm in her shop and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Anifa now hopes for a loan to buy more shop inventory (soap, cereals, oil and juice).

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen P. and I own a small mud brick house in Mian Channu, a small town in Pakistan. My husband works in a local factory and also trades sheep and goats. I help my husband and take care of the sheep and goats at our house. We need to buy a few more sheep and goats for our business and therefore, I am requesting a loan together with a group of several other women.

Jan B. needs to buy cattle; Alveena S. has a vegetable business; Nasreen N. wants to buy sheep, and Nazira F.’s husband is a day laborer.

loans.use: Buy sheep and goats for their business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 50 years old and is married with four children. Since 2000, Basilisa has sold cereals seller and been a pastoralist. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Basilisa now hopes for a loan to buy more cereals for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cereasls for her business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia B. is the group leader of a group of five women who all reside in the small town of Mian Channu, Pakistan, and are well acquainted with each other. These women are needy and desire a comfortable life for themselves and their fellow  group members. Razia B. needs her share of the requested loan to buy electrical goods for their business; Naseem B. will invest the loan in her family’s livestock trading; Nasreen B. and Parween B. both want to buy sheep for their businesses. Lastly, Salma B. will also invest her share of loan to improve their livestock trading business.

loans.use: to expand their little retail business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose L. is married with four children. She began selling shoes in 1993.  Every day, Rose works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Rose now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Affossogbe Setoko Group

texts.fr:
Social measures implemented by the government to help the poor and the needy led to the 2002 creation of an all-woman association in Setoko, made up of three members. Its main aim is to convert palm nuts into palm oil for subsequent trading. This all-woman association is seeking financing not only to improve its production and income capacity, but also – more specifically - because it believes that external loans are more secure and stricter than the association’s annuity and savings schemes. The group has already benefited from several loans from local MFIs. This is also a group that has a good reputation in the area of conversion and trade of palm oil.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Les mesures sociales engagées par le gouvernement pour aider les couches sociales démunies et d’heséritées ont conduit à la création d'une association féminine constituée de 3 membres à SETOKO depuis 2002. Elle a pour objectif principal la transformation des noix de palme en huile destinée à la commercialisation. Cette association féminine recherche un financement non seulement pour améliorer ses capacités productives et économiques mais surtout parce qu’elle juge que la gestion des crédits externes est plus sûr et plus rigoureuse que les tontines et épargnes de l’association. Ce groupement a eu a bénéficier de plusieurs crédits auprès des IMFs de la place. C’est aussi un groupement ayant une bonne réputation en matière de transformation et commercialisation de l’huile de palme.

loans.use: To buy 5.2 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Secilia

texts.en:
Secilia is married with one child, age 2 years old. Secilia has been selling clothes since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Secilia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Catherine's Inoth Group

texts.en:
Catherine is married with three children. She owns a small poultry business, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Catherine now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaid and Aisha, who sell fruit and clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for a poultry business.

loans.name: Rahel's Peace Group

texts.en:
Rahel is married with five children. She has been selling fruit and other food items since 1993. Every day, she works from 5.30am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rahel now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and other food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Naitovuaki, who has also sells fruit and other food items.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a married woman. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Evelyne now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food inventory

loans.name: Djamily

texts.ru:
Djamily Y. is a Vahdat resident, is married, and has 2 children. She is 35 years old and has secondary education. Djamily is in the business of selling various goods. She has been in this business for the past 14 years. She has a space in one of the markets in the town of Vahdat. Even through her family is not that big, her expenses increase over time. Her children are currently attending high school, and she wants to give them good education. Because of this, the income of her husband is not sufficient enough. Her business is the main source of income for their family. Currently, Djamily wants to purchase seasonal inventory from distributors at wholesale prices. To obtain funding for this transaction, she decided to take out a loan. After increasing the assortment of her inventory, Djamily will be able to increase her income. In addition, Vahdat residents will be able to purchase necessary products without laving the town. She plans to pay off the credit within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Якубова Джамиля Музафаровна жительница города Вахдат, замужем , имеет 2 детей. Возраст 35 лет,образование средние. Джамиля занимается куплей продажей товаров народного потребления. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 14 лет.Клиентка имеет торговую точку на рынке города Вахдат . Хоть семья у Джамили не очень большая ,но расходы с каждым днем становятся больше .Дети Джамили ходят в среднюю школу. образование клиетка хочет дать своим детям хорошее. Поэтому заработка ее мужа им не хватает. Торговля является основным доходом ее семьи. В данный момент Джамиля хочет закупить сезонный товар у оптовых поставщиков. Для чего ей нужны деньги.поэтому клиентка решила взять кредит.Увеличив ассортимент товара Джамиля увеличит свой доход.Так же жители города Вахдат могут приобретать товары первой необходимости , не выезжая за пределы своего города.А планирует погасить кредит Джамиля в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Firdavs Kurbanov lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 21 years old and single. He has secondary education. He is in the business of buying and selling phone accessories and pre-paid cell phone cards. Firdavs has a large and strong family. Even though he is only 21, he has been working for the past 3 years. His parents are retired. Government support is not sufficient to pay for even their medicines. For this reason, immediately after graduating from high school, Firdavs began his business. Now he would like to increase the assortment of his inventory, for which he needs additional funding. After consulting with his family, he decided to take out a loan. He plans to pay off his credit in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбанов Фирдавс Мукимович проживает в городе Вахдат .Фирдавсу 21 год, холост. Образование средние.Клиент занимается куплей продажей телефонных аксессуаров и карточек пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов. У Фирдавса большая, дружная семья .Не смотря на то ,что Фирдавсу только 21 год,он уже 3 года занимается бизнесом.Родители клиента пенсионеры . Пенсиии не хватает им даже на лекарства. Поэтому Фирдавс закончив среднюю школу, занялся бизнесом. В данное время клиент хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки. Для чего ему нужны деньги.Фирдавс посоветовавшись со своей семьей решил взять кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of his inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is married with four children. She began selling onions and other vegetables in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Agness now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables and onions for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food inventory.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is 24 years old and is married with one child. Tumaini began selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Tumaini now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo A. is a resident of Vahdat. She is married and has 3 children. She is 44 years old and has secondary education. She has been in the business of selling children's clothing for the past 13 years. Her husband is a construction worker, which is a seasonal job. For this reason, she can only rely on herself. Her children are currently in school. Marhabo wants to increase the assortment of her inventory. To do that, she wants to get a loan. With help of credit, she will be able to purchase more goods. Marhabo, having an extensive experience, knows that the more quality merchandise she has, the better are her sales. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбова Мархабо жительница города Вахдат. Мархабо замужем имеет 3 детей. Ей 44 года, образование среднее. Мархабо торгует на центральном рынке города Вахдат детской одеждой. Торговлей клиентка занимается 13 лет. Муж клиентки строитель, работа сезонная . Поэтому полагаться ей приходиться только на себя. Дети Мархабо еще только учатся . Клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки. Для этого она хочет получить кредит. Получив кредит ,она сможет завести новый товар . Мархабо,имея хороший опыт в торговли,точно знает чем больше хорошего,качественного товара,тем лучшет торговля.Клиентка планирует погасить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.name: Mahudjro Goulo Group

texts.fr:
This micro project focuses on converting palm nuts into red palm oil It is the initiative of the all-woman group MAHUDJRO de GOULO in the township of Akpro Misserete. The group was created in 1997 and is made up of 9 women. This micro project will enable the group to increase its production capacity, record a profit and improve the living conditions of its members. This is a group that is very motivated towards their work. The township’s geographical location allows the group to obtain permanent supplies of palm nuts for the conversion process.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin MAHUDJRO de GOULO dans la commune de AKPRO MISSERETE. Ce groupement a été crée en 1997 et est composé de 9 femmes. Ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager un bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres. C'est un groupement bien motivé pour le travail. La situation géographique de la commune permet à ce groupement d'avoir les noix de palme à transformer en permanence.

loans.use: To buy 6 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Tusekile

texts.en:
Mambo (hello) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Tusekile M.. She is married and has three children ages 13, 17, and 20. She has one dependent, a niece who lives with her.

In 2007, Tusekile established her liquor store business. Tusekile requires a loan to purchase a deep freezer to refrigerate beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals, but not to the sticks, although I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola, Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer to refrigerate beer and soda.

This micro project will enable the group to increase its production capacity, record a profit and improve the living conditions of its members.

The group has been having trouble financing its business for quite some time due to the inexistence of a microfinance institution that can assist it in finding funds. This loan will give the group the financial resources it needs to increase production and improve the members’ standards of living.

Le présent financement leur permettra de disposer de ressources financières pour l’augmentation de la production et l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie.

loans.name: Heleni

texts.en:
Mambo (hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Heleni M.. She is single and has two children, ages 6 months and 13 years.

In 1999, Heleni established her rice farming business. Heleni requires a loan in order to plant, harvest, and sell more rice. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equipment for her rice farm.

This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make snacks and juice for her kiosk.

loans.name: Felista's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Felista is 31 years old and a is married woman with 4children, ages 11,8,5 and 2 years old. Felista has catering business, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothes and shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ruth's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her children are 10 and 5 years old. Ruth sells clothes, or batik. She began her business in 2003, and has worked everyday from 8 AM to 4 PM. She earns a monthly average of $140 from her sales.

Ruth would like a loan to purchase more clothes and expand her business. Her subgroup members would also benefit from this loan, and they sell charcoal and soap.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (batik) for her business.

loans.name: Ruth's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 10 and 5 years old. Ruth is a clohtes (batik) seller,she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (batik) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales,shop and soap sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (batik) for her business.

loans.name: Hermina

texts.en:
Hermina lives in Soko, a small village near the town Gračanica and she is married. She works in shoe factory and her monthly salary is 300.00KM. Her husband is also employed and works in factory of furniture where his monthly income is 600.00KM.

Hermina wants to use the loan of 600.00KM for buying a cow. Hermina's wish is to do agriculture and breed cattle in order to increase the number of the stock.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Naza

texts.en:
Naza lives in Soko with her husband and son. She is doing agriculture. Her husband is employed in forestry and earns 350.00KM monthly.

The current loan amount is 900.00KM. Naza wants to use this loan for buying a cow, in order to do agriculture and breed cattle.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela was born in 1978. She is married and she lives with her husband with their two children in the town of Lukavac. One child goes to the primary school. Her husband has a full-time job and he works in a forwarding firm. His monthly salary is 2,000 KM.

This is Danijela's first loan at the MCO WWI in the amount of 1,200 KM. Danijela will use this loan to buy chicken, because her wish is to breed poultry and to use her free time in a good way.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Radmila

texts.en:
Radmila is 65 years old woman from the town Lukavac. She is divorced and she receives the monthly pension in the amount of 280 KM.

This is her first loan at the MCO WWI. Radmila intends to use this loan in the amount of 1,200 KM to buy a bench on the market where she will sell the clothes. Her wish is to expand the business in order to employ her daughter, too.

loans.use: For buying a bench in the market.

loans.name: Viv Ansanm Group

texts.en:
