L. lives with his two children (ages 8 and 10) in a small community outside Trou du Nord, Haiti. He has been selling fish for the past couple of years, and with this loan he hopes to get a larger variety and better quality of fish. All of his profits will go directly to his children, whether it be for food, school, clothing, etc. He told us that his biggest difficulty is that his children get sick often, and they don’t have money for any type of medical care or even basic medicine. In the future, L. dreams of having a big and successful business.

Haiti is the poorest country in the western hemisphere, and economic development is extremely difficult without access to capital. Esperanza is grateful to all Kiva lenders who make it possible for us to extend credit to these entrepreneurs. God bless!

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Taras

texts.en:
Taras is a taxi driver from the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He has been working as a driver for many years. After serving for a time in the military he drove for a government official and then later worked as a driver for a private person. About seven years ago he decided to become self-employed and started working as a taxi driver. Taras is married and has one daughter who is fourteen. His taxi business is the main source of income for his family. Currently he makes about $30-$35 per day.

Taras has requested a loan to help take care of some repairs to his taxi. He has repaid all previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this opportunity to support him in his business and help keep him on the road making a living.

loans.use: Taras would like to make repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a small business owner from the city Primorsk in southern Ukraine, near the Azov Sea. She has a little space at an outdoor market in Primorsk where she sells a selection of children’s outerwear. Mariya decided to sell children’s clothing after noticing a need for good quality clothing. This has proven to be a wise business decision and even now there are not many other vendors in her market that offer the same items. Mariya is married and has three children. She makes around $1000 in profit each month from her business.

Mariya has requested a short term loan to add to her working capital and help purchase new inventory to sell. Many market vendors such as Mariya are dealing with the effects of high inflation in Ukraine. They must sell more in order to make more. This loan will help Mariya continue to operate a stable, successful business that will provide for the needs of her and her family.

loans.use: Mariya would like to add working capital and purchase inventory for her children's clothing stall.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana and her husband Alexander are from the small city of Primorsk, Ukraine near the Azov Sea. Svetlana operates a small women’s clothing business at the Primorsk Central market. She has been selling for some time and has developed a good reputation for having quality merchandise, updated selections, and being honest in dealing with her customers. Svetlana currently has around $2000 worth of inventory on hand and makes about $500 in a typical month. She has an excellent location for her sales kiosk and would like to continue investing in and developing her business.

Svetlana has requested a small, short term loan to give her some extra working capital and to help purchase new inventory.

loans.use: Svetlana would like to increase the working capital of and purchase inventory for her women's clothing stall.

loans.name: Lourdes Eliane

texts.es:
Lourdes dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, and her husband works at an entity as a store assistant. Lourdes is 23 years old and, with her husband, has two children ages 4 and 2 respectively.

The cosmetics brands she sells are Yanbal and Avon. In her house she also has a place for making calls, and she has been doing both activities for about four years. There is substantial competition with regard to cosmetics sales, but demand for these products is also high. Her sales allow her to meet her obligations. She seeks the current loan to purchase cosmetics, whose prices vary depending on make and type of product.

This is Lourdes’ third time with the foundation, and she has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She currently has loans with other financial entities where she has also met her installments on a timely basis.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo y su esposo trabaja en una entidad como auxiliar de almacenes. Lourdes de 23 años de edad y su esposo tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Los cosméticos que ella vende son los de Yanbal y Avon, en su casa también tiene un punto de llamadas lleva con ambas actividades una antiguedad de aprosimadamente 4 años. Existe bastante competencia en cuanto a la venta de cosméticos pero así también la demanda es elevada, la comercialización de los mismos permiten cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene Lourdes. La solicitud del presente préstamo es para la compra de cosméticos y el precio de los mismos varian dependiendo de la marca y del tipo de producto. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Lourdes con la institución y durante este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable con sus pagos, actualmente también tiene créditos en otras entidades financieras donde también cumple con sus pagos.

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is 24 years old, and he dedicates himself to transporting city passengers on trufis route 115 (a trufi is similar to a taxi service, but with a fixed route).

David is a single young man with no dependents who still lives with his family. He has 90 months of experience in the field of transportation, an activity which he carries out with great responsibility.

There is quite a bit of competition in this business and, despite this, David has affiliated himself with trufis route 115 which guarantees him a stable income.

He plans to make some repairs and to repay his debt to Agrocapital. The current loan would be his third, and he did have some problems with falling behind previously but did complete his payments. He has current debts with other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

David de 24 años de edad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros a nivel urbano en la ruta fija de la línea de trufis 115. David es un joven soltero, no tiene dependientes pero vive en la casa de su familia. David cuenta con 90 meses de experiencia en el rubro del transporte de pasajeros a nivel urbano, actividad que realiza con bastante responsabilidad. Existe mucha competencia en el rubro, sin embargo David se encuentra afiliado a la linea de trufis 115 lo cual le garantiza un ingreso estable. Destinara el credito al arreglo de su movilidad y el saldo al pago de su deuda con Agrocapital. La presente se trata de la tercera secuencia, tuvo algunos problemas con el credito (retrasos) pero pago con normalidad. También presenta deudas con otras instituciones.

loans.use: Make repairs and cancel balance with Agrocapital.

loans.name: Einar

texts.es:
Einar is single, does not have children and he lives in the home of his parents. He is an employee at an enterprise where he holds the title of Systems Manager. He does not have direct competition in this business as he works as an employee.

The present loan is to purchase equipment for converting his current transportation to gasoline, the price of which varies depending on the brand and the size of the cylinder.

His standing with the foundation is good given he is responsible and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Einar es una persona soltera, no tiene hijos y actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Trabaja como dependiente en una empresa y asume el cargo de Encargado de Sistemas. No tiene competencia directa en este rubro debido a que trabaja como dependiente de la empresa. La presente solicitud es para la compra de un equipo para convertir su movilidad a gas, el precio varia dependiendo de la marca y de la capacidad del cilindro. Su comportamiento con la institución es bueno ya que es responsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for gasoline.

loans.name: Selene Mayret

texts.es:
Selene V. started her business two years ago, because she no longer had work and needed a source of income to pay for personal expenses. She decided to rent space and outfit it for the purpose of selling clothing and shoes. At first, she was afraid her enterprise would not work out but thanks to much effort on her part things have been going well.

Currently, she seeks a loan of $500USD to be repaid in 4 months in order to purchase additional merchandise. With your help, Selene will continue her progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Selene V. inicio su negocio hace 2 años, ya que no tenia trabajo y necesitaba de una fuente de ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales. Por lo que decidió rentar un local y acondicionarlo para la renta de ropa y zapatos. Inicialmente tenis miedo de que no funcionara pero gracias a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir más mercancía. Con tu contribución Selene seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina is married and her husband works in construction. She embarked on her business to live with more ease with regard to expenses, given they are currently paying on their house. Five years ago, she began to sell shoes by catalog. As things progressed and went well, she rented space from which to continue selling footwear.

She now seeks a loan of $500USD, to be repaid in five months, to buy merchandise so she will have a wider variety of shoes. With your help she will get ahead!

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Armandina R. es casada y su marido se dedica a la construcción. Emprendió su negocio para vivir más desahogos en cuanto a gastos, ya que están pagando su casa actualmente. Por lo que hace 5 años empezó a vender calzado por catalogo, posteriormente como le empezó a ir bien, rento un local y siguió surtiendo calzado.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y así tener mayor variedad de calzado. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante!.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel V. started his business three years ago when he was left without work and needed income to support his wife and two children who were in primary school, Jonathan, 10 years old, and Sarriá, 8. He saw the opportunity to open an office supply store because, near the school his children attend, there was no such enterprise so he opened his own.

Today, he seeks a loan of $500USD, to be repaid in five months, to purchase merchandise. With your help, Manuel will continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Manuel V., emprendió su negocio hace 3 años cuando se quedo sin trabajo y ocupaba un ingreso para sostener a su esposa y sus 2 hijos que estaban estudiando la primaria, Jonathan de 10 años y Sarriá de 8. Vio la oportunidad de poner una papelería ya que cerca de la escuela a la que van sus hijos no había ningún negocio de este tipo, por lo que abrió la suya.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Manuel seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nelly Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nelly Hernández started her business a little over a year ago, selling cold beverages for the heat of the summer and slowly she started adding a wider variety of products. She did this to help her husband with the family’s expenses, and to help pay for the schooling for their 2 children, Jessica, 15 years old and Karina, 18, who studies nursing. Her husband works in a local clinic but his salary does not cover all the expenses.

She is asking for a loan of $350USD, to be repaid in four months, to purchase merchandise and that way be able to increase her earnings. With your support, Nelly will continue prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly Hernández inicio su negocio hace poco mas de un año, empezó vendiendo algunas bebidas frías para el calor de verano, y poco a poco fue metiendo mas variedad de productos hasta tener un snack. Esto lo hizo para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y pagar las colegiaturas de la escuela de sus 2 hijas, Jessica de 15 años estudiante de secundaria y Karina de 18 años quien estudia enfermería. Su esposo labora como intendente de una clínica local por lo que su sueldo es insuficiente.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mercancía y así obtener más ganancias. Con tu apoyo Nelly seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac A. is a successful trader who sells used clothing. He is married and has 5 dependents. Business is good, and he wants to increase sales.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefanía R. is married. Her husband is a construction worker, and they have 7 children. 27 year old Juan Manuel works at a paper store, 31 year old Juan Héctor and 29 year old Juan Jesús are construction workers, 24 year old Juan Ernesto is a day laborer, 20 year old Adelfa sells clothing, 22 year old Maria Guadalupe sells food, and 18 year old Maria de los Ángeles is a student.

Estefanía began her business in order to help her spouse maintain their children. It has been 18 years since she began selling clothes in a market with a friend. Later she became independent and has continued alone with her business.

Now she is asking for a loan of US $500 that she will repay in 5 months in order to buy merchandise. With your help, Estefanía will continue helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Estefanía R. esta casada, su esposo se dedica la construcción y tienen 7hijos Juan Manuel de 27 se dedica a venta en una papelería, Juan Héctor de 31 a la construcción, Juan Jesús de 29 a la construcción, Juan Ernesto de 24 jornalero, adelfa de 20 venta de ropa, Maria Guadalupe de 22 venta de comidas y Maria de los Ángeles de 18 estudiante. Inicio su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en la manutención de sus hijos, hace 18 años se inicio en la venta de ropa con una amiga vendiendo en el mercado, luego se independizo y ha seguido sola con el negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Estefanía seguirá apoyando a su familia

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo Rodríguez is married and his wife works as an employee of a commercial store. They have four children; 23-year-old Adolfo Ángel is a day laborer, while 18-year-old Estrella, 15-year-old Cristal, and 12-year-old Eduardo are all students. 2 years ago, Gustavo began a business selling pork rinds in his house, until he started selling more products. This is how he was able to have a snack stand and get extra income to support his family.

Now he is asking for a loan of US $350 that he will repay in 4 months in order to buy a variety of merchandise. With your contribution, Gustavo will improve his life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo Rodríguez es casado y su esposa trabaja como empleada en una tienda comercial. Ellos son padres de 3 hijos Adolfo Ángel de 23 años jornalero, Estrella de 18 años, Cristal de 15 y Eduardo de 12 años todos estudiantes. Hace 2 años emprendió un negocio vendiendo chicharrones en su casa, hasta vender mas productos y así tener un snack de esta manera fue obteniendo ingresos extras para sostener a su familia.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar variedad de mercancía. Con tu contribución Gustavo seguirá delante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo began a business two years ago in order to generate income to support himself since his parents passed away in an accident, leaving him abandoned. He wanted to continue studying, which caused the idea of opening a snack stand to occur to him. This business has actually permitted him to live and continue in school.

Now he is asking for a loan for US $350 that he will repay in 4 months in order to buy merchandise and to have a better variety of products to offer. With your help, Gustavo will continue to proposer!

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo inicio un negocio hace 2 años para generar ingresos que le permitieran sostenerse a si mismo, ya que sus padres fallecieron en un accidente quedándose desamparado. El deseaba seguir estudiando por lo que se le ocurrió la idea de poner un snack. Actualmente este negocio le ha permitido subsistir y continuar en la escuela.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Gustavo seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma R. is married and her husband works as a driver in a foundry. She has three children. The two oldest are already married. The youngest, Sofía, is 18 years old and she is still a student. She began 22 years ago with her business of preparing food for the employees of a company and so she helps her husband with the family expenses. Also, she has always enjoyed cooking.

Now she is asking for a loan of US $500 that she will repay in 5 months to paint her business and put in order some details that will help her improve the image of her business. With your help, Irma will achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma R. esta casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer en una ferretería, tiene 3 hijos los 2 mayores ya están casadas y la mas pequeña Sofía de 18 años quien esta estudiando. Inicio hace 22 años con su negocio preparando comida a empleados de una empresa y así ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares además que siempre le ha gustado la cocina.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para pintar su negocio y arreglar algunos detalles que le ayuden mejorar la imagen del negocio. Con tu apoyo Irma lograra sus metas,

loans.use: To remodel a business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica H. is married and her husband works as a salesman. She has 3 children, Angel 8, Jazmin 6, and Alondra 4. They are all students. Three years ago she began the sale of shoes through a catalog. She began that from the recommendation of her mother when her husband got sick and could not work. Her mother gave her the catalog so that she could offer the shoes for sale. Since she has been successful she has continued this business.

Now she needs a loan for $500us that she will be able to pay back in 5 months so that she can buy products

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Jessica H. esta casada y su esposo trabaja como agente de ventas, tiene 3 hijos Ángel de 8, Jazmín de 6 y Alondra de 4 años, estudiantes. Hace 3 años empezó con la venta de zapatos por catalogo, lo hizo por recomendación de su madre cuando su esposo enfermo y no podía trabajar, entonces su mama le regalo el catalogo para que ofreciera los zapatos. Como le ha ido bien continua con esta actividad.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $500 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 5 meses para comprar mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Maria is married and her husband works in a laboratory. They have three children, Perla 6, Valeria 4, Susana 2. Two years ago she started her sale of cosmetics in order to help her husband out economically. That way with more income she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life for their children

She soliciting a loan for $300us that she would payback in 4 months so that she could buy more products to sell. With your help Maria will continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Maria de los Ángeles es casada su esposo trabaja en un laboratorio, y tienen 3 hijas perla de 6, Valeria de 4 y Susana de 2 años. Inicio hace 2 años con la venta de cosméticos para apoyar a su marido en la economía familiar y así tener mayores ingresos para ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía. Con tu ayuda Maria seguirá adelante

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Martha Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is married and has 2 children, Vicor Guadalupe who is 8 years old, and Martha Itzel 6years old. Both are students, and her husband is a construction worker. Two years ago she started selling clothing from her home to her family and friends. She started when her husband went to the United States to look for work. During that time she was in charge of the kids. Since she was successful with her business she continued it.

She is soliciting this loan for $475us that she will pay back in 5 months, because she wants to buy more inventory in order to increase her income. With your contributions Veronica will achieve her sales goals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Verónica es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Víctor Guadalupe de 8 años y Martha Itzel de 6 estudiantes. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción. Inicio hace 2 años vendiendo ropa en su casa a sus familiares a sus amigas, cuando su esposo se fue a Estados Unidos a buscar trabajo, mientras tanto ella se hizo cargo de la manutención de sus hijos. Como le iba bien continua con esta actividad.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y así obtener mejores ingresos. Con tu contribución verónica lograra incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.name: Lower Nyamboyo Women's Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel started his matatu (public service vehicle) transport business seven years ago with a second-hand vehicle. Through hard work and determination, Ezekiel is able to feed, clothe, and educate his family of two wives and eight children.

Ezekiel operates his business along the Kisumu – Busia highway and is currently planning to buy another second-hand matatu (public service vehicle) to diversify his business. With the help of his loan, Ezekiel will also be able to buy public service vehicle spare parts which he hopes to sell to generate more income for his family. His long-term business vision is to own a fleet of many public service vehicles.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase matatu (public service vehicle) spare parts

loans.name: Lower Nyamboyo Women Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel started his matatu (public service vehicle) transport business seven years ago with a second-hand vehicle.  Through hard work and determination, Ezekiel is able to feed, clothe, and educate his family of two wives and eight children.  

Ezekiel operates his business along the Kisumu – Busia highway, and is currently planning to buy another second-hand matatu (public service vehicle) to diversify his business.  With the help of his loan, Ezekiel will also be able to buy public service vehicles spare parts which he hopes to sell to generate more income for his family.  His long term business vision is to own a fleet of many public service vehicles.

loans.use: To purchase matatu (public service vehicle) spare parts

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the “Mujeres Creativas” Communal Bank located at Jr Maya de Brito S/N in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 34 years old and is the mother of five children. Her husband is a deliveryman.

With the first loan that Blanca received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business buying and selling fish. Now she has her own stand where she sells fish in the market. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and then goes to her stand where she stays until she runs out of fish to sell.

With this loan of $300, which she plans to repay in four months, Blanca will buy 50 kilos of fish like sea bass, boquichicos, sardines and doncella.

Blanca is very happy. Her business is growing and her sales are increasing. All of the effort she is making is to give her children a good education and a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, ubicado en el Jr Maya de Brito S/N, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de pescados. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de pescados en el mercado, para lo cual se levanta a las 5 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dirige a su puesto para vender sus pescados hasta la hora que termine su venta.. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 50Kg de pescado como corvinas, boquichicos, sardinas, doncella. Blanca esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una buena educación y futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the “Mujeres Creativas 2” Communal Bank located in the Nueva América neighborhood at Mz 3 Lt. 11 in Manantay, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is a carpenter.

With the first loan that Ana received from Manuela Ramos, she started a business selling detergent in bulk door to door. Using the money she maD. selling detergent, she has decided to invest in a business selling beauty products and, with the economic support of her husband, is now able to better help her children.

With this loan of $300, which she plans to repay in four months, Ana will buy detergent in bulk and beauty products including perfumes, lipsticks, talcum powders, fingernail polish, jewelry and eye shadows.

Ana is happy and very content with the support she receives from Manuela Ramos. She says that it is a great help to Peruvian women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. Nueva América Mz 3 Lt. 11, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 23 años es madre D. 2 hijos, su esposo es maderero. Ana con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta domiciliaria D. detergente a granel. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas del la venta del detergente decidió invertir en la venta D. productos D. belleza, con el apoyo económico que le brinda su esposo esta logrando sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará detergente a granel, productos D. belleza como perfumes, labiales, talcos, esmaltes, joyas, sombras, etc. Ana esta feliz y muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, dice que es una gran ayuda para las mujeres peruanas que quieren salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and detergent to sell

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika belongs to “La Familia” Communal Bank located at Jr Atahualpa No. 520 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 28 years old and the mother of one child. Her husband is a salesman but his income isn’t sufficient enough to pay household expenses.

So, with the first loan that Erika received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business to sell spare parts for motorcycles and three-wheeled delivery vehicles and she now has her own store. She gets up at 7:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and son and then she and her husband work in the store until 7:00 p.m. With this loan of $750, which she plans to repay in four months, Erika will buy tires and other replacement parts to sell.

Erika is extremely happy because her business has grown. With desire, hard work and perseverance everything is going well and she can help pay her family’s expenses. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos gives her to help build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr Atahualpa No 520, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es comerciante pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no alcanzan para los gastos de su hogar, es así que Erika con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de repuestos para motos y motocarros. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda de venta de repuestos para motos y motocarros para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo, y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la atención de su tienda, con la ayuda de su esposo hasta las 7 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2 000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: llantas, cámaras, retenes, rodajes, etc. Erika esta súper feliz, su negocio a crecido, basto solo ganas, esfuerzo y perseverancia para que todo le vaya bien pues de esta manera puede apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for shop

loans.name: Mahanga Fanikiwa Shg Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a middle-aged married woman with 5 children of her own.  Her late sister's 3 orphans also live with her.  

Hellen started her business nine years ago after working for her aunt helping around the house.  With the little money that she got from her earnings, Hellen was able to save money and start a small second-hand clothing business.  She gets her stock from the famous Kibuye market in Kisumu Town and sells to customers who are mostly from the local neighborhood.  

With the little profits that she gets from the business, Hellen is still able to feed, clothe, and educate her children.  With the help of her loan, Hellen will be able to purchase more bails of clothes which she hopes will increase her sales.  Her long term business vision is to open up a boutique in her home town in Luanda, Western part of Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of clothes.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to “La Familia” Communal Bank, located at Av. Yarina 2381 in Yarinacocha, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children.

Blanca’s income wasn’t enough to support her family so she decided to invest the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in a business buying and selling clothing. She now has her own store where she sells items including clothing and shoes. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and then works attending to her customers until 8:00 p.m.

With this loan of $650, which she plans to repay in four months, she will buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothing, women’s shoes, wallets, toys, backpacks, jewelry and perfumes.

Blanca is very happy and content. She realized that only with hard work and perseverance could she accomplish more than she thought possible at the beginning. She can now afford to pay her household expenses and support her children in their studies and is very grateful for all of the support given to her by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. Yarina 2381, del Distrito D. Yarinacocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos con que cuenta no le alcanzan para los gastos familiares, es así que Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. compra y venta D. ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta una tienda D. venta D. ropas, zapatos, etc, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos, luego se dedica a la atención D. sus clientes hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, zapatos D. mujer, carteras, juguetes, mochilas, joyas, perfumes, etc. Blanca esta muy feliz y contenta, se dio cuenta que solo con esfuerzo y perseverancia pudo lograr lo que no pensó al comienzo, ahora pueD. solventar los gastos D. su hogar y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios esta muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mahanga Fanikiwa Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a middle-aged married woman with 5 children of her own. Her late sister's 3 orphans also live with her.

Hellen started her business nine years ago after working for her aunt helping around the house. With the little money that she got from her earnings, Hellen was able to save money and start a small second-hand clothing business. She gets her stock from the famous Kibuye market in Kisumu Town and sells to customers who are mostly from the local neighborhood.

With the little profits that she gets from the business, Hellen is still able to feed, clothe, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Hellen will be able to purchase more bails of clothes which she hopes will increase her sales. Her long-term business vision is to open up a boutique in her home town in Luanda, Western part of Kenya.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of clothes.

payments.comment:
Dear Lender,

Mahanga Fanikiwa Self-Help Group has repaid $236 of its loan to Kiva lenders.  It is now 15% complete in its repayment schedule.

Sincerely,
Opportunity International WEDCO

loans.name: Omore Jenga Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Oscar O. is an average-aged man who is married with a wife and six children.

He owns a small retail shop which he started ten years ago, after accumulating savings from the little money he earned while working as a shelf attendant for a supermarket. Oscar’s small retail shop sells household goods that his customers can use on a daily basis. The shop mostly stocks food and toiletries.

Oscar is a hardworking man. From the little profits that he gets from his business, he is still able to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the help of the loan, Oscar will be able to add more stock for his business, which he hopes will generate more income. His long-term business vision is to open up a wholesale unit in the future.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es:
Desideria is married and has two children. She started her business out of necessity to obtain a higher family income given that one salary was not enough. Also, at the time, her husband’s unemployment caused her to look for additional resources and she started working on her own. Two years ago, one of her neighbors began supplying her with household cleaning products for her to sell, and she continues to carry out this activity today.

She is now requesting a loan for $US 150, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase a batch of personal cleaning products and offer demonstrations of these on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desideria es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener mas recursos para su familia dado que un solo sueldo no era suficiente, además en ese tiempo el desempleo que tenia su marido la obligo a buscar recursos y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta, hace 2 años una de sus vecinas le facilitaba productos de limpieza para su venta, actividad que continua realizando.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un lote de productos de limpieza personal y realizar demostraciones por su cuenta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to give her own demonstrations.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Doña Marlene is a woman dedicated to the sale of ‘cajetas,’ or homemade caramel, and has a small grocery store. She has thirty years of experience in small businesses, to which she has dedicated all of her life and all of her efforts.

From the time she was very young, upon seeing her son in her arms she decided to look for a source of income to be able to give sustenance to her young one, so she began selling cajetas, and it is for this that she seeks a loan to purchase raw materials to continue producing a larger quantity of cajetas.

Doña Marlene is 51 years old, single, and has a 30 year-old son who is in the United States, helping her with monthly remittances. One of the greatest desires of Doña Marlene is to have a small grocery story where she can sell a greater amount of sweets, and the other, which is no less important, is to see her son again after having gone so long without seeing him.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Marlene es una señora que se dedica a la venta de cajetas y tiene una pequeña pupería. Tiene 30 años de estar en estos pequeños negocios a los cuales le ha dedicado toda su vida y todo su esfuerzo.

Desde muy joven al verse con su hijo en brazos decidió buscar una fuente de ingresos para poder darle el sustento al pequeño, es así como empezó la venta de cajetas, y es para eso que solicita el préstamo, para la compra de materia prima para seguir elaborando mayor cantidad de cajetas.

Doña Marlene tiene 51 años de edad es soltera y tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad y se encuentra en Estados Unidos, él le ayuda con remesas mensuales. Uno de los mayores anhelos de dona Marlene es llegar a tener una pequeña empresa donde pueda comercializar a mayores cantidades de dulces, y el otro pero no menos importante es poder volver a encontrarse nuevamente con su hijo al que tiene mucho tiempo sin ver.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for homemade caramel

loans.name: Elsa Enedelia

texts.es:
Elsa is 38 years old and is married and has two children. Her husband is an employee at a company. She started her business because she has always liked sales and also to increase her income and be independent from the money her husband would give her. Three years ago she started selling perfumes, doing demonstrations for her co-workers and neighbors who have now become faithful clients that buy from her frequently.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300, to be paid in 5 months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to deliver her pending orders. With your help she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Elsa tiene 38 años y es casada su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, tienen 2 hijos. Inicio su negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas además para ser independiente a lo que su marido le daba y así incrementar las entradas de dinero. Hace 3 años empezó con la venta de perfumes haciendo demostraciones con compañeras de trabajo y vecinas logrando así clientes fieles que le compran con frecuencia.

Solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder entregar los pedidos que ya tiene a tiempo. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martín Manases

texts.es:
Don Martín is 41 years old, separated, and has a son who is under his guardianship, and for whom he works day after day.

Don Martín is a driver and has a truck that he uses to transport goods, primarily construction items and timber. He currently has problems with the gearbox in his vehicle and because of this he needs a loan.

He needs to buy the part and install it in his vehicle so that he can continue working to provide sustenance to his son and to his mother, whom he supports financially.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Don Martin tiene 41 años de edad, es separado y tiene un hijo, el cual se encuentra bajo su tutela, y por el que trabaja día a día. Don Martin es transportista, tiene una camioneta que la usa para el servicio de Acarreo, principalmente en las áreas de construcción y maderas. Actualmente tiene problemas con la caja de cambios de su vehículo, por lo que requiere del préstamo. Necesita comprar el repuesto e instalarlo en su vehículo y así poder seguir trabajando para darle el sustento a su hijo y a su madre a la que él ayuda económicamente.

loans.use: To change the gearbox of his truck

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Amelia, together with her spouse, is dedicated to the production of plastic cups and bowls, which she started on her own initiative and with loans to build the machine. She is 52 years old and has two children who are studying and in their free time help their parents with the business.

They have a small factory in their house, which is why their short term plans are to acquire more land so they can separate the factory from their house. They have six years of experience in this business and they want it to grow more. Doña Rosa asks for a loan to buy raw material to make these plastic items. Acquiring a bigger machine for this work is part of their plans to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa Amelia se dedica junto a su esposo a la elaboración de panas y vasos plásticos, el cual iniciaron por iniciativa propia y con créditos otorgados para construir la máquina. Tiene 52 años de edad y 2 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando y en sus tiempos libres le ayudan a sus padres en el negocio. Tienen la pequeña fábrica en su casa de habitación, es por eso que sus planes a corto plazo es adquirir un terreno para poder independizar la fábrica de su casa de habitación. Tienen 6 años de experiencia en este negocio, y debido al tiempo en esto quieren crecer más, y Doña Rosa solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima para la fabricación de estos artículos de plásticos. En sus planes de crecimiento está adquirir una máquina más grande para este trabajo.

loans.use: To buy raw material to produce plastic cups and bowls

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is married and has two children. She started her business because at the time they were still paying the house where they live and their income was very low. Six years ago she started selling clothing out of her mother's house and then she started selling clothing in bulk at the markets.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $825, to be paid in 6 months, to purchase clothing of the season in bulk. With your help she will continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Francisca es casada y tiene 2 hijos inició el negocio por que en ese momento todavía estaban pagando la casa donde viven y el ingreso que entraba era muy poco. Hace 6 años fuera de la casa de su madre empezó a vender ropa hasta meterse de lleno a los mercados para la venta por pacas.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $825 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar pacas de ropa de la temporada. Con tu ayuda ella seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cruz Adilia

texts.es:
Cruz Adilia is a woman of 36 years of age that lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua.  She is married and has 4 children, all of them school aged.   Her husband is a merchant that specializes in the sale of clothing. 

Cruz Adilia has a small grocery store in her house which she started with the help of her husband.  She has had this business for 6 years and with time it has grown despite the daily problems that she confronts, like the lack of electricity  and the delinquency in her neighborhood. 

She requests the loan in order to invest in supplying her business and generate greater earnings because she wants her store to someday become a wholesaler.   Her other wish is to be able to give her 4 children an education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Cruz Adilia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, que habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, de la ciudad de Managua, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos aún en edad escolar. Su esposo es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa. 

Cruz Adilia tiene una pulpería en su casa da habitación, la cual inició con la ayuda económica de su esposo, tiene 6 años de tener este negocio, con el tiempo ha venido creciendo a pesar de los problemas que a diario se enfrenta como es la falta de energía, y la delincuencia en su barrio. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio para así surtirlo y generar más ganancias porque quiere que su pulpería algún día llegue a convertirse en una distribuidora. Su otro anhelo es poder darles educación a sus 4 hijos para que lleguen a convertirse en unos buenos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to invest in her business

loans.name: Manuel Leoncio

texts.es:
Mr. Manuel P. is a 50 year old man who is a driver by profession. He has a 18 year old son. He is single and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. While he works his son takes charge of caring for the house.

He needs the loan in order to replace the roof of his house due to the coming winter and doesn't want to have problems from water leaks in the house. Don Manuel's dream is to have a respectable house to be able to eave to his son who is currently a student.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Don Manuel P. es un señor de 50 años de edad cuya profesión es Conductor. Tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, es soltero y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur. Mientras él se encuentra trabajando es su hijo quien se encarga de cuidar la casa por el día.

Necesita el préstamo para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, debido a la llegada del invierno y no quiere tener problemas por filtro de agua en su casa de habitación. El sueño de don Manuel es llegar a tener una casa digna para poder dejarla a su hijo quien actualmente se encuentra estudiando.

loans.use: To replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is married, and her husband works as a laborer. Together they have one son. She started this business to help her husband with the family expenses and make ends meet given their situation at the time. The little income her husband earned was not enough to subsist and lead a better quality of life. She started two years ago with a little stand where she sold soft drinks and tostadas (a popular Mexican dish) up until she opened her own grocery store, which she still runs today.

Currently, she is requesting a loan for US $150, which she will repay in 3 months, to invest in merchandise and do some minor remodeling to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel es casada su esposo trabaja como obrero y tiene un hijo. Inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y salir adelante dado la situación que pasaban en ese momento. El poco ingreso con que contaba su esposo no era suficiente para subsistir y llevar un mejor nivel de vida. Comenzó hace 2 años con un pequeño puesto de refrescos y tostadas hasta tener ya su propio negocio la tienda de abarrotes con el que hoy cuenta.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para invertir en mercancía y realizar una pequeña remodelación en su negocio

loans.use: Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata S., age 34, is married and takes care of four children. She has been a member and an assistant at the village bank of Boucotte Centre in Ziguinchor for three years. Her business consists of buying bissap (a flower use to make beverages), peanuts, and beans to resell. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve the well-being of her family. Aminata wants to strengthen her business. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aminata S., 34 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre et assistante au banc villageois de Boucotte Centre à Ziguinchor depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter du bissap, des arachides et des haricots pour les revendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être familial. Aminata veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy bissap, peanuts, and beans to resell

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is married and has a son. Her husband works as an employee. She started the business to help with the household expenses because her husband's salary was very low. Things were very hard with the small amount of income they had at that moment so she started selling shoes three years ago. At first she only handled orders by catalog and she was sharing the expenses in order to be able to keep the supply, until she was able to work independently and have her own client portfolio.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $150, to be paid in 3 months, to purchase a shelf to display her merchandise. With your help Teresa can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa es casada tiene un hijo y su esposo trabaja como empleado. Inició el negocio para apoyar los gastos de la casa dado que el sueldo de su esposo como empleado era demasiado bajo. La poca entrada de dinero con que se contaba en ese momento era muy difícil por lo que comenzó vendiendo zapatos hace 3 años solo trabajando pedidos por catalogo y compartiendo credenciales para poder surtir. Hasta lograr independizarse y contar con una cartera de clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un estante para demostraciones. Con tu apoyo Teresa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase a shelf to display her merchandise

loans.name: Ketty Rosana

texts.es:
Ketty belongs to the La Familia Community Bank, located inside the Pucallpa gas station, in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is the 38 year old mother of one son. Her husband is retired. With the first loan that Ketty received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin her business of food sales.

She relies on her business selliing food, for which she gets up at 6 a.m., in order to prepare breakfast for her son and husband, and afterwards she prepares for to sell at the gas station until 2 p.m.

With this loan of $500, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy provisions for food sales, including food, fruit, and a display case,etc.

Ketty is thankful for the peace of mind that comes from supporting her family, and for the self-value that comes from working for herself and moving her family forward, all thanks to Manuela Ramos's support of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ketty pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el interior del grifo Pucallpa, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es jubilado. Ketty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para luego venderlas en el interior de un grifo de la ciudad hasta las 2 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará víveres para ampliar su negocio de venta de comida, una vitrina, frutas, etc.

Ketty esta muy orgullosa y alegre, al fin puede estar tranquila y solventar los gastos de su familia, puede valerse y trabajar por si misma y sacar adelante a su familia, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Supplies for food production

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Perla Cecilia

texts.es:
Perla is married and has two children. She started her business to help her husband with the household expenses and to try to get ahead, since the financial situation they were going through was very difficult. Her husband was unemployed at that moment so there was no fixed income for the family. She got started three years ago buying second hand shoes in bulk. She now sells directly at the markets and now also sells shoes through catalogs.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of $300, which she will pay in 6 months, to purchase new shoes and shoes through catalogs in other to increase her earnings. With your help Perla can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Perla es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y salir adelante dada la situación que pasaban en ese momento era muy difícil. Su esposo en ese momento estaba desempleado y no había un ingreso fijo por lo que decidió apoyarlo. Comenzó hace 3 años comprando calzado de segunda por lote hasta vender ya directamente en mercados metiendo también la venta de calzado por catalogo.

Solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar calzado nuevo y por catalogo para incrementar sus ingresos. Con tu ayuda Perla saldría adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama G., age 40, is married and takes care of seven children. She has been a very energetic member of the village bank of Boucotte Nassinkar in Ziguinchor for six years. She wants a loan to buy palm oil to resell and some monkey bread (baobab fruit) and sugar to make ice cream to sell. Her income enables her to support her children and to contribute to her family's well-being. The requested loan will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mariama G., 40 ans, mariée, 7 enfants en charge est une membre très dynamique du banc villageois de Boucotte Nassinkar à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile de palme à revendre et du pain de singe et du sucre pour faire des crèmes glaces à vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir ses enfants et de contribuer au bien être familial. Le prêt sollicité sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, monkey bread, and sugar

loans.name: Gledys Melita

texts.es:
Gledys belongs to La Familia Community Bank, located in Humano Javier Perez, in the Calleria District in Ucayali. She is 42 years old, and is the mother of three children. Her husband works in business. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create her seamstress and clothing sales business.

She relies on her business as a seamstress, and also selling grilled snacks, parrillidas. She rises at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and afterwards, works on her linens and sells them, and on weekends she prepares parrilladas and sells them from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.

With this loan of $500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: cotton cloth, thread, material, and chickens.

Gledys is happy and thankful that all that she has achieved in life, she obtained through her own strength and conviction with the main concern of seeing out the well-being of her children and knowing that her support of them is vital.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gledys pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Javier Pérez de Cuellar Mz C Lt 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Gledys con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de confección y venta de lencería.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de confección y venta de lencería y también venta de parrilladas mixtas para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo, después se dedica a la confección de su lencería para venderlo de manera casual, los fines de semana prepara sus parrilladas mixtas y los vende desde las 9 am hasta las 3 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: telas de algodón, hilos, blondas, pollos, etc.

Gledys esta muy feliz y satisfecha, todo lo que logro en su vida lo obtuvo por su propio esfuerzo y convicción con el único afán de ver bien a sus hijos pues el apoyo que les da es vital para ellos, esta muy agradecida con la ayuda que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Merchandise for food production

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma S. is married and has two children. She started her business when she realized that one salary was not enough to support her family, thus she decided to help her husband. They come from a small town so when they arrived at the city they did not have a job. Because of this she was forced to find a way to generate an income. She started by having her husband sell novelties, such as backpacks, caps, etc; door to door until they were able to get established at their home.

Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of $300, which she will pay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Irma will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Irma S. es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio por necesidad para apoyar a su familia dado que un solo sueldo no era suficiente y decidió ayudarle a su esposo. Ellos venían de un pueblo por lo que al llegar a la ciudad no contaban con un trabajo lo que la obligo a buscar la manera de generar ingresos. Comenzó hace 4 años con su esposo vendiendo novedades casa por casa mochilas, gorras, etc. hasta establecerse en su casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancías. Con tu ayuda Irma saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Gladys Eulalia Del S

texts.es:
Gladys is a single mother of two children, ages 17 and 8. She started her business when she realized that she could not cover all their expenses with her salary. She decided to start selling hamburgers and hot dogs out of her brother in-law's house. Gradually she started to get customers and now she wants to give her business a better presentation.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400, that she will pay in 6 months, to purchase a grill and a display case made of aluminum and glass. With your support Gladis will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Gladys, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años. Empezó su negocio al ver que no alcanzaba a cubrir sus gastos con el salario que ganaba, por lo que decidió iniciar la venta de hamburguesas y hot dogs en casa de su cuñado, poco a poco fue ganando clientes y ahora desea montar el negocio con una mejor presentación.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara 6 en meses para adquirir una parrilla y una vitrina de aluminio y cristal. Con tu apoyo Gladis saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase a grill

loans.name: Lena Karina

texts.es:
Lena belongs to La Familia Community Bank, located in the Calleria District, in Ucayalo. She is 40 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a businessman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Lena decided to begin selling merchandise. She relies on her business, for which she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children, her husband, and afterwards works selling merchandise, distributing to clients until 5 p.m. With this loan of $600, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy women’s, men’s, children’s clothing, household accessories, shoes, etc. Lena is proud of herself; only with the initiative for self-improvement could she overcome many obstacles, and it is for this principle that she now works independently, managing her own income, and is very thankful for the loan from Manuela Ramos which has helped her to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lena pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. 16 de Noviembre No 340, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Lena con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de su mercadería, repartiendo a sus clientes hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas de damas caballeros y niños, accesorios para el hogar, zapatos, pasamanería, etc. Lena esta muy orgullosa de si misma, sólo con ganas de salir adelante y esfuerzo pudo vencer muchas barreras que se le presentaban, es por eso que ahora puede trabajar de manera independiente y manejar sus propios ingresos, y esta muy agradecida con la ayuda que le presta Manuela Ramos para salir adelante.

loans.use: Merchandise for sale

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura belongs to the Las Shipibas Community Bank in Jr. Martir Olaya, in the Calleria District in Ucayali. She is 26 years old and the mother of 1 child. Her husband works with cars and motorcycles. With the first loan Laura received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin a second-hand clothing store.

She relies on her second-hand store and raising chickens, for which she rises at 7 a.m., in order to prepare breakfast for her son and husband. Afterwards, she does household chores and takes care of her son and chickens.

With this loan of $300, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy used clothing and chicken feed.

Laura is happy and thankful, now that she is working independently and managing her own income. She is pleased with the support that Manuela Ramos has brought to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr Martir Olaya No 130, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es motocarrista. Laura con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de ropas usadas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta ropas usadas y con la crianza de pollos en su galpón para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo, y de su esposo luego se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo y de sus pollitos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas usadas y alimento balanceado para sus pollitos.

Laura esta muy feliz y agradecida, ahora puede trabajar de manera independiente y manejar sus propias ganancias, esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more chickens, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha belongs to Las Shipibas Community Bank, located on the corner of Jr. Sáenz Peña and Jr. Tarapacá, in the Calleria District in Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a businessman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create a food sales business.

She relies on her street food sales, for which she rises at 6 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and husband. Afterwards she prepares food, which she sells from 6 p.m. to 1 a.m. With this loan of $750, which she will repay in months, she will little by little, buy provisions for food sales.

Martha is satisfied and pleased about all that she has pursued with her strength and sacrifice, and that she can support household costs, and she is thankful for the support brought by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en la esquina del Jr Sáenz Peña con el Jr Tarapacá, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Martha con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comida en la calle, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas, que los vende desde las 6 pm hasta la 1 am.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: víveres para la preparación de sus comidas, el cual los invertirá de poco en poco.

Martha esta muy satisfecha y contenta, todo lo que tiene lo consiguió a base de esfuerzo y sacrificio, ahora puede apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, y se siente muy feliz por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Provisions for food production

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Laura belongs to La Familia Community Bank, located in the Calleria District of Ucyali, Peru. She is 55 years old, and has one child. With the first loan Laura received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create a business making and selling shoes.

She relied on her shoe sales and sells parrilladas, for which she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her son, and afterwards works making shoes to sells to her clients, and weekends, she sells her parralladas from 9a.m. until 3 p.m.

With this loan of $850, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of onions and potatoes, and several types of vegetables to sell.

Lola is thankful for the support brought by Manuela Ramos, which has helped her to afford the costs of her family, and move forward with optimism and assuredness. She is a businesswoman who works hard to overcome any difficulty.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lola pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la calle 16 Mz 16 Lt 4, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Lola con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300.00 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de confección y venta de zapatos.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de confección y venta de zapatos y también venta de parrilladas mixtas para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de su hijo, y de allí se dedica a la confección de sus zapatos para venderlos a sus clientes, los fines de semana vende sus parrilladas desde las 9 am hasta las 3 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz 1 saco de cebolla medio saco de papa y todo tipo de verduras para la venta del Menú.

Lola esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ese apoyo puede solventar los gastos de su familia y así seguir saliendo adelante con optimismo y decisión, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora pues no piensa rendirse ante ninguna dificultad.

loans.use: Provisions for food sales, shoe sales

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Senora Nimia is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located in the district of Manantay in Ucayali. She is 43 years old and has 5 children. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business selling food and drinks. Today, she continues to run her business with the help of her children. They get up early to prepare the food, and then they sell the meals in the afternoon.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will expand her business by buying more utensils, sodas and sweets. Nimia appreciates the loans and she feels comfortable that she can continue to work with a good support system in place to help women like herself.

La señora Nimia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Nueva América Mz 17 Lt. 1-2, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 5 hijos. Nimia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida y golosinas. En la actualidad continua con su venta de comida y golosinas, con la ayuda de sus hijos se levantan temprano para dedicarse a la preparación de sus comidas, y en las tardes sale a vender sus comidas. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implantara su negocio con la compra de utensilios, gaseosas, y golosinas en general. Nimia agradece el préstamo que le brindo Manuela Ramos, a través de su banco comunal así mismo se siente muy cómoda de seguir trabajando con un buen respaldo y apoyo para todas las mujeres.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE UTENSILS, SODAS AND SWEETS TO CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Mirna Enith

texts.es:
Senora Mirna is a member of the communal bank La Familia, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 50 years old and has 3 children. With the first loan she received, she invested in a business buying and selling wood. She continues to run this business, getting up at 5 in the morning to make breakfast for her children, and then proceeding to oversee the sales of the wood until 1 in the afternoon. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in different types of wood to offer her customers.

Mirna is content and grateful. Thanks to the help she has received, her business is growing more every day and she is able to better support her children and pay for their education. She feels proud of what she is accomplishing

La señora Mirna pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Psj Nuevo Mundo Mz C Lt 11, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 3 hijos, Mirna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de madera. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de madera, para lo cual se levanta a las 5 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de allí se dirige al aserradero para controlar la venta de su madera hasta las 1 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará maderas de las especies shihuahuaco, estoraque, etc. Mirna esta muy contenta y agradecida, gracias al apoyo de manuela ramos su negocio crece cada día mas, sus ingresos están aumentando y así puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, se siente realizada como mujer.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS BUYING AND SELLING WOOD.  WITH THE LOAN, SHE WILL  BUY DIFFERENT TYPES OF WOOD TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Peggy Ysabel

texts.es:
Peggy is a member of the communal bank called La Familia, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 30 years old and has 2 children. With the first loan she received, Peggy invested in a business selling sodas. Today she has grown the business and now sells food and drinks, getting up at 6am each day to prepare breakfast for her childen and husband, and she works in her general store during the day. Her husband also works.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more sodas and the ingredients she needs to prepare the meals and snacks she sells. Peggy is pleased with her work. She is realizing her goals and overcoming obstacles with hard work and courage. Now she can help support her family thanks to her work. She is grateful for the help she has received.

La señora Peggy pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Urb. JJ. Muñoz MZ A Lt 23, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Peggy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comida y de gaseosas para lo cual se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de sus comidas hasta las 11 am. Con este préstamo de S/. 1 600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará gaseosas e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas. Peggy se siente muy contenta, esta haciendo realidad sus metas y a superado las adversidades que se le presentaron con esfuerzo y valentía, ahora puede apoyar a su familia gracias a su trabajo, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER GENERAL STORE, AS WELL AS INGREDIENTS SHE NEEDS TO PREPARE THE MEALS AND SNACKS SHE SELLS.

loans.name: Olmit

texts.es:
Senora Rosa is a member of the communal bank called Shipibas, located in the district of Yarinacocha in Ucayali, Peri. Rosa is 41 years old the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan she received, she invested in a small spare parts business. Today, she continues to run her business which has grown and expanded, as well another business selling food. She gets up at 6am to make breakfast for her family, then she prepares the meals which she will sell between 12 and 3, and afterwards she helps her husband in the shop until 6pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase ingredients needed to prepare the meals she sells, as well as napkins, glasses, chairs, etc. She is pleased with the work she is doing. She is considered a hardworking and enterprising woman, achieving what she has through hard work and the dedication to improving her family's quality of life. She is very grateful for the help she has received.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal las Shipibas ubicado en la Av Yarina S/N, del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Olmit con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller de vulcanizado de llantas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de repuestos de motos y de vulcanizado, y un negocio de venta de comida para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas que lo vende desde las 12 pm hasta las 3 pm y de allí apoya a su esposo en la atención de su vulcanizadota hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará víveres para la preparación de sus comidas, parches, rodajes, llantas, etc. también comprará cubiertos, vasos, sillas, manteles, etc. Olmit esta muy alegre, ella se considera una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora todo lo que consiguió hasta ahora lo hizo en base a esfuerzo y empeño con el único afán de apoyar y salir adelante a su familia, y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER BUSINESSES, CONTINUE TO  INCREASE HER INCOME AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Senora Sarita is a member of the communal bank called La Familia, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 46 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband works as a driver. With the first loan she received, she invested in a business preparing and selling food. Today she continues to run this business, getting up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her family, and then dedicates herself to her business during the day.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals as well as the fruits she needs to prepare her drinks. Sarita is a hardworking woman who has been able to help improve the quality of life for her family. She is grateful for the help she has received for her business.

La señora Sarita pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Eduardo del Águila Tello Mz A Lt 25, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Sarita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comida para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de su hijos, y de su esposo,luego se dedica a la venta de sus comidas en una aserradero hasta las 3 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará productos alimenticios para la preparación de sus comidas y frutas para la preparación de sus refrescos. Sarita se considera una mujer trabajadora que supo salir adelante con sus hijos y con su esposo ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS, CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS AND PROVIDE FOR HER FAMILY'S WELLBEING.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Senora Rosa is a member of the communal bank called Mujeres Creativas, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 58 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a longshoreman. With the first loan she received, Rosa invested in a business preparing and selling food. Today she continues to run her business selling food from a street stall in the evenings. She gets up at 7am to make breakfast for her family, and then she prepares the meals she will sell later that day from 6pm until 11pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase ingredients she needs to prepare her meals, as well as glasses, napkins, chairs, etc. Rosa is very enthusiastic and content with her business. She has had to work hard to reach her objectives and is now able to help support her family.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas II, ubicado en la Urb. Nueva América Mz 5 Lt 21, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es estibador. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.
