En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida en la calle en las noches, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas, que los vende desde las 6 pm hasta la 11pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará víveres para la preparación de sus comidas, también comprará cubiertos, vasos, sillas, manteles, etc. Rosa esta muy entusiasmada y contenta, ella se volvió una mujer trabajadora y luchadora con el fin de hacer realidad sus objetivos y así poder ayudar a sus familiares

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS, CONTINUE TO EARN INCOME AND HELP SUPPORT HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jesus belongs to the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at Jr. Tiwinsa Mz. D Lt. 6, in the district of Manaytay in the city of Ucayali. She is 28 years old is a mother of 3 children, her husband is a teacher. Jesus used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos totalling S/.300 to invest in the sales of soft drinks.

Today she continues selling soft drinks and she also sells prepared foods. In the mornings she manages the household chores and at in the evenings she manages her small business while helping her children with their homework.

With the loan she recevies totalling S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase: soft drinks, food ingredients, and snacks to offer more variety to her clients.

Jesus is very happy with the results she has seen and and also because she feels more economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Tiwinsa Mz. D Lt. 6, del Distrito de Manaytay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es profesor, Jesús con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad continua con su venta de gaseosas y también se dedica a la venta de comidas, por las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas de su hogar así mismo atiende su negocio y por las noches ayuda a sus hijos con sus tareas escolares. Con este préstamo recibido de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de diferentes precios, víveres para la venta de sus comidas, golosinas para ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes. Jesús se siente muy feliz por los resultados que tiene y además por que se siente mas independiente económicamente.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase ingredients for the preparation of her foods.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at Asentamiento Human Rumbo al Futuro Mz 3 Lt.7, in the district of Manantay in the city of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and is mother of 3 children, her husband is a worker for the telephone company. Blanca used her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/.300 to invest in a small grocery store.

Her grocery store has expanded and now she sells more bread products. In the morning she manages her house chores and cares for her children and gets them ready for school and in the afternoons she manages her grocery store.

With this loan in the amount of S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, and a pack of pasta, some preserves, soft drinks, breads, snacks, etc..

Blanca is happy because thanks to the loan received from Manuela Ramos she and her family are keeping well, and that makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Rumbo al Futuro Mz 3 Lt. 7, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es trabajador de Telefónica, es así que Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido ahora vende mas productos de pan llevar, en las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas y atender a sus hijos para llevarlos al colegio y en las tardes se ocupa de la atención de su bodega. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideos, conservas, gaseosas, pan, golosinas, etc. Blanca esta contenta por que gracias al préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos ella y su familia están saliendo adelante y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
The municipality of El Sauce of the city of Leon is characterized for being one of the zones with greater percentage of cattle in Nicaragua and is for this reason that nowadays there are many whose job is raising cattle. Among these people is Mr. Raymundo Rio Torrez who has his own cattle, to which he provides the necessary and adequate care.

He is the father of three children who despite of their short age and the time they dedicate to school, support their father by milking the cows, as well as with any other chores related to raising the cattle. One of the problems that Mr. Raymundo has is the need to invest in new cattle so he can breed them. This is the reason why Mr. Raymundo is seeking the opportune support of Ceprodel, so he can obtain the necessary economic resources to purchase the cattle and thus, improve the conditions of his business and therefore, the lifestyle of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

El municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León se caracteriza por ser una de las zonas con mayor porcentaje ganadero en Nicaragua y es por esta razón que hoy en día son muchos los que se dedican a esta labor en esta localidad. Entre estas personas se encuentra el señor Raymundo Rio Torrez que posee su propio ganado al que día a día alimenta adecuadamente y da el cuido necesario para su desarrollo.

Es padre de tres hijos que a pesar de su corta edad y de que son estudiantes, le apoyan a su padre tanto en la extracción de la leche como en la guiaza de los animales de un punto a otro. La problemática por la que transcurre el señor Raymundo es la necesidad de invertir en nuevas vaquillas para su crianza es por esto que busca el apoyo oportuno en Ceprodel para lograr obtener el recurso económico que de lugar a la compra del ganado y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y las de su familia.

loans.use: To Purchase Cattle to Breed

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith belongs to the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at 500 Aguaytia Avenue, in the distric of Manaytay in the city of Ucayali. She is 67 years old is mother to 6 children, her husband is an independent worker. With the first loan Judith received from Manuel Ramos in the amount of S/.300 she decided to invest it in the sales of candy suckers.

Today she depends on her small grocery store, and renting lodging, and with the help of her children and husband she manages the grocery store and administer the room rentals.

With the loan she received in the amount of S/.1200 which she will repay in a term of 4 months, she will purchase construction materials to build more rooms to rent, and she will also purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

Judith feels happy that she is able to develop and expand her busienss every day, she is a hard working woman with a great deal of vitality.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en la Av. Aguaytia 500, del Distrito D. Manaytay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente, es así que Judith con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. chupetes. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega, y alquiler D. cuartos, con la ayuda D. sus hijos y su esposo atienD. su bodega y administran su alquiler D. cuartos. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/.1,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará materiales D. construcción para construir mas cuartos, también comprará abarrotes para su bodega. Judith se siente contenta pueD. avanzar y crecer cada día con su negocio, es una mujer luchadora y con una gran vitalidad,

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her sales.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana belongs to the community Bank Mujeres Creatives 2, located at Jr. Maya de Britto and Alfonso Ugarte, in the district Calleria in the city of Ucayali. She is 32 years old and she has 1 child, and she is divorced. Juana with the first loan she received in the amount of S/.300 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest the funds in the buying and selling of fish.

Today she sells her fish in teh Bellavista market, for which she starts her day at 4a.m. to get her stand ready for sales she carries on until 11a.m.. Afterward she goes back home to care for her little boy and her home.

With this loan amounting S/.700, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase: different kinds of fish.

Juana is very happy because thanks to this loan she will receive through the community bank she has progressed in her business and her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto con Alfonso Ugarte, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años es madre de 1 hijo, es divorciada,. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de pescado. En la actualidad ella vende sus pescados en el mercado de Bellavista, se levanta a las 4 am. de la mañana para ir a su puesto de venta y ofrecer sus pescados hasta las 11 am., luego se dirige a su hogar para atender a su pequeño hijo y su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: pescados de diferentes especies, como paco, gamitada, boquichico, palometa, sardinas, carachama, etc. Juana esta feliz, por que gracias a este préstamo recibido a través de su banco comunal esta progresando en su negocio y en su vida familiar.

loans.use: With the loan she will be able to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda is a member of the community bank Mujeres Creatives 2, located at 35 Walter MZ B Lt. Street in Santa Clara, in the disctrict of Manaytay in the city of Ucayali. She is 54 years old and is a mother of 4 children, her husband is a nurse. Lucinda with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300 decided to invest the funds on the sales of candy lollipops.

Today she depends on the sale of her candy, and she starts day very early to do household chores and make her candy, that she sells from her own home and they have become very popular because they are soo delicious.

With this loan of S/800 which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase ingredients such as flavoruings, locally grown fruits, sugar, milk, and small bags to wrap her candy.

Lucinda is very grateful for her loans provided by Manuel Ramos and she is grateful towards her community bank for the support they are providing her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en la Calle Walter Mz. B Lt. 35 Santa Clara, del Distrito de Manaytay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es enfermero, es así que Lucinda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de chupetes. En la actualidad cuenta con su venta chupetes, se levanta muy temprano para realizar las tareas domesticas y a la vez prepara sus chupetes que vende en su propia casa y tiene mucha aceptación por los ricos que son. Con este préstamo de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ingredientes como saborizantes, frutas de la región, azúcar, leche, y bolsas para envasar sus chupetes Lucinda esta muy agradecida a los préstamos que le brinda Manuela Ramos y a su banco comunal por todo el apoyo que le están brindando.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase ingredients for the preparation of her products.

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
Leovina is a member of the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at 35 Walter Mz B Lt. Street in Santa Clara, in the disctict of Manaytay in the city of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and is mother of 4 children, her husband works in civil construction. Leovina with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300 decided to invest in the purchase of lollipops.

Today she depens on the sales of her lollipops and on the sales of her foods, but for this work she starts he rday very early in the morning with her children to prepare the lollipops and foods, and at the same time they do house chores, and by the evenings they sell their products.

With this loan of S/.1200 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, a half sack of sugar, meats, condiments, and ingredients for their lollipops.

Leovina is a hard working woman, and each day she fights hard to provide the best of her children and mold them into good people.

Tranlsated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leovina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en la Calle Walter Mz. B Lt. 35 Santa Clara, del Distrito de Manaytay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil, Leovina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de chupetes. En la actualidad cuenta con su venta chupetes y una pequeña venta de comida, para ello se levanta muy temprano y con la ayuda de sus hijos preparan sus chupetes y comidas, y a la vez realizan las tareas domesticas, y por las noches vende sus productos. Con este préstamo recibido de S/.1,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, carnes, condimentos, y insumos para sus chupetes. Leonina es una mujer trabajadora, cada día se esfuerza para darles lo mejor a sus hijos para hacerlos hombres de bien .

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more ingredients for the preparation of her products.

loans.name: Segunda Maria

texts.es:
Segunda belongs to the “Mujeres Creativas 2” Communal Bank, located at Av. Santa Clara Mz. A Lt. 6, in Manaytay, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 56 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband works as a carpenter.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Segunda invested in food sales. Currently she continues selling food outside a sawmill. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. and, with her children’s help, prepares food to take and sell to her clients who anxiously await her delicious stews. She spends her afternoons taking care of her home.

With this loan of $300, which she plans to repay in four months, she will expand her business by buying a blender along with local fruits to make juice so she can have more clients. The rest of the money will be used to buy ingredients to prepare the food she will sell.

Segunda thanks Manuela Ramos for the help she receives to grow her business. She now feels much more sure of herself.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Segunda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en la Av Santa Clara Mz. A Lt. 6, del Distrito de Manaytay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en madera. Segunda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad continua con su venta de comida afuera de un aserradero, se levanta a las 4 am., con la ayuda de sus hijos alistan sus comidas y llevan a vender a sus clientes que con ansias esperan sus ricos potajes, por las tardes se dedica a su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliara su negocio y comprará una licuadora, frutas regionales para vender jugos y así tener mas clientes, y el resto loinvirtira en víveres para la comidas que venderá. Segunda da gracias a Manuela Ramos por que esta haciendo crecer su negocio y ahora se siente mas segura de si misma.

loans.use: Purchase blender and fruit to make juices along with ingredients needed to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the Communal Bank “The Shipibas”, located in the Jetty Grau, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and is a mother of 4 children. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. With the first loan she received of 300 PEN, she decided to invest it in order to buy and sell regional products. Currently, she sells bananas, regional fruits and beans. She leaves her home early to set up her shop and drives to the port of the city. It is her sales that allow her to support her family and give a better life to her children.

With this loan of 1,500 PEN, which will be paid in four months, she will buy green bananas, maduros, sapotes, faro, tangerines, oranges, cocona etc. Sara is very happy to work with Manuela Ramos because it allows her to work independently and is a big help for women.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Malecón Grau, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, Verita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de productos de la región.

En la actualidad vende plátano, frutas regionales, fréjoles, para ello se levanta temprano y se dirige al puerto de nuestra ciudad a ofrecer sus productos y así poder llevar sustento económico a su familia y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará plátanos verdes, maduros, sapotes, fariña, mandarina, naranja, cocona, etc.

Sara esta muy contenta de trabajar con Manuela Ramos por que le permite trabajar independientemente y es una gran ayuda para las mujeres.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
Yolita belongs to the Communal Bank “The Shipibas”, located in the Jr. Mayan of Britto Cdra. 1, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 57 years old and is a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income does not cover the costs of daily life for the family, so Yolita initially took out a loan of 300 PEN from Manuela Ramos in order to start her own business of buying and selling fish.

Currently she sells fish in the Bellavista market and begins her sales very early in the morning. She goes home each day at noon and attends to her children and her home. With this loan of 1,800 PEN, she will be able to buy various types of fish, including sardines, etc. and will be able to invest in products which she can sell for people’s homes. Yolita believes that the services offered by Manuel Ramos are a great support and it is thanks to those loans that her children are able to study while she continues to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yolita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto Cdra. 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Yolita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de pescado.

En la actualidad vende sus pescado en el mercado de Bellavista, se va muy temprano para empezar su venta del día hasta las 12 pm, en las tardes atiende a sus hijos y su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará pescados de diferentes especies como sardina, palometa, bagre, etc, y una parte lo invirtira en mercadería para vender a domicilio.

Yolita nos cuenta que los préstamos de Manuela Ramos son un apoyo excelente, gracias a eso puede hacer estudiar a sus hijos y sigue apoyándolos para que salgan adelante y sean todos unos profesionales de éxito.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more fish for her store

loans.name: Verita Luz

texts.es:
Verita belongs to the Communal Bank “The Shipibas”, located in the Jr. Mayan of Britto Cdra 1, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and is a mother of 7 children. Her husband is a merchant, and upon seeing that his money could not support their daily life she decided to take out a loan. She received a loan of 300 PEN and decided to use it to purchase and sell faro, tapioca and beans.

Currently, she sells her products in Bellavista market, and begins selling very early each day. At night she rests to have the energy to be able to continue business the next day.

With this loan of 1,000 PEN (approximately $375), which will be repaid in four months, she will buy 20 kg of tapioca and 20 kg of beans. Verita says that the branches of Manuela Ramos provides great aupport and allows her the opportunity to work and to be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Verita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto Cdra 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, al ver que no le alcanzaba el dinero para su economía diaria decide sacar un préstamo, es así que Verita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de fariña, tapioca y menestras.

En la actualidad vende sus productos en el mercado de bellavista, se va muy temprano para empezar su venta del día, y en las noches descansa para tener energías para el día siguiente siempre dándole para adelante.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 20 Kg. de fariña, 20 Kg. de tapioca, 20 Kg. de fréjol.

Verita dice que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es un gran apoyo por que le permite trabajar y puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar.

La señora Verita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto Cdra 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, al ver que no le alcanzaba el dinero para su economía diaria decide sacar un préstamo, es así que Verita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de fariña, tapioca y menestras. En la actualidad vende sus productos en el mercado de bellavista, se va muy temprano para empezar su venta del día, y en las noches descansa para tener energías para el día siguiente siempre dándole para adelante. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 20 Kg. de fariña, 20 Kg. de tapioca, 20 Kg. de fréjol. Verita dice que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es un gran apoyo por que le permite trabajar y puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more products to sell

loans.name: Marielos

texts.es:
Marielos is requesting a loan in order to invest it in the improvement of her house, located in the municipality of Nueva Guinea.  This is an area in which, despite being a productive region, the salaries provided to the teachers are very low.   Marielos has been a high school teacher for 18 years.  Marielos is also a small businesswoman that sells cosmetics in the afternoon. 

It's important to mention that Marielos, with the previous loans provided by AFODENIC, has improved her home to a great extent and has improved the life of her 3 children.  The oldest daughter is 16 years old and is currently in her 4th year of secondary school, her 2nd son is 8 years old and is studying in the 2nd grade of primary education and her youngest son is 2 years old.  Her husband works for a company marketing roots and tubers(plant) and with this loan they want to repair the roof over the kitchen that is in bad shape and finish building some bathrooms.  Marielos is a woman that dreams about a better future and that her children have the basics in economic terms as well as their studies. 

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Marielos está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea, este es un municipio que a pesar de ser una zona productiva los salarios que devengan los maestros es muy poco,  es docente de educación secundaria  desde hace 18 años. Marielos es también una pequeña comerciante, que por las tardes se dedica a vender cosméticos.

Es importante mencionar que Marielos con los créditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC a mejorado su vivienda en gran medida y ha mejorado la condicion de vida de sus 3 hijos, la hija mayor tiene 16 años actualmente esta cursando 4to año de secundaria, el otro niño tiene 8 años de edad estudia 2do grado de educación primaria y el niño menor de 2 años. Su esposo trabaja para una empresa comercializadora de raíces y tubérculos, con este préstamo pretende cambiar el techo de la cocina que se encuentra en mal estado y terminar de construir los servicios higiénicos. Marielos es una mujer que sueña con tener un porvenir mejor y que sus hijos tengan siempre lo básico tanto en lo económico como en sus estudios.

loans.use: To change the roof of her house and finish building bathrooms

loans.name: Libaña

texts.es:
Libaña belongs to the Communal Bank The Family, located in the Av. Centenario Km. 3,800, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 60 years old and is a mother of three children. Her husband is a merchant. With the first loan of 300 PEN she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in the sale of food and frozen drinks. Currently, she sells carbonated water, sandwiches and cakes in the entrance to the factory of Gaseosas Kola Real. In the morning she spends her time at home and in the evening she leaves to sell her goods. She is very attentive to her clients, very nice and always very happy.

With this loan of 2,000 PEN (about $700), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy carbonated water, sweets and supplies for baking cakes.

Libaña feels very good that her business is growing each day because it allows her to be able to help her family and feel more useful and independent.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Hernandez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Libaña pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. Centenario Km. 3.800, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Melita con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comida y bebidas heladas.

En la actualidad venD. gaseosas, sanwichs, queques en la puerta D. la fábrica D. gaseosas Kola Real, en las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las noches sale a vender, para tener mas clientes Libaña atienD. a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y siempre con mucha alegría.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará gaseosas, golosinas, insumos para sus queques.

Libaña se siente muy bien su negocio esta creciendo día a día con mucho esfuerzo así pueD. ayudar a su familia y sentirse útil e independiente.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products for her business

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva belongs to the El Banco Comunal La Familia, located in the Jr Huancavelica 154, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old is a mother of 4 children, she is a widow, and her income does not support her daily life. Elva decided to invest the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for $300 to buy and sell fish.

Elva has a three-wheeled delivery vehicle and continues to sell fish, working for an company of the state and with the help of her children she moves forward with her business. She is very proud of her children as they are her biggest source of support.

With this loan of S/ 1.700 which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy different species of fish. She will also put money toward the maintenance of her three-wheeled delivery vehicle and other parts she needs for her business.

Necy is a woman that was widowed at a very young age and had to move forward alone with her children. She3 is very proud of her children who are now professionals and who help her. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos, who supported her when she needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr Huancavelica 154, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 años es madre D. 4 hijos, es viuda, y el ingreso que tenia no le alcanzaba para su economía diaria, es así que Elva con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta D. pescados.

En la actualidad tiene un motocarro y sigue con su venta D. pescado, trabaja en una entidad del estado y con la ayuda D. sus hijos salen adelante en su negocio y esta muy orgullosa D. ellos por que son su mas granD. apoyo .

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará diferentes especies D. pescados, también le dará mantenimiento para su motocarro y algunas piezas que necesitaba.

Necy es una mujer que quedo viuda muy joven, y tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos sola pero esta muy orgullosa D. ello por que ya son profesionales y la apoyan. Esta muy contenta con Manuela Ramos porque la apoyo cuando más lo necesitaba.

loans.use: With the loand she will purchase different essential products for her current business

loans.name: Saribel

texts.es:
Saribel is a teacher at Manteles Verdes school.   She is married and she and her husband own a small piece of land where they plants crops like pineapple, yucca, malanga and papaya.  In the afternoon Saribel helps her husband with the crops and also works in the home.  She has a 8 year old daughter that is studying in the 3rd grade.  

Saribel started volunteering giving classes without earning any salary and has been an exemplary woman by helping her community bringing education to the rural children in her region. 

She requests a loan to build a bedroom in her house to continue improving it as she has been doing for many years.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Saribel es docente de la Escuela Manteles Verdes, es casada. Ambos poseen una pequeña tierra en donde simbran cultivos como piña, yuca, quequisque y papaya. Saribel por las tardes le ayuda a su marido en estos cultivos, además que se dedica también a su hogar. Tienen una hija de 8 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando el tercer grado de primaria.

Saribel inició dando clases de manera voluntaria, sin devengar salario alguno, ha sido un ejemplo de mujer ya que ayudo a su comunidad llevando el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de su comarca.

Requiere del préstamo para construir una habitación en su casa de habitación, y así seguir mejorandola como ya desde muchos años lo ha venido haciendo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a bedroom in her house

loans.name: Melita Tipto

texts.es:
Melita belongs to the Banco Comunal La Familia group, located in Av. Alfredo Eglintong Mz C Lt. 1, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 63 years old and has 3 kids. Her husband makes metal sheets, but his income is not enough to keep them afloat. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos of $300 Melita invested in selling food and cold drinks.

Now she is still selling food. She gets up at 6am and with the help of her kids she makes delicious vegetable stews and on the weekend she goes out and sells, so that she gets more clients. Melita cooks very well so her clients are always happy.

With this loan of $1500, which she will repay over a period of 4 motnhs, she will buy tablecloths, plates, disposable spoons, rice etc.

Melita says that she has always liked to work; it makes her feel independent, and she likes her business as she can speak to her clients and she makes lots of friends, and this makes her feel more like a woman and businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Melita pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. Alfredo Eglintong Mz C Lt. 1, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es laminador, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Melita con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comida y bebidas heladas. En la actualidad continua con la venta D. comidas, se levanta a las 6a.m. con la ayuda D. sus hijos preparan los ricos potajes y los fines D. semana sale a vender y para tener mas clientela. Melita cocina rico sus clientes se van muy felices y contentos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: manteles, platos, cucharas gaseosas, arroz, etc. Melita dice que siempre le gusto trabajar sentirse independiente por eso le gusta su negocio por que pueD. conversar con sus clientes y hacer muchos amigos, eso la hace sentirme mas realizada como mujer y empresaria.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy merchandise to sell/Con el prestamo comprara  su mercaderia para su venta

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa belongs to the Banco Comunal La Familia group, located in Jr Urubamba 798, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has 4 kids, he husband is a welder. With the first loan of $300 that Maria Luisa received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small grocery store.

Now this small store has grown and she has a store which sells gas and has a small public telephone so that she can earn more and enjoy better finances. Her kids look after the store whilst she works.

With this loan of $2500, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, oil, fizzy drinks, carbon and some construction materials to sell gas.

Maria Luisa is very grateful that Manuela Ramos will help make her dreams come true: her store will grow and thanks to this her kids will be able to study.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Luisa pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr. Urubamba 798, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es soldador, Maria Luisa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido y esta implementando un local para venta D. gas y un teléfono publico para poder generar mas ingresos y gozar D. una buena economía, con la ayuda D. sus hijos atienD. su bodega mientras ella trabaja. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/ 2,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, carbón y materiales D. construcción para su local D. venta D. gas. Maria Luisa esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por hacer realidad sus sueños D. ver crecer su bodega, gracias a ello pueD. hacer estudiar a sus hijos.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell/Con el prestamo comprara mas mercaderia para su venta

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the Banco Comunal La Familia group, located in Jr Alfonso Ugarte 449, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 38 years olds and has 5 kids. Her husband works with wood. With the first loan of $300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Sara decided to invest in the buying and selling of wood.

Now she has a small woodshop where she sells and chops wood, and with her husbands help and her effort and dedication, the business is going well.

With this loan of $1300, that she will pay back over a period of 4 months, she will buy different types of wood, like Peruvian cherry, 'bolaina' and mahogany.

Sara is very enthusiastic and dedicated to her business, which she looks after very carefully as her clients are the only way that she can make progress and give her family the best.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr Alfonso Ugarte 449, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo trabaja en madera. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de madera. En la actualidad cuenta con un mini aserradero donde se dedica a la venta y aserrado de madera, con la ayuda de su esposo esta sacando adelante el negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará diferentes especies de madera, como quinilla, bolaina, caoba, etc. Sara tiene una energía y dedicación para su negocio, el cual atiende con mucho esmero por que sus clientes son la razón de ser para que ella pueda seguir progresando y darle lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more wood to sell/Con el prestamo comprara mas madera para su venta

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Americas group, located in the Jr 23 de Febrero 443 Micaela Bastidas, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 21 years old and is single. With the first loan of $300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Pilar decided to invest in buying beauty products to sell.

Now, she is still selling cosmetics. She studies in the morning and in the afternoons she goes round to people's homes to sell her products.

With the loan of $800 which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy perfumes, lip liners, eye shadow, cologne, talc, jewellery etc.

Pilar is very happy with her business, as she can now pay for her studies and feels safer and more independent.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Pilar pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Americas, ubicado en el Jr 23 de Febrero 443 Micaela Bastidas, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años es soltera, Pilar con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de productos de belleza En la actualidad continua con su venta de cosméticos, por las mañanas estudia y en las tardes se dedica a ofrecer sus productos a domicilio. Con este préstamo de S/ 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: perfumes, lápiz de labios, sombras para ojo, colonias, talcos, joyas, etc. Pilar se siente muy bien con su negocio ,puede pagar sus estudios y sentirse más segura e independiente.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell/Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para su venta

loans.name: Necy

texts.es:
Necy belongs to the group Banco Comunal La Familia, in the Avenue 3 de abril 488 Micaela Bastidas, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has 2 kids. Her husband works in a shop. With the first loan that Necy received from Manuela Ramos of $300 she invested in food to sell.

Now she has a cevicheria (a place that sells cheviche - a cold fish/vegetable dish) in her house which is very well known for all the different stews she uses, as well as her excellent seasoning. This, along with help from her husband, is why her business is doing very well.

With the loan of $1300, which she will pay back over a period of 4 months, she will fit out her business with a stereo, and she will also paint it, and buy some more utensils for the preparation of her food.

For necy, belongin to a communal group like Manuela Ramos is a great help, as it is for all the women who have small businesses and want to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Necy pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. 3 de abril 488 Micaela Bastidas, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Necy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad tiene una cevicheria en su casa que es muy concurrida por los diversos potajes que ofrece además ni que decir de la excelente sazón y la atención esmerada de Necy, con la ayuda de su esposos sacan adelante su negocio. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implementara su negocio con la compra de 1 equipo de sonido, también pintara su local, comprará utensilios, y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas. Necy pertenecer a un banco comunal de Manuela Ramos es un gran apoyo para las mujeres que tenemos pequeños negocios y que queremos progresar.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy utensils for her business/Con el prestamo comprara utensilos para su negocio

loans.name: Lili Del Rosario

texts.es:
Lili is requesting your financing in order to invest in buying construction materials that will be used to remodel a room in her mother's house located in Zone #6 of Nueva Guinea.

Lili works as a teacher of elementary school. She has been working 6 years for Nerpe Salomón Ibarra Mayorga in the neighborhood San Francisco located 15 km from Nueva Guinea in the rural zone.

She has 3 children, her oldest son is 7 years old and studies the 5th grade level, her daughter is 6 years old and studies the 2nd grade level and her little son is 1 year old. Her husband works on his father's property in a region called El Cojo, which helps with the family expenses.

Lili is an example for all the women that fight for the well-being of their family. Since the distance from her job isn't an obstacle to her continuing to struggle to reach her dreams, her first desire is to buy plot of land and build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lili esta solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción, para remodelar un cuarto en la casa de su mamá ubicada en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea.

Doña Lili se desempeña como docente de educación primaria, labora desde hace 6 años como docente del nerpe salomón Ibarra Mayorga en colonia San Francisco a 15 Km. de Nueva Guinea en la zona rural.

Tiene 3 hijos, su hijo mayor tiene 7 años de edad estudia 5to grado, la niña tiene 6 años estudia 2do grado de educación primaria y el un bebe de 1 añito , su esposo trabaja en la finca de su papá en una comarca llamada El Cojo, él le ayuda en los gastos familiares.

Lili es un ejemplo para todas las mujeres que luchan por el bienestar de su familia ya que la distancia de su trabajo no es impedimento para seguir luchando por sus sueños primeramente su deseo es comprar un solar y construir su propia casa.

loans.use: Remodeling a room of a house

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a high school teacher at César Augusto cesar Salinas Pinell. He started out giving classes to his fellow students when was in the 4th grade and it was here that he showed his love for teaching. Two years ago, he managed to get a job from the Ministry of Education, which he performs with responsibility and honesty. He is a teacher of mathematics and English and at the same time he is studying towards two degrees in mathematics and English. It is worth noting that this young guy is characterized by his simplicity and humble spirit of overcoming challenges. He wants to become an excellent professional to be able continue helping his family.

Mario J. is requesting a loan in order to invest in the improvement of his home, located in Zone #1 of Nueva Guinea, by repairing his bedroom to have a little bit of comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Mario es docente de educación Secundaria en el colegio César Augusto cesar Salinas Pinell. Inició a laborar dando clase a sus mismos compañeros cuando estaba en cuarto año, fue así que él demostró su amor por la docencia y consiguió que en el ministerio de educación le otorgara una plaza hace dos años, donde se desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad y honestidad es maestro de matemática e inglés, a la vez es estudiante de dos carreras Lic. En Matemática e Ingles, Cabe la pena recalcar que este joven se caracteriza por su sencillez y humildady espíritu de superación, quiere llegar a ser un excelente profesional para así seguir ayudando a su familia. Mario J. está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ubicada en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea, como es repellar el dormitorio en el que habita y así tener un poco de comodidad.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to repair a room of his house

loans.name: Efrain Ricardo

texts.es:
Efrain S.'s dreams are to give his children the best education and examples to follow. He has a seven-year-old son with his wife, who is his support in everything and who work as a store clerk.

He is employed as a top national policy official who has twenty years of service to his community, helping to reduce delinquency and maintaining order and security.

With the loan that he is requesting, he want to lay bricks in his house and make a small enlargement.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

Los sueños de Don Efrain S. son los de darle la mejor educacion y ejemplo a sus hijos, quien tiene un hijo de 7 años con su esposa quien es su apoyo en todo y trabaja como dependienta en una tienda.

El se desempeña como primer ofiical de la policia nacional quien tiene 20 años de servir a la comunidad constribuyendo a minimizar la delincuencia manteniendo el orden y la seguridad. Con el prestamo que solicita quiere ponerle ladrillos a su casa y hacer una pequeña ampliacion.

loans.use: Bricklaying on the floor of his house.

loans.name: Carol Davis

texts.es:
Carol Davis C. D. Velezmoro is 34 years old and has completed secondary school. She has 2 kids who depend on her. She lives in Saucipe, in the district of Paijan, in the province of Ascope in the county of La Libertad, in Peru.

When Carol started,her business was rearing ducks which she killed every 3 months to sell to different market stalls and restaurants in Paijan. Since their food started to cost more, Carol decided she could not go on with her business as she was not making enough from it. She became a member of the beauty product company UNIQUE, and she is still selling their products to friends and neighbors, and it is going very well.

With the loan of $300 that she got from the Banco Comunal which belongs to the group 'manos unidas', she bought a lot of bags of food for her birds.

With a loan of $800, which she will pay back over a periodof 6 months, she will buy beauty products like perfumes, jewellery, creams and make-up.

Carol's dream is to open a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carol Davis C. D. Velezmoro tiene 34 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen D. ella.Vive en Saucipe en el distrito D. Paiján en la provincia D. Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando la señora Carol inicia su negocio lo hizo con la crianza D. patos el cual después D. tres meses aproximadamente los mataba para ofrecerlos y venderlos por los diferentes mercados y restaurantes del distrito D. Paiján. DesD. que el alimento balanceado subió D. precio la señora Carol deciD. ya no seguir con el negocio ya que no obtenía utilidades satisfactorias. Posteriormente ingresa a la empresa D. productos D. belleza UNIQUE, hasta la actualidad venD. estos productos a sus vecinas y amistades, y le va muy bien. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal al que pertenece “Manos Unidas” compro varios sacos D. alimento balanceado para sus aves. Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprará productos D. belleza como: fragancias, joyas, cremas y maquillaje. La señora Carol tiene un gran sueño que es el D. poner una tienda en su domicilio.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell/Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para su venta

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 45352

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Client María Mercedes is requesting her seventh refinancing to invest money in improving her home. She needs to construct a room. She works two shifts at the Vigarmy Flores School, where she earns her salary as a primary school educator.

She has four children. Her oldest is 28 and is in his third year of university studies. He works as an educator in the San Antonio colony and helps his mother with the family expenses. Her other son is 18 years old and is in his fifth year of secondary education. Her older daughter is 16 and is in her third year of secondary school, and her younger daughter is 12 and is in fifth grade. Her life companion works as a farmer on a country property and also helps with the family expenses.

María Mercedes is a woman who has fought since becoming a mother to provide her four children with everything necessary and has proven herself to be a very responsible mother. She has fought so that her children may become educated, and she dreams of having a house with all of the best features that her family deserves and of her children managing to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La clienta María Mercedes está solicitando su séptimo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, necesita construir una habitación, trabaja dos turnos en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores en la cual devenga un salario por docenciade educación Primaria.

Tiene 4 hijos, su hijo mayor tiene 28 años actualmente está cursando 3er año de la Universidad, éste labora como docente en colonia San Antonio y le ayuda con los gastos familiares a su madre, su otro hijo tiene 18 años de edad estudia V año de educación secundaria, su hija de 16 años, estudia III año y su hija menor de 12 años estudia quinto grado, su compañero de vida trabaja como agricultor en una finca y tambiém le apoya con los gastos familiares.

Doña María Mercedes es una mujer que ha luchado desde que se convirtió en madre por brindarle todo lo necesario a sus cuatros hijos y ha demostrado ser una madre muy responsable y ha luchado por que sus hijos estudien y sueña con tener una casa con todas las condiciones optimas que amerita la Familia y lograr que a sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.

loans.use: To build a room in her home

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia C. D. R. is 65 years old. She currently lives in Chongoyape, in the district of Paiján, in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She has 10 children, none of whom are dependent on her. Eufemia studied up until the first graD. of primary school.

She began her business selling various vegetables, yucca and potatoes in the door of her house in Paiján. Through some friends she joined the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” (Hands together).

The last loan she received was used in order to buy spices wholesale, which resulted in lots of sales. Currently every morning she sells in the Casa GranD. market, which is going well because she has sold in the market for quite a long time now, and so has attracted many customers.

With the loan of 2000 Soles, which she will repay within 6 months, she will buy two sacks of dried chilies, garlic, spicy pepper, black peppers, cumin seed and a variety of vegetables.

Her dearest wish is to expand her business and secure a larger stall.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eufemia C. D. R. tiene 65 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Chongoyape, Distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad - Perú; tiene 10 hijos, ninguno dependen D. ella. La señora Eufemia estudió hasta el primer grado D. primaria.

Inició su negocio vendiendo unas cuantas verduras, yuca, papa en la puerta D. su casa en Paiján; por unas amigas ingresa al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”.

Su anterior préstamo que recibió lo utilizo para comprar especias al por mayor el cual tuvo muchas ventas. Actualmente todos los días por las mañanas venD. en el mercado D. Casa GranD., le va bien pues ya tiene bastante tiempo vendiendo en este mercado y ha conseguido mucha clientela.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 el cual pagara en seis meses, comprará dos sacos D. ají seco, ajo entero, rocoto, pimienta y comino entero, y una variedad D. verduras.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar más su negocio y conseguir un puesto más granD..

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma V. R. is 45 years old, she studied up to the third grade of primary school. She has one son who is no longer dependent on her: he is already an adult and she has given him a job in her business. She lives in Licapa in the district of Paiján in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

The first business Norma had was selling clothes in the hills of La Libertad, traveling through different settlements. With the passing of time she seceded to leave that business as she was no longer obtaining such a good income. Later, she joined with a friend to work in Laredo making bricks, and then having learnt the business she set-up herself as an independent business only when she received her first loan from the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” (Hands Together).

With this money she paid for the land rights, and with subsequent loans she bought her tool and in this way the business has continued growing and she had been able to give more and more work to youths in the area. The last loan she received enabled her to increase her capital and thus to expand her business still further. She has many customers and is well-known.

With this loan of 3000 Soles, which she will repay within six months, she will buy 22 tons of coal to burn in order to make the bricks.

Norma dreams of being able to build a big factory which would be equipped with all the necessary machinery to produce books, and in this way increase the efficiency of production.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma V. R. tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que ya no depende de ella, ya es mayor y le ha dado trabajo en su negocio. Vive en Licapa en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

El primer negocio que tuvo la señora Norma es la venta de ropa por la sierra de La Libertad viajaba por diferentes lugares. Al pasar el tiempo decide dejar aquel negocio ya que no obtenía tantas utilidades. Posteriormente se asocia con un amigo para trabajar en Laredo en la fabricación del ladrillo ahí aprendió el negocio se independizó para trabajar sola cuando recibió su primer préstamo en el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”.

Con ese dinero pagó el derecho de tierra, con los siguientes préstamos compró sus implementos y así su negocio fue creciendo y pudo dar cada vez más trabajo a jóvenes de su zona. Con su anterior préstamo que recibió le ayudo a aumentar su capital y a incrementar más su negocio. Tiene mucha clientela, es conocida.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual pagara en un periodo de seis meses comprará 22 toneladas de carbón para quemar y poder elaborar el ladrillo.

La señora Norma sueña con poner una gran fábrica en la que cuente con toda la maquinaria necesaria para producir ladrillos, de esa manera ser mas eficiente en su producción.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy coal in order to make bricks.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa Isabel R. C. is 45 years old: she studied up until the fifth grade of primary school. She has six children in total, but only four are still dependent on her. She lives in Chogoyape in the district of Paiján in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

Rosa Isabel began her business selling a few vegetables to her neighbours and acquaintances, and with the passage of time she was able to secure a stall at the “El Tambo” market, in the district of Paiján, where she sells merchandise such as vegetables, salads and condiments. She constantly travels to Trujillo district in order to buy vegetables and spices to grind wholesale.

See joined the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” where she obtained her first loan of 300 Soles, using this money to buy a variety of vegetables by the sack.

With this loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay within six months, she will buy: 20 Kg. of carrot, 25 packets of coriander and spring onions, celery, leeks and other vegetables as well as all types of condiments.

Her dearest wish is to expand her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Isabel R. C. tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene seis hijos en total pero cuatro aun dependen de ella. Vive en Chogoyape en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Rosa Isabel inicia su negocio ofreciendo y vendiendo un poco de verduras a sus vecinos y conocidos, al pasar el tiempo logra conseguir un puesto en el mercado “El Tambo” en el distrito de Paiján, lugar donde ofrece sus productos como verdura, ensaladas, condimentos. Viaja constantemente al distrito de Trujillo para comprar al por mayor las verduras y especias para los molidos.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo utilizo para comprar una variedad de verduras por sacos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará: 20 Kg. de zanahoria, 25 paquetes de culantro y cebolla china, apio y poro, y otras verduras además todo tipo de condimentos.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar mas su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45356

loans.name: Felicita Gloria

texts.es:
Felicita is requesting a loan to invest in improvements to her home. For the past 4 years, Felicita has occupied herself as a preschool teacher at the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell Schol. This woman counts on the help of her husband, who is an elementary school teacher. They have two children; the oldest, who is 15, is in his fifth year, and the other, who is 10, is in 6th grade.

Felicita is a woman of economic resources who has fought, with her husband's help, to gradually improve their home. Currently, they have a house made of wood, but her dream is to little by little construct a home made of concrete. With this loan she hope to build a wood kitchen that provide the conditions that her family needs. Her desire is that her children will study in order to make something of their lives and achieve the dreams that every mother has for her children -- that her children will become professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Felicita esta solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda. Felicita se desempeña desde hace 4 años como docente de pre escolar de la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell. Esta señora cuenta con la ayuda de su marido quien es docente de educación primaria, tienen 2 hijos, la mayor de 15 años está cursando su quinto año y el otro de 10 años en 6to grado.

Doña Felicita es una mujer de escasos recursos económicos que ha luchado con su marido por ir mejorando su vivienda, actualmente tiene una casita de madera pero su sueño es construir poco a poco una vivienda de concreto, con este préstamo pretende construir una cocina de madera que cumpla con las condiciones que la familia necesita y su deseo es que sus hijos estudien para ser alguien en la vida y cumplir con sus sueños que toda madre anhela que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos profesionales en el futuro.

loans.use: To build a wood kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Tania Yolanda

texts.es:
Tania Yolanda S. C. is 30 years old: she completed secondary school. She has two children in total but only one is still dependent on her. She lives in Licapa in the district of Paiján in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

Tania started her business together with her mother in a school kiosk near her house, during the school terms she makes prepared various dishes to sell such as jelly, biscuits, cake and other foods. Also during Summer she sells frozen ices outside her home. Recently, she has started-up another business which is the preparation and sale of animal feed: the idea of this business was based on the fact that various neighbours in her area are involved in rearing birds and are always buying these products.

She is a member of the Community Bank “Manos Unidas”, from whom she received her first loan of 300 Soles: with this money she bought snacks, fruits and cooking ingredients.

With this loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay within six months, she will buy: one sack of soya cake, one and a half sacks of ground maize, one sack of bran, 20 kilograms of birdfeed, fishmeal, Vitamin B complex and other raw ingredients to prepare poultry food.

Her dream is to have a mill in which she would be able to produce better-quality products.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Tania Yolanda S. C. tiene 30 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en Licapa en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Tania inicia su negocio junto con su mama en el kiosco de un colegio cerca de su casa, durante la época escolar hace algunos preparados para vender como, gelatina, marcianos, flan y comida. Así también en época de verano vende raspadilla afuera de su domicilio. Recientemente ha iniciado otro negocio que es la preparación y venta de alimento balanceado, la idea de este negocio se debió a que existen por su zona varios vecinos que se dedican a la crianza de aves y siempre adquieren estos productos.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro golosinas, frutas y los ingredientes para cocinar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en un periodo de seis meses comprará: un saco de torta de soya, un saco y medio de maíz molido, un saco de afrecho, 20 kilogramos de avemicina, harina de pescado, complejo B y los demás insumos para preparar el alimento de aves.

Su mayor sueño es tener un molino en el que pueda elaborar sus productos pero de mejor calidad.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for business

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda M. V. is 45 years old: she only completed primary school. She has three children all of whom are dependent on her. She lives in the district of El Provenir in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad - Perú.

She started-up her business selling groceries, vegetables and clothes to wear, to sell in the various mountain villages of the region. Recently she has begun another business together with her daughter, which is the sale of pharmaceutical products.

She was invited by a friend to participate in the Community Bank “Dios de Bendición” (God’s Blessing) from which she obtained her last loan, which served to stock her business and to take advantage of the Christmas season. This went very well and she made a good profit.

With this loan of 1700 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months she has decided to buy shelving and all types of medicine to set-up her new business with her daughter.

Her dearest wish is to have a vehicle for transportation, in which she would be able to share out their merchandise between different places.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teodolinda M. V. tiene 45 años de edad, solo estudió primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y una todavía depende de ella. Vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir de la provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio se inicia con la venta de abarrotes, verduras y ropa lleva, a vender a diferentes pueblos de la sierra de la región. Recientemente esta iniciando otro negocio junto con su hija, es la venta de productos farmacéuticos.

Es invitada por una amiga a participar del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” en el cual obtuvo un anterior préstamo, el cual le sirvió para surtir su negocio y para aprovechar la campaña navideña. Le fue muy bien ya que tuvo utilidades.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses ha decidido comprar andamios y todo tipo de medicina para emprender su nuevo negocio junto a su hija.

Su mayor sueño es tener un medio de transporte en la que pueda repartir su mercadería por diferentes lugares.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Professor Rosalio fills his time as an educator involved in secondary education at the Rubén Darío Institute. He has worked as an educator for 30 years. His dream is to enjoy job stability and a decent home with all of the basic conditions that every citizen aspires to. This client has two daughters, both of whom are educators. The older of the two, who is 25, is a teacher at a private school, and the younger, who is 22, teaches physical education at the Rubén Darío Institute. He also has a grandson under his care.

His wife also works as an educator at the same institute, and all of them assume the responsibilities and the family expenses since they are a close family. Rosalio is the only person recognized in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for being responsibe and sociable. Currently, Professor Rosalio is studying for a degree in English at the University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua (URACCAN).

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials in order to plaster the kitchen and a room in his house, which is located in zone # 6 in Nueva Guinea.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

El Profesor Rosalio se desempeña como docente de educación secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío labora desde hace 30 años como docente, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadano aspira, este cliente tiene dos hijas ambas son docentes la mayor de 25 años es docente de un colegio Privado y la menor de 22 años es docente de educación Física en el Instituto Rubén Darío, y un nieto que esá a su cargo.

Su esposa trabaja también como docente en el mismo Instituto todos asumen las responsabilidades y los gastos familiares ya que son una familia unida, él es una persona reconocida en el municipio de Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y sociable, actualmente el Profesor Rosalio esta estudiando Lic. En Ingles en la universidad URACCAN.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción para repellar la cocina y un cuarto en su casa ubicada en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea.

loans.use: To plaster walls in kitchen and bedroom

loans.name: Yvon Mireyna

texts.es:
Ms. Yvon Mireyna U. M. is 24 years old, she studied but didn’t finish her major because of personal reasons. She has 2 children that depend on her. She lives in Saupice en in the district of Paijan in the province of Ascope in the state of La Libertad – Peru. When Ms. Yvon began her business she did it selling beauty products, she would offer and sell to her friends. Sometimes she wasn’t able to pay by the date and bit by bit she lost her merchandise and didn’t make enough income to be able to buy more. Some of her clients suggested that she sell clothing for women, men and children. She is a member of the United Hands communal bank where she obtained her first loan of S. 300.00 this money was invested in the purchase of beauty products to have in stock. With the loan of S. 1500.00 which she will pay off in 6 months, she will purchase goods for different requests: school shoes, skirts, jeans, school shirts, clothes for children, jewelry, pants, and blouses. Ms. Yvon’s biggest dream is to construct her home and have a place where she can sell all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yvon Mireyna U. M. tiene 24 años de edad, estudio superior pero no termino la carrera de secretariado por motivos personales. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella.Vive en Saucipe en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando la señora Yvon empezó su negocio lo hizo vendiendo productos de belleza, ofrecía y vendía a sus conocidos y amistades. En oportunidades no le cancelaban en la fecha y poco a poco se iba descapitalizando y no ganaba lo suficiente así que dejo de vender. Algunos de los clientes que había conseguido le sugirieron que venda ropa para dama, caballero y niños, en general los pedidos que le hicieran. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para comprar productos de belleza para tener en stock. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará diferentes pedidos que le han solicitado: zapatos de colegio, faldas Jean, camisas de colegio, ropa para niño, joyas de fantasía, pantalones Jean y blusas. La señora Yvon es fiscal de su Banco Comunal. Su mayor sueño es construir su casa y ambientar un lugar donde venda todos sus productos.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45361

loans.name: Roger Mauricio

texts.es:
Roger Mauricio is requesting a loan to invest in renovations to his home located in the 5th zone of Nueva Guinea, he needs to remodel his home to have a little comfort, he is a employee of APROSAPAN, he is the father of a 10 year old boy who is a 6th grade student. Roger is a young professional who earned his degree in forest management. In administration he does his job with a lot of responsibility and honesty he is an example for all young Nicaraguans that love their country, nowadays he has obtained a scholarship to study. Roger is a young man who is characterized as a fighter and enterprising, a part from being a salaried person he was from scarce economic resources as a young boy and he has always been an independent man with a good spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Roger Mauricio está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda ubicada en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, necesita remodelar el dormitorio que él habita y así tener un poco de comodidad, es trabajador de APROSAPAN como responsable de proyecto, es padre de un niño de 10 años estudia 6to grado de educación primaria. Roger es un joven profesional que se recibió en las carrera de Ing. Agroforestal y Lic. En informática Administrativa desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad y honestidad es un ejemplo para todos los jóvenes Nicaragüense que amamos nuestro país, actualmente consiguió una beca para estudiar Lic. En Derecho. Roger es un joven que se caracteriza por ser luchador y emprendedor a pesar de ser una persona asalariada y de escasos recursos económicos desde muy joven ha sido un hombre independiente de su mamá pero posee un alto espíritu de superación personal.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Mr. A. lives in the Balalaica neighborhood of Juigalpa with his family composed of 6 people, 4 children and his wife, all his children study, 1 is in his 5th year of high school, the 14 year old is in his 3rd year, the 12 year old is in 6th grade, and the 8 year old is in 3rd grade. Mr. A. is the only person who economically supports the family; with the help of AFODENIC he has been able to establish his business of selling packaging and glass for vehicles. This allows him to maintain his home and develop his business. He has been running this activity for 10 years, maintaining a clientele composed of public and private transportation workers, maintaining a constant demand, his wife cares for the home and helps her husband with his small business, with this loan he plans to strengthen his inventory and to improve his sales and improve the conditions of the family life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. A. habita en el Bº Balalaica de juigalpa junto a su familia compuesta por 6 personas, 4 hijos y su esposa, todos sus hijos estudian 1 de 18 años 5to año, el de 14, 3er año, el de 12 años 6to grado y el de 8 en 3er grado y el Sr. A. es el unico sosten de su familia; con apoyo de AFODENIC ha logrado establecer su negocio consistente en venta de empaques y guias para vidrio de vehiculo que le permite disponer de su propio negocio que le garantiza mantener su hogar y desarrollarse como empresario empredendedor, muy temprano personalmente atiende su negocio que es su unica fuente de ingreso familiar el que realiza en la via publica a orillas de la carretera norte hacia Managua expuesto en mostradores y estantes provisioneales. Ejerciendo esta actividad desde hace 10 años, logrando mantener clientela local compuesta por transportistas publicos y privados, manteniendo constancia de su demanda; su esposa es ama de casa y atiende el hogar y garantiza la asistencia de su marido muy temprano a su pequeño negocio; con el credito solicitado pretende reforzar su inventario y mejorar su oferta que le permita mayores ventas y por ende mejores condiciones de vida familiar.

loans.use: To strengthen the inventory of his small business.

loans.name: Magdalena Asunción

texts.es:
Mrs. B. U., primary school teacher, single mother of 3 married older children, to support herself she has worked as a primary school teacher in the New Horizons School located in the Penitentiary System of Juigalpa for 6 years for a low entry level salary, in addition she sells cosmetics to coworkers and colleagues, this has enabled her to succeed in this stage of her life.  Nowadays she runs her business in a traveling manner selling products (perfumes, creams, lotions, etc.) a few years ago she decided to begin this business to obtain another income to support her home since she is a single mother and has been able to further her family while playing a double role as mother and father to her 3 children, with this loan from AFODENIC she will be able to consolidate and strengthen her inventory and be able to continue this activity as a work alternative that will allow her to achieve more goals in her life.

 Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. B. U., maestra de educacion primaria, soltera, madre de 3 hijos mayores casados, para su autosostenimiento labora como maestra de primaria en la Escuela Nuevos Horizontes ubicada en el Sistema Penitenciario de Juigalpa desde hace 6 años por el bajo ingreso salarial del sector , adicionalmente vende  cosmeticos a compañeros de trabajo, colegas y clientela domicialiar, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante en esta etapa de su vida.  

Actualmente ejerce su negocio de forma ambulante vendiendo productos (perfumes, cremas, lociones, etc), decidio emprender este negocio para obtener otros ingresos despues de su salario para sostener su hogar ya que es soltera desde hace varios años habiendo logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos teniendo doble roll familiar, de padre y madre en la formacion de sus 3 hijos; con financiamiento de AFODENIC ha logrado consolidar cierto inventario, el que pretende reforzar con la presente solicitud de financiamiento y mantener esta actividad como alternativa de trabajo que le permita lograr nuevas metas en su vida.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams and lotions.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. T. B. lives in the Santa Ana of Juigalpa neighborhood in Chontales, Nicaragua with his family composed of 4 children and his wife. Nowadays all his children go to school, because of his own efforts he has been able to start a bakery that allows him to support his family, his desire is to make progress in his business and with this loan he plans to buy raw material (flour, baking powder, butter, etc.) that will allow him to develop his business and answer the demands of his local customers in the urban area of Juigalpa; historically his relatives have worked in this field, this has enabled him to have an established clientele and continue developing his family environment.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. T. Bermúdez, habita en el Barrio Santa Ana de Juigalpa, Chontales junto a su familia compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposa; actualmente todos sus hijos van al colegio, por esfuerzo propio ha logrado establecer un taller de panadería que le brinda el sostén familiar, su deseo es de progresar y a través de esta solicitud de financiamiento pretende comprar materia prima (harina, polvo de hornear, mantequilla, etc.) que le permita desarrollarse y dar respuesta a su demanda localizada en el casco urbano de Juigalpa; históricamente su descendencia familiar ha laborado en este trabajo, lo que le ha permitido tener la clientela establecida y seguir desarrollando su entorno familiar.

loans.use: To buy raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Thị Ngọc
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Thị Thìn

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thin is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 125USD to buy material to make clothes and sell it. Besides that, she also be a meat retailer. The money she got from these jobs will help her repay the loan easier. Mrs. Thin likes Binhminh's (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) Microcredit program a lot. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thiet, 25 years old, also wants to borrow 125USD to buy material to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô N. Thị Thìn (MS: 050042), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua vải may cho khách. Ngoài ra cô chú còn đi mua thịt trâu bò về bán buôn và bán lẻ, với mức thu nhập thường xuyên hàng ngày sẽ giúp hoàn trả và thực hiện tốt với chương trình. Cô rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm này. Chị N. Thị Thiết (MS: 050044), năm nay 25 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua vải và đặt may cho khách.

loans.use: do their business

loans.name: Thị Thoi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi Thoi (ID number: 020025), is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 125 USD to breed the chickens. She is very hard-working. Since her hushand does not have very good health conditions, she is on her own raising and sending 3 children to school. She also works as a cleaner to earn extra money. Together with her pension, she is able to repay the borrowed money during the last 6 months. Mrs. Duong Thi Nga (ID number: 020022), is 28 years old. She would like to borrow 125 USD to buy wood to practice carpentry. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hue (ID number: 020026), is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 140 USD to breed the pigs. Mrs. Dang Thi Nhan (ID number: 020024), is 38 years old. She borrows 175 USD to breed the pigs. Mrs. Nghiem Thi Lan (ID number: 020052), is 37 years old. She would like to borrow 125 USD to breed the pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.
