Cô Ngô Thị Thoi (MS: 020025), năm nay 44 tuổi. Vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi gà thịt. Cô rất chịu khó và đảm đang, cô nuôi ba con đang đi học, chồng cô thì sức khoẻ không được tốt. Ngoài ra cô còn đăn ký đi làm vệ sinh ở thị trấn để có thêm thu nhập, cộng với lương của một giáo viên về hưu sớm. Cô đã tiết kiệm để hoàn trả vốn cho chương trình tốt trong sáu tháng vừa qua và những kỳ tiếp theo. Chị Dương Thị Nga (MS: 020022), năm nay 28 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND về mua gỗ làm mộc. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huề (MS: 020026), năm nay 37 tuổi, vay 2.242.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Đặng Thị Nhân (MS: 020024), năm nay 38 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Lan (MS: 020052), năm nay 37 tuổi,vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: breed the pigs, chickens and practice carpentry

loans.name: Thị Vân

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi Van (ID number: 11040022), is 42 years old. She works on the rice field, breeds the pigs. Her husband is a builder and her child is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 125 USD to buy machines for her child to open a carpentry workshop. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Anh (ID number: 11040023), wants to borrow 125 USD to buy pig mash. Mrs. Tran Thi Men (ID number: 11040010) wants to borrow 125 USD to buy merchandises for her store. Mrs. Nguyen Thi My (ID number: 11040024) wants to borrow 125 USD to buy pig mash. Mrs. Nghiem Thi Quynh (ID number: 11040025) wants to borrow 100 USD to buy more pigs to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị T. Thị Vân (MS: 11040023),năm nay 42 tuổi. Chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Chồng chị đi xây, còn con chị làm nghề mộc. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua máy cưa về xẻ gỗ đóng bàn ghế để bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ánh (MS: 11040023), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị T. Thị Mến (11040010), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị My (11040024), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Quỳnh (11040025), vay 1.534.000 VND để mua lợn giống.

loans.use: buy pig mash, buy pigs, buy merchandises for store, buy carpentry machine

loans.name: Thị Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs C. Thị Hương is 31 years old. She has had a loan with SEDA before and she has already paid back. She gives support and counsels other women in her G.. She is requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to buy flowers. She makes about 150.000 VND a day. Her husband is a cadre and they have 2 school age children.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Minh is 35 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to buy telephones, she has a phone repair shop.
- Mrs Lê Thị Hà is 33 years old. She also has a phone repair shop. She needs 2.714.000 VND
- Mrs Đặng Thị Hoa is 32 years old. She needs 2.714.000 VND for her phone repair shop.
- Mrs Tống Hồng Xuyên is 30 years old. She needs 2.714.000 VND for her photography studio for bridals

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị C. Thị Hương (MS: 030017), năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị đã vay được một C. kỳ 6 tháng và hoàn trả rất tốt , chị cũng giúp đỡ các chị em trong nhóm rất nhiều. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND mua hoa và mua kính thời trang để bán, chị bán hàng rất chạy và có thu nhập 150.000 VND/ngày. Chồng chị làm công an xã và chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh (MS: 030018), năm nay 35 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán và sữa chữa điện thoại. Chị Lê Thị Hà (MS: 030019), năm nay 33 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán và sửa chữa điện thoại và kính thời trang. Chị Đặng Thị Hoa (MS: 030020), năm nay 32 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán và sửa chữa điên thoại. Chị Tống Hồng Xuyên (MS: 030021), năm nay 30 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để kinh doanh chụp ảnh, áo cưới.

loans.use: Buôn bán và sửa chữa

loans.name: Thị Thành

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Thành is 40 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to buy shoes, sandals for her shoes store. She also raises poultry to make ands meet. Her husband is the village's committee president. She has 2 children who are attending school.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Thành (MS: 030022), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán dày dép, ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập. Chồng chị làm chu tịch xã, chị có hai con đang đi học.

loans.use: shoes store

loans.name: Holmamad

texts.ru:
Holmamad I., 46, is married and has 6 children. His wife does not work and takes care of the household. Holmamad lives in the village Yutkonsoi in the Gafurov region. He has been in the business of selling cattle for the past 10 years. That is the main source of income for his family. His older son, who is 17, helps him to take care of cattle. Currently, he has 25 goats and 20 sheep. To increase the number of animals, he came to MicroInvest to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Исломов Холмамад мужчина в возросте 46 лет женат имеет 6 детей , жена домохозяка.Он проживает в поселке Утконсой Гафуровском районе. уже 10 лет как занимается откормом скота на что и зарабатывает на проживание.По уходу за скотом ему помогает старший сын которому 17 лет. На данный момент у него сейчас 25 козочек и 20 баранов.Он хочет увеличить колличество скота, для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Sales of cattle

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45372

loans.name: Ibrohimova

texts.ru:
N. is 27 years old, married but has no children. She lives in a remote village in Utkonsoy of Gafurov region. He husband is working in Almaty. N. enjoys taking care of farm animals, and she makes wool from goat hair. Then she sells the wool for good money. Now, N. has 20 goats and 9 rams. She would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase more animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Назокат женщина в возросте 27 лет замужем но детей не имеет. Она проживает в отдаленом поселке Утконсой гафуровском районе. Ее муж в отъезде на заработках в Алма-ате. Сама Назокат любит ухаживать за скотом, и прядет с козьей шерсти пряжу потом продает ее за хорошие деньги. Сейчас у нее 20 коз и 9 баранов. Она обратилась к нам получить кредит для увеличения коз и барашков.

loans.use: To rear and resell farm animals

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45373

loans.name: Atakulov

texts.ru:
A. Atakulov is 43 years old and has 5 children. He works on a farm and simultaneously he owns farm animals at his house (1 cow and 30 goats). His job does not pay him, but it provides food for the whole family. A. receives a good profit from his personal farm animals. He would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the number of his animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Атакулов Абдусаттор мужчина в возросте 43 года имеет 5 детей. Oн работает в колхозе постухом одновременно у него имеется на дому свой скот ( 1 корова и 30 коз). Ha колхозe ему не плaтят зарплату , но обеспечивают его семью продуктами потания.А скот дает ему хорошую прибыль. Для увеличения скота он обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase more farm animals

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45374

loans.name: Tumainis Upendo Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is a 25 year old woman and is married with 2 children. Tumaini owns a small shop and sells fruit, which she began in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more shop items and fruits for her business. Upon receiving a loan, Tumaini would share it with her subgroup member Deaish, who runs a business selling vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more shop items and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Rose's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Rose started selling food in 1993. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Jamilah and Hamida, who have businesses in soap sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Lizy

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Lizy M.. She is married and has three children, ages 10, 13, and 17.

In 2007, Lizy established her crop wholesaling business. Lizy requires a loan in order to purchase maize, rice, and cocoa crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase maize, rice, and cocoa, in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Mary M.. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 10.

In 2006, Mary established her soft drink and clothing business. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks and to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase clothing and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:

Josephine’s husband works at a medical laboratory and one of her sons provides movie-making services at various occasions including weddings and birthdays. Currently, her son wants to purchase a new camera for which he needs a loan. Josephine will save the extra profits from his income for his wedding.

There are several other women in this loan group who also require small loans: Tahira Y. needs her share of the loan for her husband’s medical laboratory; Razia J.’s daughter runs a beauty salon. Suriya S. will invest her share of the group loan in her husband’s grocery store, and Sakina S.’s son runs a medical laboratory. All these women have been together for a year and practice values such as punctuality and saving.

loans.use: Buy a new movie camera for her son's business

One of my sons is currently working while all my other kids attend school. My husband paints buildings and churches on order. We need a loan to buy a few items so we can fulfill our recent order to paint a school. We want to expand our business to increase our income, which we will save to build a house of our own.

Sobia N. wants to buy a movie camera with her share of our group loan. Rubina B. needs this loan for her husband’s paint business. Asifa N. is borrowing for her husband’s medical laboratory. Shabana R. also wants to buy a movie camera.

loans.use: Buy a few items to fulfill an order to paint a school

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Firdavs R. lives in Gissar region. He is 24 and single. He has a university diploma in economics. Firdavs lives in an area called Navobod where he has a small store. The clients sells food items. He has been in this business for 5 years. Firdavs has a lare family and his parents no longer work. The client can not take care of the family on a salary of an economist. His business allows Firdavs' family to purchase all the necessities.

Currently, the client would like to buy a large number of goods, which is why he needs money. Firdas decided to apply for a loan, thereby increasing the amount of his capital. Local people would be able to purchase all the necessary foods without having to leave the area where they live. The client plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Расулов Фирдавс Сангимуродович проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 24 года, холост.Образование высшее, по специальности экономист. Фирдавс проживает в махалле Навобод, там имеет небольшой магазин.Клиент торгует продуктами питания.Занимается бизнесом более 5 лет.У Фирдавса большая семья , родители уже не работают. Клиент содержать семью на заработную плату экономиста не может. Бизнес позволяет семье Фирдавса приобретать самое необходимое. В данное время клиент хочет закупить больше товара ,для чего ему нужны деньги. Фирдавс решил взять кредит ,тем самым увеличить оборот денежного капитала. Местные жители могут покупать необходимые продукты питания не выезжая в за пределы района.Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

Muhiddin T. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 25 years old and single. He has a university diploma in engineering and works at the Tajik Aluminum Factory. Muhiddin also trades crockery from his house. He has been in this business for 3 years. Because his salary is not enough, the client trades in his free time. Additional income allows his family and him to purchase necessary food and clothes.

Currently, the client wants to buy a large amount of goods from whole sale traders. Local people will be able to purchase Muhiddin's crockery without having to leave the city. Muhiddin decided to apply for a loan. He will pay back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Тураев Мухиддин Нуридинович житель города Турсунзаде.Мухиддину 25 лет , холост. Образование высшее ,по специальности инженер, работает на Таджикском Алюминевом заводе. Так же занимается куплей продажей посуды,торгует из своего дома. Занимается бизнесом 3 года.Так как заработной платы не хватает, клиент в свободное от работы время занимается бизнесом. Этот дополнительный заработок позволяет ему и его семье приобретать необходимые продукты питания и одежду. В данный момент клиент хочет закупить больше товара у оптовых поставщиков для реализации . Местные жители могут покупать у него подарочные наборы, не выезжая за пределы города .Мухиддин решил взять кредит . Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the selection of goods

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 45, divorced and has 3 children. She has finished high school. Karomat sells shoes on the market. She has been in this business for 13 years. It is the main source of income for her family. Karomat takes care of her children by herself, she wants to give them a good education, which costs money. Karomat divorced her husband when the children were still small.

Currently, she wants to buy seasonal goods, which is why she needs money. Karomat decided to ask for a loan. She plans to repay within 12 months

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Каримова Каромат жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 45 лет,разведенная ,имеет 3 детей. Образование средние. Каромат торгует на рынке обувью. Занимается бизнесом более 13 лет. Эта деятельность является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Каромат сама растит своих детей,хочет дать им хорошее образование,что стоит денег. С мужем Каромат развелась,когда дети были еще маленькими. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить сезонный товар,на что ей нужны деньги. Каромат решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:

She has been in this business for 8 years. It brings additional income to her family, which makes it possible to provide for the family. All Nazokat's children are still in school. This is why she only can rely on herself for income. Because of her long experience in the retail business, Nazokat knows that the greater her variety of goods, the better the sales. This is why the client decided to get a loan. She plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Кунушова Назокат жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 41 год,замужем , имеет 4 детей.Образование средние. Занимается куплей продажей женской и детской обувью на рынке.Имеет опыт в бизнесе уже 8 лет. Торговля приносит ее семье дополнительный доход. Что позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью. Все дети Назокат учатся в средней школе. Поэтому клиентка надеется только на себя. Имея хороший опыт в бизнесе Назокат знает,чем больше ассортимента товара ,тем лучше торговля. Поэтому клиентка решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima Mustafoevna B. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is a widow, 47 years old with two children. She has secondary education. Halima is in the retail business of buying and selling fabrics for national Tajik dresses and has been doing it for more than five years. By working from her home she is able to take care of her small children. It's also convenient for her neighbors to buy from her without having to travel outside of town. This business is the only source of income for her family. At this time, Halima wants to buy more fabrics because the time for lighter clothes is around the corner. She does not have enough capital so she decided to apply for a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоева Халима Мустафоевна жительница города Турсунзаде.Она вдова , имеет 2 детей.Возраст 47 лет. Образование средние. Халима занимается куплей продажей ткани для пошива национального платья.Клиентка торгует из своего дома.Занимается этой деятельностью более 5 лет.Торгуя из дому ,она может смотреть за своими маленькими детьми.Это удобно и ее соседям,они могут приобретать ткани и выезжая в город.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить больше ткани,так как наступает сезон более легкой одежды. Своих оборотных средств у нее не хватает и она решила взять кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течние 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Gulchehra Haitovna R. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is married and has three children. She is 52 years old and has a college degree in engineering. But she does not work as an engineer because of very small wages. Two of her children are students and her third child goes to school. She sells food and groceries at the local market. This business is the only source of income for her family at this time. Gulchehra wants to increase the variety of her merchandise, but does not have enough means. She decided to take out a loan, which will allow her to increase commodity circulation and profits. It will help support her family. Also, the locals can buy the necessary groceries in their own town at reasonable prices. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Гулчехра Хаитовна жительница города Турсунзаде.Замужем, имеет 3 детей.Возраст 52 года.Образование высшее,по специальности инженер.Но по специальности не работает,так как очень маленькая заработная плата. У Гулчехры двое детей студенты,третий ребенок ходит в среднюю школу. Поэтому она торгует на местном рынке продуктами питания.Эта деятельность пока является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки,но своих средств у нее не хватает.Гулчехра решила взять кредит,тем самым увеличит товарооборот и увеличит доход своей торговой точки.Это ей позволит содержать свою семью.Так же жители грода Турсунзаде могут приобретать у нее продукты питания по более приемлимым для них ценам. Планирует погасить кредит Гулчехра в течение 12 месяц

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Kristina M.. She is married, and has four children between the ages of 2 and 11. She also has two dependents, her nieces, who live with her.

In 1999, Kristina established her crop wholesaling business. Kristina requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional crops in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He is married and has one child. His elderly father lives with him, and his father is sick with diabetes. He has an old car and he applied to borrow $1200 to replace his old car with another taxi. He also wants to purchase new tires in order to work on it. He wants to save for a good life for his family and take care of his father's treatment.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace the old car with another taxi

loans.name: Hidaya's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 20,17,14 and 4. Hidaya owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Amina and Nuru, who have businesses dealing in kiosk owns and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Hamasika Group

texts.en:

Grace owns a small cafe, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Grace has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in coconut sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:

Asha would like a loan to increase the charcoal she purchases to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food (rice, beans and maize flour) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma A., who has business dealing in charcoal sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (juice, blue band, and rice) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have their own cassava, drinks and food vending business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales, cafe, and salon.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (soda and beer) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Wande, who has business dealing in cafe.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:

Aisha now hopes for a loan to purchase more salon items and materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items,juice and shop items for her buseness.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine N. is business-focused and very determined to increase her business and to lift her family above poverty. Celine is 35 years of age, with a kid; she lives in Jakunde community, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks in her neighborhood. She also has two drums that she uses for storing her provisions at night to prevent insects and rats from destroying them. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and now needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children ages 10 and 3. She began selling charcoal in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Mariam hopes to receive a loan in order to buy more charcoal for her business so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kidawa

texts.en:
Kidawa is a 32-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 2 small children, ages 8 and 12 years old. Kidawa owns a small salon. She also sells timber, a business which she began in 2000. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

In the past, Kidawa has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Virgínia  João

texts.pt:
Virgínia João H., born December 27, 1971, in Maputo, lost her father when she was four years old and lived with her mother until she was ten. She went on to live with an aunt until she was seventeen. She only studied up to seventh grade, due to family financial difficulties.

In 1993, she married her husband and had a child. In 2007, her husband lost his life. She went to live with her son and three other family members.

She started her business when she was seventeen, selling used clothing. Later she changed her business, going on to sell food items.

The impact of her business activity is important in her family, as it ensures income; and in the community, by supplying groceries, shortening the distance for her neighbors to go shopping.

Through a friend, she heard of the existence of Hluvuku. She solicited a loan of 15,000 meticais for the purchase of a bunch of chickens for resale, and one part for the purchase of chicks for resale as well, strengthening the volume of her business. Her product has been most sought after on weekends and at the end of the month, when there is more demand.

In the future, she would like to have a store where she can stock her products, as she currently delivers to homes. Her loan will go to toward that end.

Translated by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Virgínia João H., nascido aos 27 de Dezembro de 1971 em Maputo perdeu o pai apenas com 4 anos tendo ficado a viver com a mãe até aos 10 anos. Depois foi viver com uma tia até aos 17 anos, estudou apenas até 7ªclasse devido as dificuldades financeiras dos seus progenitores.

Em 1993 junta-se com seu marido com o qual tiveram um filho, em 2007 seu marido perde a vida ficando a viver com seu filho e mais três familiares.

Iniciou o negócio com 17 anos onde começou por vender roupa usada mais tarde mudou de negócio passando a vender géneros alimentícios.

O impacto da sua actividade é notório na sua família uma vez que garante o seu sustento e na comunidade pelo facto de fornecer géneros alimentícios encurtando distância dos seus vizinhos na procura destes.

Através duma amiga mais próxima ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado um empréstimo de 15,000.00mt para compra de um lote de frangos para revenda e uma parte na compra de miudezas de frangos para o mesmo fim, o que veio a reforçar o volume do seu negócio. O seu produto tem mais saída nos fins de semana e o nos fins do mês onde a procura é bastante maior.

Futuramente almeja ter uma loja onde poderá colocar os seus produtos uma vez que actualmente faz entregas domiciliarias aos seus clientes e para tal recorrerá ao empréstimo.

loans.use: To increase stock of chickens

loans.name: Rukiyatu

texts.en: Rokiyatu A. lives in Ayetoro, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food in her area; she acquired this skill from her mother. She is 45 years of age, with 8 children. Notwithstanding the number of her household, she is willing to increase her business so that she can feed her family. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. Rukiyatu now needs the sum of $875 to enable her buy more foodstuffs. This, she said, will help her serve her customers better. She expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her little restaurant

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is a 34 year old married woman with 3 children, ages 18,15, and 8 years old. Scola owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Scola has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Helena Paulo

texts.pt:
37 year-old Helena Paula Massugine was born in Maputo, Mozambique, where she still lives. Her studies had to be interrupted after elementary school due to her parents' financial difficulties. At age 18 Helena started a small grocery store to help support herself. A year later, her partner of one year left her to care for their newborn on her own. In 1999 she used the money she made in the grocery store business to buy a piece of land, where she built a chicken coop and started raising chickens to sell – an activity she learned from her mother. Now her son, who is high-school, helps her run it. Her business has a positive impact in the commmunity, providing work for several individuals that work to resell the chickens (she supplies the local market and resellers directly from her home.) Thing were going well until she had a setback: the brick house she built and furnished with profits from the business got partly destroyed by a fire in a nearby warehouse, which forced her to get a loan from a broker. Luckily, she heard about Hluvuku from a friend, and is now applying for a $1025.00 loan, to be paid in 16 months, to buy baby chickens, chicken feed, vaccine, and all the necessary things to grow the business. In the future, Helena hopes to expand her activities by adding egg-laying hens, and to buy a vehicle to facilitate her transportation and delivery needs.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Nome da Cliente - Helena Paula M. Localização: Bairro das Mahotas , Maputo Actividade - Avicultura Montante financiado - 25,000.00 mt Aplicação - compra de pintos e rações Início- 25/03/2008 Fim- 18/07/2009 Helena Paulo M., nasceu aos 14 de Janeiro de 1970 em Maputo tendo vivido com seus progenitores até aos 18 anos, estudou até a 8ªclasse não tendo continuado devido a exiguidade financeira dos seus pais. Deixou os seus pais aos 18 anos e foi alugar uma casa passando a viver sozinha e para o seu sustento dedicava se a actividade de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade num dos mercados da cidade de Maputo . Aos 19 anos junta se com seu marido com qual viveram um ano e tiveram um filho, depois o marido foi á R.D.A ( República Democrática da Alemanha) e de lá nunca mais voltou. Em 1999 com os lucros do negócio compra um terreno num dos bairros periférico da cidade onde construiu uma capoeira de material local e começou com actividade de criação de frangos de corte tendo aprendindo esta actividade através da sua mãe e nesta actividade conta com ajuda do filho. Este negócio tem um impacto positivo na sua vida porque através deste construiu uma casa convencional e comprou alguns bens só que infelizmente alguns foram destruídos pelas explosões do paiol (armazem de material belico) facto que fez com que recorresse a uma avalista para conseguir o empréstimo, além de garantir o seu sustento também está conseguindo suportar os estudos do filho que está frequentando a 12ªclasse. Na comunidade tem um impacto positivo pelo facto de fornecer o frango para a dieta alem de criar postos indirectos de trabalho para várias vendedeiras que compram os seus frangos para revenderem. Através de um amigo soube da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 25,000.00mt, para compra de rações e pintos o que até certo ponto veio a acrescer o negócio. Futuramente almeja ampliar o Aviário e comprar Poedeiras para a produção de ovos, adquirir uma carrinha para lhe facilitar no transporte de insumos e na entrega dos frangos aos seus clientes e para tal, recorrerá ao empréstimo.

loans.use: To raise chickens (to buy baby chickens, chicken feed, vaccine, etc)

loans.name: Charity's Pendamoyo Group

texts.en:
Charity is 42 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 18. Charity is a market seller, who started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Charity has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (rice, maize, wheat, and tomatoes) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Joyce and Tatu, who have businesses dealing in food vending and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (rice, maize, wheat,tomatoes) for her business.

loans.name: Carla Pedro

texts.pt:
26 year-old Carla Pedro T. was born in Maputo, Mozambique, where she still lives with her husband and two kids at her parents house. At age 15 her studies were interrupted due to her parents' financial difficulties and she started dedicating herself full-time to the family business of chicken raising. She heard about Hluvuku from a friend, in 2007, and is now applying for a loan of $425, which she plans to use to buy more baby chicks and chicken feed to improve the business and its profits. Her activities have allowed her to support her family for the past 10 years and have a positive impact in the community by providing indirect work for many women that resell her chickens. In the future, Carla hopes to expand the business by adding the necessary equipment to have egg-laying hens.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Nome da Cliente - Carla Pedro T. Localização - Bairro do Ferroviário, Maputo Actividade - Avicultura Montante Financiado - 10,000.00MT Aplicação – Compra de Pintos e rações Início- 25/03/2008 Fim- 18/03/2009 Carla Pedro T., nascido aos 8 de Setembro de 1981 em Maputo, vivendo com os seus pais até então. Estudou até 9ªclasse e porque os seus pais não estavam em condições de continuar a sustentar os seus estudos, teve que interromper dedicando-se ao negócio de criação de Frangos para o seu sustento o mesmo que vinha sendo desenvolvido pela família facto que fez com ela ganhasse larga experiência nesta actividade. Em 2000 casa-se e tem dois filhos continuando a residir em casa dos seus pais com o seu marido. Em 2007 através duma amiga soube da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 10,000.00mt o pretende aplicar na compra de pintos e rações mostrando se entusiasmada pelo empréstimo uma vez que aumentou o número de Frangos, assim como a receita . Esta actividade tem impacto na sua vida e na Comunidade uma vez que garante o sustento da sua família a 10 anos e cria postos de trabalho indirectos para muitas mulheres que compram frangos para revenderem. Futuramente almeja construir um grande Aviário onde para além de criar Frangos de Corte quer criar Poedeiras para a produção de ovos e que poderá gerar vários postos de trabalho e para tal recorrerá ao empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy baby chicks and chicken feed to improve her chicken raising business

loans.name: Festa

texts.en:
Festa is 28 years old and is a single woman. Festa has sold soft drinks since 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks items (soda, juice and water) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks items (soda, juice and water) for her business.

loans.name: Saulita Júlio

texts.pt:
Saulita Júlio was born September 22, 1970 in the Manhiça district in Maputo. She lived with her mother until she was 30 when she arranged for a home of her own where she lives alone. A little time later she married and had 2 children. Her husband went to South Africa searching for better conditions for the family but never again returned.

She started her business when she was 20 and purchased sweet potatoes in the Manhiça district and resold them in Ressano Garcia on the border of R.S.A. 15 years later she changed her business to selling cereals which she acquired in the center and the north of the country. Currently she counts on 4 children two of which help her with her business. Through a friend she learned of the existence of Hluvuku and solicited a loan for 18,000MT to purchase cereal to increase the volume of her business.

This business has a positive impact on her life and on the community since it guarantees the sustenance of her family. She was able to build a home with conventional materials and purchase furniture and kitchen appliances. She also supplies cereal for the community. Several women purchase cereal for resale contributing in some part to the reduction of the unemployment tax. She intends to reopen her small commercial establishment that is closed due to a robbery. She is going to use the earnings from the business to plaster and paint her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Saulita Júlio T., nascido aos 22 de Setembro de 1970 no Distrito de Manhiça em Maputo. Viveu com a mãe até aos 30 anos, depois arranjou uma casa propria, onde passou a viver sozinha, pouco tempo depois junta se com seu marrido e tiveram dois filhos. O marido foi á Africa de sul a busca de melhores condições para a família e de lá nunca mais voltou. Iniciou o negócio com 20 anos onde comprava batata doce no distrito da Manhiça e revendia em Ressano Garcia uma localidade que faz fronteira com a R.S.A. 15 anos depois muda de negócio onde passou a vender cereais até então, os quais adquire na zona centro e norte do pais. Conta actualmente com 4 filhos dois dos quais ajudam lhe nos seus negócios, através duma amiga soube da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 18,000.00MT para compra de cereais o que veio a aumentar o volume do seu negócio. Este negócio tem impacto positivo na sua vida e na comunidade uma vez que garante o sustento da sua família e na base deste já construiu uma casa com material convencional, comprou mobília e electrodomésticos e na Comunidade fornece cereais para a dieta além de que várias Mulheres tem comprado os cereais para revenderem contribuindo de certa forma para a diminuição da taxa de desemprego. Futuramente pretende reabrir o seu pequeno estabelecimento comercial que está fechado devido a um roubo, rebocar e pintar a sua casa e para tal vai usar os lucros do seu negócio

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Estwida's Tsunami Group

texts.en:
Estwida is a 28 years old married woman with one child who is eight years old. Estwida owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.
In the past, Estwida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sofia and Halima, who have businesses dealing in market sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.pt:
Tomás S. is 60 years old and was born in the city of Maputo. He finished the 6th grade. He is married and supports 7 people. He grew up in a typical family environment, however, his father passed away when he was 10 years old, and he says he started to have difficulties studying because he didn't have anyone to support him. His only option was to look for work so in 1963 he was hired at the Industrial Plastic Company where he worked until he retired.

In 1969 he married and moved to Catembe with his wife where they had children referenced above. He continued working for his company as a mechanic. He began searching for a way to keep himself busy opening a workshop to provide various services in the metal working arena with a lathe and saw in his back yard. His level of service is good.

He came to know Hluvuku through his brother that happens to be a client and has already had several loans which were paid off without problems. With this loan of 20MT he intends to purchase a machine to cut metal for his workshop that is open at 8am and closes at 6pm depending on the demand and favorable economic conditions. His monthly profit is around 3MT and with these earnings he is able to support a family, pay the loan, and still make some improvements on the machinery. In the future he envisions opening a shop to wash, lubricate, and align wheels and other services and may possibly need credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Tomás S. de 60 anos de idade, nasceu na Cidade de Maputo concluiu a 6ª classe, sustenta 7 pessoas e é casado oficialmente. Cresceu num ambiente típico familiar, porém o pai faleceu quando tinha 10 anos e relata que começou a enfrentar dificuldades para estudar por falta de quem o apoiasse por isso a opção que teve foi procurar emprego e assim em 1963 foi contratado na Companhia Industrial de Plásticos onde trabalhou até a reforma. Em 1969 casa-se e passa a viver na catembe com sua esposa donde tiveram os filhos acima referidos e continuou a trabalhar na Companhia acima com Torneiro-mecánico. Assim procura criar uma forma de se ocupar criando uma oficina como forma de dar resposta aos vários serviços na área de serralharia-mecánica, torno e fresa no seu quintal e o nível de adesão é satisfatório. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através do irmão que por sinal é cliente, já teve vários créditos dos quais paga-os sem sobressaltos. Com o crédito de 20.000MT pretende comprar uma máquina de corte de metais para sua oficina e refere que esta, é aberta as 8horas e encerra as 18:00horas dependendo da demanda e condições climatéricas favoráveis. A margem de lucro mensal ronda aos 3.000MT e com este ganho consegue sustentar a família, pagar o empréstimo e ainda fazer algumas beneficiações da maquinaria. A perspectiva futura é montar um alpendre para lavagem, lubrificação, alinhamento de rodas entre outros serviços e possivelmente vai precisar de crédito.

loans.use: To buy machine

loans.name: Sérgio Isabel

texts.pt:
Sérgio Isabel S., a 25-year-old single man with one child, born in the city of Maputo, was raised by his mother along with his brothers and sisters, and finished 10th grade. In addition to his daughter, he supports seven other people including younger brothers and sisters and nephews. Due to socio-economic problems, he had to leave school and begin working with his brother-in-law as an auto mechanic. He explains that his older brother, a sailor, then encouraged him to become involved with fishing. In 2005, with the help of his friends, he built a rowboat and purchased nets, and thus began his fishing business. He has been in business for more than five years now, and is doing well in spite of the lack of a formal business or other degree. His business currently has two employees.

With a loan of 11,000 MT, he intends to buy nets and other accessories. He was introduced to Hluvuku through friends. With the profits from his business he is able to support his family, pay for his daughter’s studies, and improve working conditions. His plans for the future are to buy a motor for his boat so that he can cover more miles.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Cliente: Sérgio Isabel S. Localização – Bairro Chali, Catembe Actividade:Pesca Valor de empréstimo: 11.000,00 MT Aplicacao: Compra de redes e outros acessórios Início: 25/03/08 Fim: 18/07/09 Sérgio Isabel S., solteiro de 25 anos de idade, tem um filho, nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, concluiu a 10ª classe sustenta para além da filha mais 7 pessoas, dentre irmaos mais novos e sobrinhos. Cresceu e viveu com a mãe e seus irmãos, devido a problemas sócio-económicos teve que parar de estudar e passou a ajudar seu cunhado mecânico na reparação de veículos e assim começou a envolver-se cada vez mais com esta arte. Relata que para abraçar a pesca parte do irmão mais velho que é marinheiro que incentivou o a abraçar esta actividade é nisto que em 2005 decide com ajuda dos amigos fazer barco a remo e comprar redes que impulsionaram bastante o trabalho e está nesta área a mais de 5 anos e não tem nenhuma formação e emprega actualmente dois trabalhadores. Com o crédito de 11.000Mt pretende comprar redes e outros acessórios, é assim que procura auxílio na Hluvuku que conhecera atraves de amigos. Com o rendimento consegue sustentar a família, por a crianças a estudar, melhorar as condições de trabalho. A perspectiva futura é comprar um motor para permitir percorrer mais milhas.

loans.use: To buy nets and other accessories

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Samuel M., a young man of 23 years, single, no children, was born in Catembe-Maputo. He attends 10th grade, and supports two brothers. He explains that he has always lived with his parents, studied, and found ways early on to help the family by selling essential products in the yard of the family home, which is in the Chali district of Catembe (across the bay from Maputo). For the last four years, he has also worked for Generics & Specialists Lda. selling pharmaceuticals. For 2 years he has been running his grocery store on good common sense; he has no business or other degree. The store has one salaried employee, has a business license, and is open from 8:00a.m. to 9:30p.m.

Samuel became acquainted with Hluvuku through friends and colleagues, and has already repaid his first loan with no trouble. With a loan of 10,000 MT, he intends to bolster his grocery store with products such as rice, beans, peanuts, corn meal, and soft drinks. He acquires his products in Catembe and rents a wagon to transport them. The best periods are weekends in the summer and at the end of the month, when supply is better. His daily revenue is 1,000 MT, and his most profitable product is soft drinks.

According to Samuel, the business has reached a good rhythm, with a monthly profit of 2,000 MT. With the business profits, he is able to support his family, increase volume, make home improvements, and put away savings. In the future, with additional loans, he intends to expand and diversify the products that he can offer his customers. He is thrilled with the credit extended to him, because it has substantially improved his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Cliente: Samuel M. Localização – Bairro Chali, Catembe Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade e refrigerantes Início: 27/03/08 Fim: 20/07/09 Samuel M. jovem solteiro de 23 anos, nasceu na Catembe-Maputo, está frequentando a 10ª classe, sustenta 2 irmáos e ainda não tem filhos. Relata que sempre viveu com os pais, estudava e desde cedo preocupou-se em arranjar formas de ajudar a família vendendo produtos de 1ª necessidade no quintal de sua casa, e actualmente trabalha como promotor de produtos farmacéuticos na Generics & Specialists Lda a 4 anos. Faz o negócio a 2 anos sensivelmente e não tem nenhuma formação e emprega um trabalhador assalariado. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku de colegas e amigos e já teve o 1º empréstimo que pagou sem sobressaltos. Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00MT pretende reforçar a mercearia com produtos como: arroz, feijão, amendoim, farrinha de milho e refrigerantes. O estabelecimento é aberto as 8 horas e encerra as 21:30mn e adquire os produtos na catembe e aluga carro para transportá-los e o melhor período é aos fins de semana, verão e final do més onde a procura é maior. A receita diária é de 1.000MT e que dá mais lucro são refrigerantes e tem registo no seu negocio. O negócio segundo relata está num bom ritmo e margem lucro mensal é 2.000MT e com os rendimentos do negócio consegue sustentar a família, aumentar volume de negócio, reabilitar sua casa e poupancas. No futuro pretende reforçar e diversificar os produtos que oferece aos clientes e provavelmente vai precisar de empréstimo e duma maneira geral está entusiasmado com o crédito porque melhorou substancialmente o negócio.

loans.use: To increase and diversify stock in his business

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya is a single mother from Simferopol, Ukraine who supports herself with a business offering employment finding services. Employment agencies such as Uliya’s are good for both employers and employees, connecting those needing help with those looking for work. Uliya has a good location for her business near the center of town. She has gained many good contacts over the four years that she has been in business which helps her offer better services. Uliya has one daughter still at home who is seventeen. One of her goals is to help her daughter with her upcoming college expenses.

Uliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase online advertising for her employment business. She has worked hard to establish a stable, profitable business. We are glad to be able to assist her with further expansion and success.

loans.use: Uliya would like to purchase online advertising for her employment agency services.

loans.name: Alime

texts.en:
Alime has a small business selling women’s clothing at the bustling Central market in Simferopol, Ukraine. She sells a selection of day-to-day wear as well as dressy clothes. Alime is single and has been in business for four years. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this is times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. Alime has expanded her business by opening a second sales kiosk and is thinking of opening a third kiosk in the future.

Alime has requested a short term loan to help renew her supply of clothing inventory. The change of seasons means a busy time of year for clothing vendors like Alime. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: Alime would like to renew her supply of inventory for her women's clothing stall.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Vasyl has sold agricultural products such as potatoes, flax and mushrooms in the central market of Unyatichy, Western Ukraine. A married father of two, Vasyl is determined to provide a better living for his entire family. He currently has about $2400 in inventory and his monthly profit is about $1400.

Vasyl is hard working and persistent, giving him the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Vasyl has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. Currently he is seeking a loan to purchase raw vegetables wholesale and expand his business. With the increased income, Vasyl plans to continue growing his business and improving the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: Vasyl would like to purchase inventory wholesale for his agricultural products business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a small business owner from Simferopol, Ukraine. She sells jeans and other clothing at the large Central market in Simferopol. Her business is unique in her market in that she is one of the only ones who sells jeans in bulk supplies as well as by the pair. Elena has been in business for about five years. She is divorced and has a 16 year old daughter who lives with her. Elena’s business provides about half of her income. She also owns an apartment and a house that she rents out for additional income.

Elena has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase a new supply of clothing inventory. This loan will help her continue to operate a successful business so that she can provide for the needs of herself and her daughter.

loans.use: Elena would like to purchase clothing inventory for her clothing stall.

loans.name: Ulviya

texts.en:
Ulviya is a sharp young entrepreneur who owns her own small clothing sales business. She started her business about two years ago and currently has an excellent sales location at the large and busy Central market in Simferopol, Ukraine. Ulviya sells a variety of women’s clothing with modern styles at reasonable prices. She would like to expand her business in the future and eventually purchase her own small kiosk to work from. Ulviya is not married and lives with her parents and two brothers. One day her business may allow her to purchase her own place to live.

Ulviya has requested a loan to help purchase additional clothing inventory. This is her first loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist her financially and help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Ulviya would like to purchase additional clothing inventory for her business.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two kids. He’s from Kherson in the southern part of Ukraine. Igor sells groceries in the local central market. His merchandise is assorted and of very good quality. Igor has been in this trade for 7 years. He has promptly repaid 6 previous loans. Currently he has about $4000 in inventory stock. His monthly net profit is about $1600.

Igor is very disciplined and responsible. He is thorough and his mind is very sharp – he can keep all his business details in his head. All these qualities have helped Igor overcome many challenges that have come his way and allowed him to reach success in business. He has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. Igor is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and bringing him profit.

loans.use: Igor would like to purchase inventory for his grocery stall.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga lives in the province of El Seibo, in the community of Colinas Don Guillermo.  She is a hard-working woman, puts a lot of effort into her business, and has an entrepreneurial spirit.  She has now become quite the businesswoman!   She started out by selling accessories for women, such as hair pieces and beauty supplies.  She developed her business to the point that she now owns a boutique where she sells clothes, shoes, beauty accessories, and home accessories! 

She requests a loan of 15,000 pesos (450 USD) to continue investing in her business, expanding it, and moving forward.  She says that her goal is to continue developing a sustainable business, generate the necessary income to repay her loan, and satisfy the needs of her clients. 

We wish Olga the best of luck, and thank you all for supporting her!

loans.use: To buy high-quality clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is a small entrepreneur from Beregovo, Ukraine. She owns a venture selling groceries at affordable prices in a local store. One of the best attractions of her business is a nice selection of different food items that are always fresh and sell well. Ildika has benefited from loans she has received through Nadiya Ukraine over the last two years. Today her turnover capital has grown to $5000 and her net profit is about $1000 a month.

Ildika dreams about the further growth and expansion of her trade. She is very persistent and motivated, and likes to set new goals and achieve success. She is also an entrepreneur of integrity and responsibility. We believe her highly motivated business perspectives and natural characteristics as an efficient business manager are a wonderful combination of qualities that can help her repay this loan and achieve her long-term business plans.

loans.use: Ildika would like to increase the assortment of her inventory for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
A small entrepreneur from Mikhailovka, Irina owns a business selling gifts and lampstands in a local mall called “Torgovyi Dom” (Trade House). She is a married mother of two daughters and a son. Irina has a nice selection of inventory that is trendy and affordable, too. She has been in the trade for 12 years. Currently, she has about $3400 in inventory.

Irina is an experienced entrepreneur. She has tried working in different business spheres. However souvenir sales became a niche that Irina chose for herself. Irina is an outstanding example of a perseverant and focused high-achiever. She can balance family and business and manage her time very effectively. Today Irina is requesting a loan to stock her vending place with new merchandise. We believe all her positive qualities will help Irina repay the current loan and achieve her goals.

loans.use: Irina would like to grow her business selling gifts, lamp stands and souvenirs.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced with two children. Her family lives in Mikhailovka, Ukraine. Yelena sells retail items such as leather goods, bijouterie and other accessories. She owns a small vending kiosk right at the market entrance which is a very favorable location for her trade. Yelena can boast business stability over the past 6 years. Presently, her monthly net profit is about $400.

Yelena loves her business. She believes the little knick-knacks she sells in her kiosk make her customers prettier and more attractive, bringing more joyful moments into their lives. Yelena works hard to keep her business sustainable and raise her kids, providing for all their basic needs. She knows how hard it is to be a single parent. However, Yelena never gives up and tries to be more cheerful and optimistic. Today she is seeking a loan of 3500 UAH to increase her turnover capital and further expand her trade.

loans.use: Yelena would like to increase the turnover capital of her small retail kiosk.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with a 5-year-old daughter. He is a small entrepreneur who sells fish at the local train station market in Melitopol. There are usually many customers in this market as the station is a popular destination for many travelers. Vladimir is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Vladimir admits he has benefited a lot in the past 5 years from his relationship with Nadiya Ukraine. Financial assistance he has received has helped him grow and expand his business. Currently Vladimir has about $1000 in inventory. His gross income is about $1400 and his monthly net profit is about $400. Today Vladimir is requesting a loan of 1000 UAH to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Vladimir would like to increase his stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Futuro Group

texts.en:
Carmen is taking out her first loan and will be starting a business selling towels throughout her community. Her plan is to buy bulk packages of towels at a discounted price at flea markets. As a street vendor, she will sell the towels in her community and neighboring towns.

Carmen is 54 years old. She lives with two of her four children and her husband. She says that it is her hope to be successful enough with this first loan to take out subsequent ones, and in this way build a substantial business one day. She says she will always work to continue providing her children with security, a safe home, and as many opportunities as she can.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and Carmen herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy towels in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three sewing machines and materials need to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.en:
Antonia and her husband live in the small eastern town of Samana, where they raised five children (ages: 20, 21, 30, 32, 34). This will be her 6th loan with Esperanza, and over the past 3 years her business has grown significantly. She now runs a good sized grocery store in her community, and plans to buy more beans, pasta, salsa, and laundry detergent to increase her selection and stock. In her free time, Antonia enjoys spending time with her husband, praying, fishing, and watching her grandchildren grow up.

Esperanza wants to thank you for your continued support, and we hope that you will enjoy watching this group continue to grow. God Bless!

loans.use: Restock grocery store and expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hardware, including cement, nails, paints and wood.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
This gentleman is a retailer in the busy neighborhood of Ziguinchor. He is asking for a short-term loan which he plans to repay in 10 months and will use to reinforce his little shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ce sociétaire est un détaillant dans un quatier populaire de Ziguinchor, il sollicite un crédit remboursable en 10 mois pour renforcer son commerce.

loans.use:
to reinforce his little business

pour renforcer son commerce

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Toleda is a calm, honest and very hardworking woman who started her own business in order to supplement her income after the death of her husband, since the money she received from his pension wasn't enough to provide for her two children. She started working for herself in February of 1993, when the family owned a taco stand at their local market, started thanks to a loan they had received. But after her husband passed away, Gloria wasn't able to maintain the business on her own and had to sell it. Afterwards, she worked selling various products in order to support her children. Then a friend invited her to take a craft class, which she really enjoyed. This led her to start her own craft business, with her friend sending her customers. So far, her customers have been very satisfied with her work and have been recommending her products to relatives and other friends, allowing Gloria's business to keep growing.

Now Gloria is seeking a $450 loan, to be repaid in 5 months, in order to buy the basic materials that she uses to make her products and be able to fill all of her orders. Your generosity will help Gloria continue to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria T. es una persona tranquila, honesta y muy trabajadora inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener otro ingreso, ya que su esposo falleció y la pensión que le dejó no me era suficiente. Necesitaba tener un ingreso que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. Comenzó en Febrero de 1993, antes de fallecer su esposo tenían una taquería en el mercado que habían puesto gracias a un crédito que obtuvieron, pero después de fallecer yo ya no pudo atenderla por lo cual tuvo que traspasarla y se dedico a vender diversas cosas para sostener a sus hijos, fue entonces que una amiga la invitó a tomar un curso de manualidades el cual le gustó mucho, animándose a poner su negocio y su amiga le comenzó a enviar clientes, los cuales quedaban contentos con su trabajo y la iban recomendando entre sus familiares y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando adornos y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Gloria seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Johana Gutierrez

texts.es:
Johana works as a domestic servant. She has a 2 year-old boy and lives with a partner who works as a building worker and supports her economically. Johana’s dream is to strengthen her family and improve their life conditions. One of her goals is to improve her house and the loan requested is to build a wall and this way erect her house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Johana trabaja como doméstica en una casa de habitación. Tiene un niño de 2 años y es acompañada, su compañero se desempeña como albañil y le apoya económicamente. El sueño de Johana es llegar a consolidar su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dentro de las mejoras está la de su casa, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para levantar una pared en su casa de habitación y así ir levantándola poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase material to build a wall to improve living conditions at home.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia is an excellent client. In addition to being very humble, she is responsible and punctual in her payments. She previously received a group loan with a group named ‘Pensamiento,’ in which she had no problem in the repayment of her loans since they were all paid on time.

To help maintain her family, she sells plants and has her own nursery where she grows all types of plants. She also helps her husband, who is a carrier, with the maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Hortencia Y. es una excelenta cliente, ademas D. ser muy humilD. es una persona responsable y muy puntual en sus cuotas, la Sra. trabajó con un Credito D. grupo el cual se llamaba Pensamiento, en el mismo tampoco tuvo problemas en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que todas las canceló puntualmente. Para ayudar a mantener a su familia ella trabaja vendiendo Plantas, posee su Vivero donD. cultiva todo tipo D. plantas, además ayuda a su esposo - que es transportista - con el mantenimiento D. su vehiculo.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and plants for her nursery.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Toleda is a calm, honest and very hardworking woman who started her own business in order to supplement her income after the death of her husband, since the money she received from his pension wasn't enough to provide for her two children. She started working for herself in February of 1993, when the family owned a taco stand at their local market, started thanks to a loan they had received. But after her husband passed away, Gloria wasn't able to maintain the business on her own and had to sell it. Afterwards, she worked selling various products in order to support her children. Then a friend invited her to take a craft class, which she really enjoyed. This led her to start her own craft business, with her friend sending her customers. So far, her customers have been very satisfied with her work and have been recommending her products to relatives and other friends, allowing Gloria's business to keep growing.

Now Gloria is seeking a $450 loan, to be paid in 5 months, in order to buy the basic materials that she uses to make her products and be able to fill all of her orders. Your generosity will help Gloria continue to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria T. es una persona tranquila, honesta y muy trabajadora inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener otro ingreso, ya que su esposo falleció y la pensión que le dejó no me era suficiente. Necesitaba tener un ingreso que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. Comenzó en Febrero de 1993, antes de fallecer su esposo tenían una taquería en el mercado que habían puesto gracias a un crédito que obtuvieron, pero después de fallecer yo ya no pudo atenderla por lo cual tuvo que traspasarla y se dedico a vender diversas cosas para sostener a sus hijos, fue entonces que una amiga la invitó a tomar un curso de manualidades el cual le gustó mucho, animándose a poner su negocio y su amiga le comenzó a enviar clientes, los cuales quedaban contentos con su trabajo y la iban recomendando entre sus familiares y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando adornos y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Gloria seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa is a 49 year-old widow who lives in the district “Raspan Sur”, she has a 30 year-old daughter who supports her economically as well as socially. Doña Rosa is a seamstress and at the same time she owns a small lunchroom. She has been in charge of both businesses for the last 20 years so she had something to fall back on if any of the businesses would fail or generate low earnings. She requests the loan to improve the infrastructure of her lunchroom and thus make it more prosperous and for herself to grow as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y habita en el barrio Raspan Sur, tiene una hija de 30 años que le apoya en todos los sentidos tanto económico como social. Doña Rosa es costurera y a la misma vez tiene un pequeño comedor. Tiene 20 años de estar en ambos negocios y esto le ha servido para apoyarse si alguno de ellos le falla o genera pocos ingresos. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la infraestructura del comedor y así algún día poder hacerlo más próspero, para ella como mujer también crecer.

loans.use: Improve infrastructure of lunchroom to increase earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 cows

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a good and very responsible client. She sells recyclable materials, which greatly helps her maintain her family being that her husband is much older and breeds animals.

She previously received a group loan, which she repaid responsibly and punctually, but she had to retire from it due to family problems. Despite these problems, she never fell behind in any of her payments. She decided to retire and not receive any more loans for fear that her family problems would cause her trouble repaying them.

Today, she needs this loan to purchase more prime materials and more animals, and in that way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Rosa es una cliente muy responsable y buena, ella se dedica a vender material reciclable, con lo que ayuda bastante a mantener su familia, ya que su esposo es bastante mayor en edad y se dedica a criar animales,

Ella tenia un crédito grupal, el cual pago muy responsable y puntulmente pero tuvo que retirarse debido a problemas familiares, aun con estos problemas ella no se retraso en ninguna de sus cuotas, decidio retirarse y no trabajar mas con creditos por temor a que los problemas familiares le ocasionaran problemas para pagar sus cuotas.

Ahora ella necesita de este préstamo para poder comprar mas material de trabajo y tambien para comprar mas animales y asi poder incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase fodder and more recyclable material.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45465

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan lives in the district “Hugo Chávez” in Managua, he is 39 years old, married, with two children, 17 and 5 years of age, the older one is studying high school and the younger has just started in school. He is a merchant who owns a small general store with a variety of products. He has had this business for the past 4 years and he has been able to make it grow by means of loans. This activity has allowed Don Juan to support his family and offer them better life standards as well as a house to live in. With the loan don Juan will change the roof of his house and business. His wish is to always generate enough income to support his children and offer them education which he will achieve setting his heart on making his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Juan habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez de Managua, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, con 2 hijos de 17 y 5 años, ambos se encuentran estudiando, el mayor ya en secundaria, y la menor empezando sus estudios. Es un comerciante que posee una pequeña distribuidora en donde oferta variedad de productos. Tiene 4 años de estar en este negocio, el cual ha podido sacar adelante a través de financiamientos. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Don Juan mantener a su familia y darles mejores condiciones de vida, así como una casa donde habitar. Con el préstamo don Juan cambiará el techo de su casa de habitación y también de su negocio. Espera poder siempre tener un ingreso para mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, lo que logrará poniéndole mucho empeño a su negocio para que siga creciendo

loans.use: Change the roofs of dwelling and general store.

loans.name: Zenon Ignacio

texts.es:
Zenon is a designer and embroiderer, and designs wedding gowns as well as gowns for events such as weddings, quinceañeras (15th birthday parties for girls) and others.

Zenon has a sewing workshop where he makes his dresses. He is a very stable and responsible worker, and he has made his loan payments punctually to date.

Now he would like to invest in construction materials for his home, which he has been able to build little by little. With much effort, the house is now in the final phase of construction.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Zenon C., es costurero bordador, diseña vestidos para novias y damas para eventos como matrimonios, fiestas de quinceaños y otros.

Don Zenon posee un taller de costura donde hace sus vestidos, es un trabajador muy constante y reponsable, hasta la fecha ha cumplido puntualmente con las cuotas de su crédito.

Ahora Él quiere invertir en material de construcion para su casa, que a venido construyendo poco a poco, y con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra en la etapa final de su construcion.

loans.use: Invest in construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio L. is a responsible person, happy and optimistic. He is married and has 2 children, Sonia is 28 years old and she has a degree in Psychology and is single. His son Juan Gabriel is 23 years old and is studying Psychology, and is single. Both are living at home. He started his business because he needed to have a permenent income, seeing as he was left unemployed and he needed to help his family. He started in April 1978 when he was layed off from the company where he worked as a driver. Once he was left without a job, with the severance pay, he purchased an electric saw, a tool tha the needed for everything. Since then the owner of the company where he worked offered him a job privately so that he would work as a handy man, painting fences etc. He kept on workign for the man and at the same time he was being recommneded to friends and since then he has seen success and today he has a nubmer of good clients.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $450 that will be repaid in a term of 5 months so that he can purchase various tools and painting tools and paints so that he can better service his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio López es una persona responsable, alegre y optimista. Es casado y tiene 2 hijos Sonia de 28 años, Lic. En Psicología, soltera y Juan Gabriel de 23 años, estudiante de la carrera de Psicología, soltero; ambos viven en casa Inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso permanente, ya que quedo desempleado y tenía que sacar adelante a su familia. Comenzó en Abril de 1978, cuando fue liquidado de un Refaccionario en donde trabajaba como chofer, y al quedarse sin trabajo, con el dinero de la liquidación, se compro una máquina para cortar césped así como diversa herramienta que necesitaba. De hecho, el dueño de la empresa donde había trabajado le dio trabajo en su casa para que fuera cortando el césped, pintando cercas, etc. el le siguió dando trabajo y al mismo tiempo lo iba recomendando con sus amistades, desde entonces le ha ido bien y en la actualidad tiene un buen número de clientes.

Actualmente el solicita un crédito por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar herramienta diversa y una desorilladora de césped, así como pintura, brochas, etc. para poder proporcionar un mejor servicio a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase building tools.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa is a married mother of 3 children ages 12, 7, and 4. Her husband works as a carpenter. She decided to start her own business because she needed to help with the family finances. Furthermore, her husband earned very little, so they needed the extra income. She has been selling all types of footwear by catalogue for 4 years.

She is requesting a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, to invest in the purchase of more shoes. Sometimes her customers order several pairs of shoes, but since she is not able to by them, she has to wait for other customers to pay her. With your help, María will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María Luisa es casada tiene 3 hijos de 12,7 y 4 años, su esposo trabaja como carpintero. inicio el negocio ya que necesitaba ayudar en la economía familiar además de que su esposo ganaba poco y necesitaban un ingreso extra ya tiene cuatro años dedicándose a esto y ahora esta vendiendo de todos los zapatos por catalogo que hay en el mercado

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir, y comprar mas zapatos porque a veces le piden varios pares y no los puede comprar entonces tiene que esperar a que otros clientes le paguen. Con tu ayuda María saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Elia
