texts.es:
Rosa Elia started this business because she needed to help with the family expenses, and help both her children and grandchildren financially. Her children are adults now, but she is currently looking after two grandchildren. She needs the additional income because they live with her. Since she loves to cook, she decided to sell food to the factory workers who live near her house.

She is requesting a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a small table and chairs. She is currently selling food to go, but would like to eventually open up a diner in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Elia inició el negocio porque necesitaba ayudar en la economía familiar, y ayudar a sus hijos y nietos económicamente. Los hijos de la señora ya son mayores pero ahora se hace cargo de dos nietos y necesitaba mas ingreso porque viven con ella así que como le gusta mucho hacer comida decidió vender a los trabajadores de fabricas que viven por su casa.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US$500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mesita con sillas porque solo vende la comida para llevar y desea tener un negocio en su casa de fonda.

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Propositos Group

texts.en:
Ana is taking out her first loan with Esperanza, along with the other nine members in her group. She has asked for this loan to improve and expand her business, the manufacture of curtains and linens.

Ana lives in the city of Santiago, the second-largest city in the Dominican Republic, with her husband and two small children. Her goal is to expand her business. Within the next two years, she hopes to have a factory and not just a small business that she runs by herself. She dreams of providing a safe and healthy upbringing to her children. She wants to teach them to become hardworking individuals and help them go to college. For herself, Ana dreams of becoming a successful and strong businesswoman, and improving her family's economic status.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and Ana herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy materials for high-quality curtains and linens.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino Hernández is a married father of 3 children ages 20, 17, and 15. He started his business because he needed the income to support his children. He started working as a taxi driver at the bus station 38 years ago. He decided to save up enough money to buy himself a taxi cab and continue in the business because for many years, he had rent the vehicle, thus he was left without money.

He is requesting a loan of $675 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can finish paying his taxi license fees and also pay for another taxi cab. With your help, Avelino will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Avelino Hernández es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 15 años. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso para la atención de sus hijos, hace 38 años como ecotaxista de la central de autobuses. Decidió juntar dinero para comprarse un ecotaxi y continuar en el negocio ya que durante muchos años tuvo que estar pagando la renta de uno y tuvo muchas carencias económicas por esta situación.

Solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para completar el pago de las placas de su taxi y abonar a otro taxi. Con tu ayuda don Avelino saldrá adelante

loans.use: Pay taxi cab license fees

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is undoubtedly the leader of her Bank of Hope. Ysabel sells undergarments, beauty products, perfumes, and jeans, and she is now taking out her second loan with Esperanza International. She says that she would use this second loan to invest in a new product--portable home stoves. Many people in her community cannot afford a full stove and oven, but they can afford the portable and compact gas stoves. This is an excellent opportunity to fill an unmet need in her community.

She lives with her husband and seven children, three of whom are adopted. She is now six months pregnant. She says that it can be hard to proviD. for 8 people every day, but the success of her past loan gives her hope that if she continues to work hard, things will get better. Her dream is one day to have her own store where she can sell anything she wants. She says that this store would be big, with big windows, and it would be a place where women could find the latest fashion or home accessories.

She dreams of achieving a stable economic state in her life so that she can send her children to a university. She wants each child to pursue one of the professions. For herself, she says that her dream is look back on her life in peace and without regrets, knowing that she did the best she could and provided a good life for her children.

Ysabel, as well as the other 14 women in her Bank of Hope¸ thank you for your generosity and support with this loan. They are excited about the prospect of improving life for themselves, their children, and their community through hard work.

loans.use: To invest in women's clothing and portable gas stoves.

loans.name: Yuliana Lizet

texts.en:
Yuliana Lizet P. R. has a business selling shirts, underwear, gifts, and stuffed animals in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, in La Libertad Region.  She has 4 years of experience and many loyal customers.  She sells her goods from a stand she rents in the Victoria Market.

Yuliana is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  She loves building relationships and earning money for her family.  Yuliana looks forward to working hard everyday and saving for her family's future.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Yuliana is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to restock her most popular items.

loans.use: To restock her most popular items

loans.name: Meriluz Rosa

texts.en:
Meriluz Rosa M. V. has a business manufacturing milk based products in Moche, a suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  Meriluz makes yogurt, cheese, and chocolates from an extra kitchen she built into home.  She started the business 4 years ago after years of selling milk.  She earns much more money now.

Meriluz is 39 years old, married and has 4 children.  She loves being her own boss and being able to spend more time with her family.  She has many loyal customers who she distributes her goods to weekly.  She has learned over time the importance of keeping her clients happy.  This includes standards of quality, quantity, and preparing her products to the specific needs of a client.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adalante II, Meriluz is requesting a loan of $300 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, and fruit.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Adilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Adilia, 34 years old, is married with two minor children. She teaches elementary school; she has always been a teacher and is proud of the fact that she knows she is educating tomorrow’s professionals. Her husband supports her with the household expenses, but the dream of this teacher is to have her house completely built so her family has a decent place to live with all the necessary comfort. She requests the loan to buy building material and make the necessary redesigning of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adilia es casada, tiene dos hijos menores de edad y tiene 34 años. Ella se dedica a enseñar a niños de primaria, desde siempre a sido docente y le agrada el hecho de saber que esta formando a los profesionales del mañana. Su esposo la apoya con los gastos de la casa, pero el gran anhelo de esta profesora es tener su casa construida completamente para que su familia viva en un lugar digno que cuente con todas las comodidades necesarias. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar algunas remodelaciones necesarias en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase building material to redesign dwelling.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F. G. manufactures milk products in Moche, a suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  These products include yogurt, creamsickles, and candies but she plans on offering more in the future.  She started the business 2 years ago after working in the dairy industry for most of her life.  She owns some cows and sold milk to the local dairy but now earns far more with her new business.

Elizabeth is 44 years old, married with 4 children.  She loves building relationships, discovering creative new products and working with her family.  Her husband is very supportive and they are excited about their future.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adelante II, Elizabeth is requesting of loan of $300 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients and molds to make yogurt.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and molds to make yogurt.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy Fernandez G. D. Veliezmoro has a business manufacturing yogurt in Moche, a suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  Nancy started her business a year ago with the help of her family.  After a steep learning curve, she now earns a healthy profit and plans on expanding her operation as soon as she has the necessary resources.

Nancy is 42 years old and happily married with 3 children.  She is hard working, ambitious, and friendly.  She started the business because she wanted to help her husband economically and be able to spend more time with her children.  She is customer oriented and will fulfill any order.  For example sometimes clients want sugarless yogurt and she will specially prepare it.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adelante II, Nancy is requesting a loan of $300 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy milk, sugar, and concentrate.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, and concentrate.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. German A. has always been dedicated to agriculture. He is 50 years old, has 4 children and is single. As his activity has always been focused on making the land produce the loans requested has generally been spent on necessary supplies to obtain a good production. In the future Don German expects to have his own working capital which will allow him to cover the costs and buy more land in order to increase production and grow as a farmer. He needs the loan to go on purchasing farming supplies for his crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. German A. por siempre se ha dedicado a la Agricultura, es un hombre de 50 años, tiene cuatro hijos y su estado es civil es soltero. Como su actividad ha estado siempre enfocada en hacer producir la tierra, por lo general los préstamos que siempre ha solicitado son para financiamiento de insumos necesarios para lograr una buena producción. Don German espera un día tener su propio capital de trabajo que le permitan cubrir estos gastos y comprar más tierra para sacar más producción y crecer como agricultor. Necesita el crédito para seguir comprando insumos agrícolas para su cosecha.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies to increase crops.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Sandra is 38 years old, she lives in an area close to the capital known as Ticuantepe, she is married, has two children, one goes to school and the other is still a baby. Her husband is a security guard and also dedicated to farming on a small piece of land that they own. Doña Sandra works at the “Ministerio de Salud” (health ministry) of Ticuantepe and she is also dedicated to farming. One of her big dreams is to increase production of her crops and thus increase her income to be able to improve the living conditions of her family. The loan requested by doña Sandra will be spent on buying fertilizer and other farming supplies needed to obtain a good production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sandra tiene 38 años, vive en una zona cercana a nuestra capital conocida como Ticuantepe, ella es casada, tiene dos hijos uno en edad escolar y otro que esta tierno. Su esposo es guarda de seguridad y también se dedica a la agricultura en una pequeña parcela de tierra que poseen. Doña Sandra trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud de Ticuantepe y a la vez se dedica a la Agricultura, uno de sus grandes anhelos es aumentar la producción en sus cultivos y por ende aumentar sus ingresos, que son los que le van a ayudar a vivir en mejores condiciones de vida a ella y a su familia. El préstamo doña Sandra lo esta solicitando para invertir el dinero en compra de abono y otros insumos agrícolas que se necesitan para lograr una buena producción.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies to improve crops.

loans.name: Armando Enrique

texts.ru:
Mr. Armando Enrique, 55 years old, lives in the District 380 of the city of Managua with his wife. They both work hard in order to give the best to their 17 year-old daughter. He has been working as a photographer for 20 years, when he started as an amateur, and his wife is supporting him as a merchant at her small neighborhood store with plans to expand to increase earnings. He requests the loan to enlarge the front part of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Armando Enrique de 55 años reside en el Barrio 380 de la ciudad de Managua junto a su esposa, ambos trabajan arduamente para darle lo mejor a su hija de 17 años, el como fotógrafo desde hace 20 años que inicio como aficionado y su esposa apoyándolo como comerciante con una pequeña pulpería con planes de ampliarla para mejorar sus ingresos. Solicita el préstamo para ampliar la parte frontal de su casa.

loans.use: Enlarge front part of neighborhood store.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Mrs. A. is 48 years old and has two teenage children, both of whom are students. Rosa Emilia is a hard-working woman and very conscientious in her work. She is a farmer who worries constantly that her land will produce well, as this is how she earns income to support herself and her children.

She combines her farming work with selling fruit, and thinks that selling her own product enables her to obtain a better profit. She needs a loan to invest in agricultural supplies that will help her increase the yields she obtains from her land parcels.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. A. es una mujer de 48 años, tiene dos hijos que están en la etapa de la adolescencia y ambos están estudiando. Doña Rosa Emilia es una mujer luchadora y muy cuidadosa de su trabajo, es una agricultora que se preocupa por que su tierra este siempre produciendo ya que es la manera en que ella obtiene sus ingresos para ella y sus hijos. Combina su trabajo de agricultora con la comercialización de frutas, cree que vendiendo ella directamente sus productos podrá obtener mejores ganancias, y eso le ayudará a aumentar sus utilidades. Necesita el préstamo. necesita para invertirlos en insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a incrementar la producción en sus parcelas de tierra.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies to increase production.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José Almaraz has been working as a taxi cab driver for 6 years in order to cover his family expenses and make his own money. He is married to Maricela de la Rosa Álvarez, who works as a nurse.

He is currently requesting a loan of $500 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can make his cab look more presentable.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan José Almaraz es taxista oficio que practica desde hace 6 años para poder solventar los gastos de su familia y tener sus propios ingresos. Es casado, su esposa se llama Maricela de la Rosa Álvarez quien trabaja como enfermera.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses que invertirá en la imagen de su carro y así tener más presentable su taxi.

loans.use: Improve taxi cab

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria del Refugio sells wholesale stuffed animals for a living. She is a divorced mother of 2 grown-up children who are both married. She started this business because she did not receive enough pension money to cover the household expenses. Eight years ago, she started selling stuffed animals for floral arrangements. After that, she started selling them wholesale because it yields greater profits.

She is requesting a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase display shelves for her business. With your help, María will advance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Refugio se dedica a la venta de muñecos de peluche por mayoreo es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores y están casados. Inicio el negocio ya que no completaba con el dinero que se le otorgaba como pensión para solventar los gastos de su casa. Hace 8 años inicio vendiendo peluches para los arreglos florales, y posteriormente empezó a hacerlo por mayoreo ya que le dan mas ganancias.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar exhibidores para su negocio. Con tu ayuda María progresara.

loans.use: Purchase display shelves

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosari

texts.es:
Mrs. Guadalupe C. is a married, 34 year old woman. She has 3 children. She has been working hard selling clothes and cosmetics on the street in order to help her husband (who sells lottery tickets) with the daily expenses. They live in the neighborhood “Memorial Sandino”. She has had her business for the past 18 years, and even though she has a steady group of customers she plans to increase her product offering so that she can better server her clients. Guadalupe would like to obtain a loan in order improve their living conditions by changing the roof of her house and plastering the walls.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Guadalupe C. es una mujer de 34 años casada con 3 hijos desde que formo su familia ha trabajado duro como vendedora ambulante de ropa y cosmeticos para ayudarle a su esposo quien vende loteria , vive en el barrio memorial sandino. Su negocio lo tiene hace 18 años, el cual ha adquirido buena clientela pero sus planes son incrementar las ventas con nuevos productos de acuerdo a exigencias de los clientes. El credito lo quiere para cambiar el techo en su vivienda y repellar paredes y mejorar sus condiciones en su hogar, cambiando el techo de los cuartos y repellar paredes de cuarto.

loans.use: To improve their living conditions by fixing the roof and the walls.

loans.name: Union Y Desarollo Group

texts.en:
Yosayra lives in the small rural community of Consuelo, in the eastern interior of the Dominican Republic.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy used and new clothing to sell in her community.  She hopes that one day she will be able to buy or rent a fixed space from which to sell her clothing.  She will use the this loan to buy more clothes at a bulk price, and in this way increase her profit margin.

Although she has no children right now, she says she that she looks forward to having her own family one day.  Her dream is to own her own house in which to raise her future family.  

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and of Yosayra herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase clothes at bulk prices.

loans.name: Gladys Katheryne

texts.en:
Gladys Datheryne P. R. has a business selling clothing, gifts, and stuffed animals in La Esperanza, suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  She sells her products from a booth at the Mercado Victoria in the center of town.  She has 4 years of experience managing her store and has many loyal customers.

Gladys is 26 years old, single and without children.  Her business is very important to her.  She studied to become a teacher at a local University but no jobs were available after she graduated.  She’s glad she is in a situation where she can help her family and save money.

A member of the community bank Mujeres En Accion, Gladys is requesting a loan of $625 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to restock her best selling products.

loans.use: To restock her best selling products

loans.name: Patricia Gosvinda

texts.en:
Patricia Gosvinda S. R. has a business renting taxis in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, of the Libertad Region.  Patricia is a wonderful success story: she started her business 3 years ago with one taxi.  She now has a fleet of 4 and dreams of more.  Her husband is a skilled mechanic who has been an invaluable resource for her business.

Patricia is 49 years old and has 3 children.  She is a very hard worker and a charismatic community leader.  In addition Patricia is a volunteer health officer for the local hospital.  Before she started her business her family was in a terrible economic situation.  Now she can breathe easier and hopes to be able to send her children to University.  

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Patricia is requesting a loan of $625 to repay over 4 months.  She would like the loan to repair a motor and buy spare parts.

loans.use: To repair a motor and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.en:
Rosa Eugenia B. P. is a busy businesswoman in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, of La Libertad Region.  From a space she built on to her house, Rosa runs a beauty salon and a call center and sells cosmetics.  Rosa has 8 years of experience managing these businesses.

Rosa is 36 years old and a single mother of 3 children.  Her children mean everything to her so she is happy that she can work from her home where she can also spend time with her family.  She works and saves so one day her children can all attend university.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Rosa is requesting a loan of $225 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy new clippers and restock more of her cosmetic products.

loans.use: To buy new clippers and restock more of her cosmetic products.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin es un señnor que tiene 30 años viviendo en la comunidad de Wisamaya.  El tiene 46 años de edad, y tiene 8 hijos - 3 mayores y 5 que todavia estan al lado de sus padres.  Martin ha solicitado un prestamo de 6000 bolivianos para el comercializacion de carne.  Este credito es el  primero que tiene este esñor con el institucion Fundacion Diaconia - FRIF. Con este dinero, el espera mejorar su nivel de ingreso economico para su familia.

loans.use: Compra y venta de carne de ovino, queso y otros productos

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a good client. She works alongside her husband, making bread to provide for her family of six. Thanks to previous credits she has requested, she and her husband were able to build their own oven in their home, which has benefited them much. They have been working long enough to get this business ahead; now they need a new loan to be able to buy more materials for their job so that they can reach more customers and increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elizabeth es una muy buena cliente, trabaja junto a su esposo, haciendo pan para mantener a su familia, en la que son seis integrantes. Gracias a un anterior Crédito que se le otorgó, ella y su esposo lograron construir su propio horno en su domicilio lo cual les beneficia mucho. Han estado trabajando bastante tiempo para sacar este negocio adelante, ahora necesitan un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mas material de trabajo y asi poder atender a mas clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing flour for their bakery

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Mrs. Trinidad is an old client, and a very good one. She has worked with our institution for four years now. She was a member of a credit Group, and now she works with individual credit. She has never defaulted on any credit; rather, she is very punctual and responsible. Her husband is the owner of the vehicle she uses for work. She helps him with the maintenance on it and also works with the automobile. Also, she works as a domestic employee, and in this way she is able to help support her large family. She needs this credit now to improve their quality of life by installing needed electrical connections in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Trinidad es una Cliente antigua y muy buena, ella trabaja con nuestra institucion ya cuatro años, ella era miembro de un Grupo solidario, ahora trabaja con un Crédito Individual, no falló en ninguno de sus creditos, al contrario es muy puntual y responsable. Su esposo es dueño de la movilidad con la que trabaja, ella ayuda a él con el mantenimiento del mismo y tambien trabaja con el Automovil, ademas ella trabaja tambien como empleada doméstica, con lo cual ayuda a mantener a su numerosa familia. Ahora necesita el Crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues instalará en su casa las conexiones electricas necesarias.

loans.use: Maintenance on their taxi and the installation of electricity in their home.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
The gentleman Enrique Garcia is originally from the municipality of Cinco Pinos (Five Pines). For 5 years he has been working at his general store, selling food items and electrical appliances in order to put food on the table for his wife and two children. It’s necessary to point out that his business has been growing thanks to the help he’s received from Ceprodel.

Today, he sees a need to invest in his business and is looking for Ceprodel’s support to obtain credit that will allow him to buy more products. The support from Ceprodel will benefit his business, his humble family and himself, as it is his duty to provide them with the necessary living conditions.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Translator.

El caballero Enrique G. es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica desde hace cinco años al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende vendiendo sus productos comestibles y algunos electrodomésticos con el propósito de llevar a su casa el alimento para sus dos hijos y su cónyuge. Es necesario destacar que su negocio ha venido desarrollándose gracias al apoyo que Ceprodel le ha brindado para la compra de los productos de la pulpería.

Hoy en día, al ver la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su negocio. Por medio del apoyo brindado por Ceprodel se beneficia tanto el, su negocio y su humilde familia el cual tiene el deber de proporcionarle las condiciones de vida necesarias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Héctor Raúl

texts.es:
Hector C. is from the municipality of Cinco Pinos (Five Pines) and vigorously dedicates himself to his home business of tricycle parts and repair. It’s necessary to emphasize that Hector C. is the father of three children and in spite of being single, his greatest efforts are to put food on the table for his children.

Ceprodel has been a pillar for his business, providing credit to buy spare parts from select suppliers. Today he’s approaching Ceprodel once again to solicit credit to buy said parts and sell them in his business. We can’t deny that he’s a loyal client of the institution, having repaid all of his credits on time and in accordance to terms agreed upon.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

Hector C. es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos y se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de la venta de de repuestos tricicletas y reparación de las mismas teniendo su propio negocio en su casa de habitación. Es necesario destacar que el caballero Hector C. es padre de tres hijos y además a pesar de estar actualmente soltero, sus mayores esfuerzos son para llevar el alimento a su mesa para el desarrollo de sus pequeños

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio debido a que le ha proporcionado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los repuestos a proveedores seleccionados. Hoy en día acude una vez mas a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de dichos repuestos para comercializarlos en su negocio. No podemos obviar que él es un fiel cliente de la institución habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for tricyles.

loans.name: Ana Roberta

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Roberta is a very good customer. Ever since she got her first loan from our institution, she has never had a late payment or any problem making her payments. She devotes herself to selling food at a shop that she obtained in a commercial area. She starts working very early given that this is her principal activity. The credit she was given before was used for her business, and also to help her daughter through her university studies. She is currently requesting a new loan to buy more goods and tools for her work, such as pots, ladles, rice, potatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Ana Roberta es una muy buena Cliente, ya que desde que obtuvo su primer crédito en nuestra institucion, no ha tenido atraso ni problema alguno en el pago de sus cuotas. La Señora se dedica a vender comida en un puesto que consiguio en una zona comercial, ella trabaja desde muy temprano ya que esta es su actividad principal. El Crédito que se le dio anteriormente lo utilizo para su negocio y ademas para ayudar a su hiija en sus estudios universitarios. Actualmente la señora solicita un nuevo Crédito para comprar mas material y Herramientas de trabajo como Ollas, Cucharones y la compra de Arroz, papa, etc.

loans.use: Invest in buying ingredients and equipment for her food stand

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides Alcara is 43-years-old and is the owner of "La Despensa Alci". A despensa is a mini-market that is very common in Paraguayan neighborhoods. In case someone needs some type of merchandise from food to cleaning products, they go to the despensa to get it.

Five years ago, Alci saw a large opportunity in the despensas market due to the shortage of them in his neighborhood, so he decided to open one. Today he has a loyal clientele, neighbors who know him and always come to him when they need something.

Alci's family is made up of his wife, Ana Rivas, and his two children, who have always helped him with his business. Ana is in charge of helping the customers of "La Despensa Alci." With the money from this loan, Alci will buy the merchandise necessary to continue his business: sugar, flour, herbs, rice, noodles, bread, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Alcides A. de 43 años de edad es el dueño de “La Despensa Alci”. La despensa es un mini supermercado muy común en barrios paraguayos. En caso de necesitar algún tipo de mercadería desde comestibles hasta productos de limpieza los vecinos del barrio siempre acuden a él.

Hace ya cinco anos Alci vio una gran oportunidad en el mercado de despensas debido a la escasez de ellas en su barrio, fue entonces cuando decidió abrir una. Hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada, vecinos que lo conocen y siempre recurren a el en caso de necesidad.

La familia de Alci esta conformada por su esposa, Ana Rivas, y sus dos hijos que siempre lo ayudan en el negocio. Ana es la encargada de la atención al cliente de “La Despensa Alci”. Con el dinero otorgado Alci comprará las mercaderías necesarias para continuar el negocio, las cuales son azúcar, harina, hierba, arroz, fideos, panificados y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Erika Selene

texts.es:
Erika C. is a single mother and has three children: Luis is 6 months old; Alejandra is 3 years old; and, Lupita is 5 years old, the last two have been diagnosed with Downs Syndrome. She started her business 10 years ago, having taken a seamstress course to help cover the family's expenses. Her parents were taken ill and were unemployed, and after she took the course, she started worked from her home to be able to earn an income to help her parents. Later she had her three kids, two of which were born with Downs Syndrome. She saw the need to keep up with her seamstress business to be able to support her children. She found herself unemployed and with an obligation to support her parents that were ill.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $775 that will be repaid in a term of 6 months to purchase a new sewing machine, one with more features and so that she can send her electric sewing machine out for repairs. This way she wil be able to provide her clients with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika C. es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos Luis de 6 meses, Alejandra de 3 años, y Lupita de 5 años, los dos últimos con síndrome de down. inició su negocio hace 10 años, tomo un curso de costura, para ayudar al gasto familiar, ya que sus padres se encontraban enfermos y sin empleo, después de que tomo el curso, se dedico a trabajar en su casa para poder tener ingresos y cuidar a sus papas. Posteriormente dio a luz a tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos nacieron con síndrome de Down, por tal motivo se vio en la necesidad de continuar con el negocio de costuras para poder atender a sus hijos. Se encontraba desempleada, y con la obligación de mantener a sus padres que se encontraban enfermos

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US$775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una maquina para hacer ojales y podrá mandar a repara una maquina de coser eléctrica. De esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.en:
At the age of 16 Anibal started working in an auto repair shop with his uncle where he began learning how to repair and maintain cars and motorcycles. Over the years, he gained a lot of experience. Now, Anibal is 28 years old and runs his own repair shop. Since he started his business four years ago, Anibal has become well known for the excellence of his work, and he now has a large number of customers.

Anibal dreams of having his business and his house in the same place. He has been saving money in order to buy a property where we could both work and live. The money from the loan would be used to help Anibal’s dream come true.

loans.use: To buy property for a joint house-workshop

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Mr. Jhonny is a responsible and punctual customer. He lives in the Periferica area, and has a photocopying and printing business. His dwelling is under an antichretic loan, one in which his creditor may use his land instead of charging interest. He is in charge of three children, and his photocopying and printing business is their only source of income. He will invest the money in purchasing machinery. Things are going well now, but as he gets more jobs, the machinery he now has won't suffice.

Mr. Jhonny has never been late in his payments, and in addition to being an honest, humble, and responsible man, he is very charismatic with great ambitions of improving himself.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Jhonny es un cliente muy responsable y puntual, vive en una zona Periferica y tienen un negocio de Fotocopias e impresiones, vive en calidad de Anticretico. El esta a cargo de tres niños y su unica fuente de ingresos son su servicio de Fotocopias e Impresiones. Invertira el dinero en la compra de maquinaria ya que ahora le va relativamente bien, pero necesita mas material de Trabajo y Maquinaria ya que la que tiene ahora no le es suficiente. Don Jhonny no tiene atraso alguno en el pago de sus cuotas y ademas de ser una persona muy honesta, humilde y responsable es una persona muy carismatica y con muchos deseos de superacion

loans.use: Invest in purchasing work equipment and machinery

loans.name: Blás

texts.en:
Blas R. is 25. He is married to Claudia Diaz (who is 21) and they have a five year old boy. Fifteen years ago, Blas started working with his father going door-to-door selling different products. This experience gave Blas a great opportunity to learn how to deal with customers.

Five years ago, he started his own business selling things door-to-door by motorbike. He calls his business “Macatero”. Blas is a well-known merchant in his town and he has the skills and experience required for a successful business; now, he has a wide range of customers. Every morning, Blas wakes up at 4 o'clock to begin his busy day.

Blas would use the money provided by the loan to purchase more products to sell, including curtains, sauce pans, and sheets.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory, including curtains, sauce pans, and sheets

loans.name: Mercedes Santos

texts.es:
Mercedes is a teacher who provides private instruction from her home. She is 31 years old, and has two small children ages six and eight who are in primary school. She wants to support their studies until they become professionals in the work force. She also lives with her mother, who she supports financially.

She has been in teaching for ten years and at first had difficulties, such as a shortage of desks/furniture as well as teaching supplies. Slowly, however, she overcame these challenges. Her near-term goal is to improve her business infrastructure. She needs a loan to purchase more teaching materials, as well as to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes es una maestra que se dedica a dar clases privadas en su casa de habitación. Tiene 31 años de edad, y 2 pequeños hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando la educación primaria, a quienes quiere apoyarlo en sus estudios hasta que estos se conviertan en profesionales. También vive con su mamá, a la cual apoya económicamente. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse al magisterio, al inicio de esto tuvo dificultades, como la falta de mobiliario y de equipos didácticos, pero estos los ha ido superando poco a poco. Sus planes a corto plazo es formalizar el negocio en cuanto a infraestructura se refiere. Desea invertir en material didáctico, y al mismo iempo hacer mejoras en su vivenda y para eso requiere del préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase teaching supplies and make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha and her husband are in the taxi business. They have been in this business for the past two years after they sold some land and bought a car with which they provide their taxi services. Both of them dedicate a lot of time and effort to their business, and they want at some point to change their car for a newer one. That is why they have started to save some money so that at some point in the future they will be able to buy a new car. Mrs. Bertha is 44 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Monseñor Lezcano, and has an 11 year old son who is currently studying. She asks for a loan in order to change the roof of her house (currently it is made out of tile and she would like to make it out of zinc).

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Bertha junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio de TAXI, tienen 2 años de pertenecer a este negocio, el cual empezaron cuando vendieron un terreno y compraron un vehículo para usarlo en el servicio de Taxi. A mbos dedican mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a este trabajo, desean cambiar su automóvil por uno más actual es por eso que empezaran a ahorrar de sus ganancias, para en un futuro poder comprarse un auto más moderno. Doña Bertha tiene 44 años de edad, habita en Monseñor Lezcano y tiene un hijo de 11 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Requiere del préstamo para cambiar el techo de su casa, actualmente es de tejas y quiere cambiarlo a zinc.

loans.use: To change the roof of her house

loans.name: Gonzalina

texts.en:
Gonzalina A., 40, is the owner of “Despensa Gonza”. Despensas are like mini supermarkets and are very popular in Paraguay. Every despensa is well-known in the neighborhood where it is located. Despensas are often very successful businesses in Paraguay because it is tradition to shop there. The owner knows the customers very well and they usually have a friendly relationship. Generally, the owner will know all of the gossip in the neighborhood and that attracts customers who not only go there to shop but also to hear what is going on in the area. For these reasons, many people prefer despensas to supermarkets.

With this in mind, Gonzalina decided to open a despensa in her house. She had previous experience in selling and dealing with customers because she had worked in a retail store. Using that previous experience, Gonzalina quickly attracted a large number of loyal customers.

Gonzalina is married to Claudio Ojeda, 47, and the couple has two boys. Thanks to Gonzalina’s entrepreneurial motivation, the family has its own house and her sons are going to college.

The money provided by the loan would be used to purchase more products to be sold in the despensa, including sugar, rice, milk, cheese, bread, and pasta.

loans.use: To buy products for a general store, including sugar, rice, milk, cheese, bread, and pasta

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro R. is not married but he is a single father to an 8 year old boy. The boy is currently in hospital fighting a bout of leukemia. He started his business so that he can continue his studies and to support his son, who requires constant hospitalization, medicines and medical support. Seeing as he is a single father he did not have the support to help with the boy, so he took on a business. He is works only on the weekends so that he can take care of his little one. He started the busines sin April 2000, importing used clothing from the US, and that which he sold to his neighbours and family members from the garage of his house. With faith and perseverence his business started to grow, and now he has even expanded into selling new clothing in the local market.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $975 that he will repay in a term of 6 months to refurbish his business and to purchase an air conditionner in preparation for the upcoming summer season. In this way he will be able to provide his clients with comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro Ramírez no esta casado sin embargo es padre de un niño de 8 años; quien actualmente se encuentra hospitalizado debido a que padece de leucemia. Inició el negocio para seguir estudiando y sacar adelante a su hijo, el cual constantemente requiere hospitalización, medicina y cuidado, Debido a que es papa soltero no tenia quien le ayudara a cuidarlo, decidió emprender un negocio, donde solo trabajara los fines de semana para poder cuidar a su menor. Comenzó en Abril del año 2000, importo ropa de U.S.A de segunda mano, la cual empezó a vender a sus vecinos y familiares en el porche de su casa, con fe y perseverancia su negocio fue creciendo, actualmente tiene su negocio de ropa nueva en el tianguis solidaridad.

Solicita un crédito por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio y comprar aire acondicionado, ya que se aproxima la temporada de calor y es necesario contar con ella. De esta forma le brindara mas confort a sus clientes.

loans.use: To refurbish his business.

loans.name: Yoselin Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Yoselin is a single mother and has worked for around four years with credit from our institution; it's worth stressing that she has used it in a very responsible and serious way, since to date she now has her own baking ovens that she uses to prepare sweet rolls and loaves of bread, which is her main business. She also works preparing food for various events like parties, wedding, graduation events, etc. She lives in her grandmother's house, who, being family, does not charge her rent. This woman is very responsible, and is one of our best customers, since she has never presented any problem from the time of her first loan. This shows her seriousness and commitment to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Yoselin es una madre soltera y ya trabaja alrededor de cuatro años con su crédito en nuestra institucion, vale recalcar que el mismo lo ha utilizado de manera muy responsable y seria, ya que a la Fecha posee sus propias maquinas horneadoras en las cuales prepara sus masitas y panes, que son su actividad principal Ademas trabaja preparando comida para distintos eventos como fiestas, matrimonios, fiestas de graduacion, etc. La casa en la que vive es de su abuela quien por ser su familiar no le cobra alquileres. La señora es muy responsable y es una de nuestras mejores clientes, ya que hasta la fecha y desde su primer crédito no ha presentado problema alguno, lo que demuestra su seriedad y compromiso consigo misma

loans.use: Invest in ingredients for her business and tools of her trade

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 65 years and is married to Angel Benitez (who is also 65); Inocencia’s husband works as a driver. The couple has five children who all graduated from college. Inocencia and Angel knew that they needed to work very hard to give their sons a good education. That motivated Inocencia to open her shop thirty years ago; she called it “Despensa Rios”.

Inocencia saw a great business opportunity because there was a lack of mini supermarkets in her neighborhood. Now she has many customers who know her very well, and every time they need something they go to the “Despensa Rios”.

In rural areas of Paraguay, despensas are a meeting point where people not only do their shopping but also gather and gossip. The money provided by this loan would be used to buy more products for the shop, including sugar, yerba, rice, pasta, bread, milk, and cheese.

loans.use: To purchase products for a general store, including sugar, yerba, rice, pasta, bread, milk, and cheese

loans.name: Peregrinas Group

texts.es:
The assocation called "Peregrinas" (Pilgrims) works with Pro-Mujer with a lot of organization and responsibility. Almost all of them say that the were born with little ability with their hands, but with a lot of imagination and optimism, one of their main activities has become the sale of "chatarritas", a term that is given to various articles that are sold depending on the season (cables, baterries, scissors, flashlights, disinfectants, cords, jewellery, combs, etc.). They offer these to the public mainly by working as street vendors all day They take their young children with them because they don't have anyone with whom to leave them. They need a larger credit to buy carts that they can carry their products in through the city's streets and also to buy other items that will offer them larger profits. In this way, they can obtain daily income for their children and give them, at the very least, good nutrition.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La asociación denominada “PEREGINAS” trabaja con Pro-Mujer con mucha organización y responsabilidad. Casi todas afirman que nacieron con poca habilidad en las manos pero si con mucha imaginación y mucho optimismo, es así que una de sus actividades principales es la venta de chatarritas, denominación que se les da por que venden artículos variados dependiendo la temporada (cables, baterías, tijeras, focos, desinfectantes, cordones, bisutería, peines etc.) estos los ofrecen al publico por lo general de manera ambulante todo el día y lo realizan junto a sus pequeños hijos ya que no tienen con quien dejarlos. Necesitan mayor crédito para comprar carritos en los que puedan llevar sus productos por las calles de la ciudad y también para comprar otros artículos que les ofrezca mayores ganancias de esta forma conseguir ingresos diarios para sus hijos y poder darles al menos una buena alimentación.

loans.use: They need larger credits to buy carts where they can offer their products and also to acquire better products

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe F. is married and has three daughters who are 10, 15, and 19 years old, respectively. Her husband works as a driver. After her husband had an accident while driving a truck at work she started her own business which allows her to help support her family and buy medicines for her husband. Since her husband did not have insurance, she had to start her own business at home in order to obtain money to cover family expenses, buy medicines for her husband, and also to help take care or her children. She started in July 1997 by selling catalog shoes to her neighbors and family. Currently two of her daughters help her with the collection of outstanding debt.

Guadalupe is requesting a $500 loan which she will repay in 6 months. With this money she will buy more merchandise and she will be able to offer more products to her clients. With your help Guadalupe will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Guadalupe F. es casada y tiene 3 hijas 3 de 10 años; 15 años y 19 años, su esposo trabaja como chofer. Inició el negocio ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso para poder comer y comprar medicinas para su esposo el cual sufrió un accidente cuando manejaba un camión de su trabajo, debido a que no tenia seguro medico, tuvo que iniciar su propio negocio en su casa, para tener dinero para el gasto familiar y poder comprar medicinas para su esposo, atenderlo y cuidarlo así como a sus menores hijos. Comenzó en julio de 1997 vendiendo calzado por catalogo con sus vecinos y familiares cercanos. Actualmente 2 de sus hijas le ayudan en la cobranza a los clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder surtir productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Guadalupe saldrá adelante

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
The Gaviotas (Seagulls) assocation has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for 3 years. The group is formed of 18 women that work very responsibly.

For the most part, they used to sell used clothing, an activity that for the moment has a lot of legal problems, and it's not very profitable anymore. This is why they decided to search for another type of business. Now with the help of the tailoring shops that Pro-Mujer offers, they design all types of clothing, that is to say: school uniforms, blouses, dresses, and pants. They also make backpacks and camera cases. They say that they need more capital to be able to buy raw materials and special machinery to make these products and in this way to make their businesses prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La asociación “GAVIOTAS” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace 3 años, grupo formado por 18 mujeres que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.

Ellas en gran parte se dedicaban a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que de momento tiene muchos problemas legales, ya no es muy rentable, entonces decidieron buscar otro tipo de negocio. Ahora con la ayuda de los talleres de confección que ofrece Pro-Mujer, diseñan ropa de todo tipo, es decir, uniformes de escuela, blusas, vestidos, pantalones de vestir, también confeccionan mochilas y estuches de cámaras. Afirman que necesitan capital para poder comprar materia prima y maquinaria especial para la fabricación de estos productos de esta manera lograr que sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: They need capital to be able to buy raw materials and special machinery to make their products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pro Mujer Bolivia - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Mr. Narciso is a single parent who financially supports his son. He owns his home, but it is very humble. His business is that of an auto repair workshop; in addition, he also sells tires. His loan history with our institution demonstrates he is a very responsible and punctual man. During the entire time he has worked with us, he has not presented any problems nor has he been delayed in any payments. He will invest in the purchase of car parts and tires.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Narciso es papá soltero ya que siendo un hombre solo mantiene y cria a un niño, su casa es muy humilde y propia. Su negocio es el de Taller de Reparacion de Automoviles y ademas vende llantas. En su historial de Creditos en nuestra institucion demuestra ser un hombre muy reponsable y puntual, ya que en todo el tiempo que esta trabajando con nosotros no ha presentado ningun problema, ni atraso alguno. Invertirá e la compra de repuestos para automoviles y llantas.

loans.use: He will purchase car repair parts and tires

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen A. D. has a restaurant located in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  At her restaurant she serves meals typical to the region such as pappa de jaungallina, ceviche, aji de gallina, as well as breakfast food and sandwiches.  She currently has a stand in the Mercado la Victoria.

Maria is 49 years old and happily married with 3 children.  Her restaurant is an important source of income for her family as all 3 of her children are still dependent on her and her husband.  Family is very important to Maria and she saves so her children can attend University.

A member of the community bank Mujeres En Accion II, Maria is requesting a loan of $200 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy plates, glasses, and silverware.

loans.use: To buy plates, glasses, and silverware.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia

Ms. Eugenia is 42 years old and she was able to complete her third year of secondary school. She has two dependent children. She live in the El Porvenir district in the province of Trujillo in the town of La Libertad. She began her business eight years ago when she was able to obtain a stand at the “Miguel Grau” market in the El Porvenir district. She sells all types of cooked legumes such as beans, lentils, carrot and beet salad, and other products that can be stewed. Ms. Eugenia is a member of the Banco Comunal “Bendicion de Dios” where she obtained her firt loan of 300.00 soles and with that money was able to buy a few kilos of a variety of legumes, corn, stewed corn, wheat and salads. With the 1100.00 soles loan, which she will repay in four months, She will buy, a sack of garbanzo beans, a sack of panamito (white beans), a sack of serranita lentis, a sack of pallares (white lima beans) and corn. Ms. Eugenia dream with expanding her business and hiring others to sell her products in other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eugenia tiene 42 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos en total que aun dependen de ella.Vive en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Hace ocho años se inicio vendiendo en un pequeño puesto que consiguió en el mercado “Miguel Grau” en el distrito El Porvenir, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de menestras cocinadas tales como frijoles, lenteja, ensaladas de veterraga y zanahoria y otros productos que se puedan sancochar. La señora Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro unos cuantos kilos de una variedad de menestras, maíz, mote, trigo y ensaladas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual pagara en un periodo de cuatro meses comprará: un saco de frijol garbancillo, un saco de panamito, un saco de lenteja serranita, un saco de pallares y maíz mote. La señora Eugenia sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, contratando gente para vender sus productos en otros mercados.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to sell it

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
Ms. Lizet U. M. is 21 years old and she studied pharmaceutical chemistry. She has one dependent son. She lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province. She began her business by selling beauty products and it was successful but she decided to start another business, one related to her studies. With effort and dedication she was able to set up a pharmacy that sells many medicinal products. She set up this business with her community in mind since there are no other pharmacies in the neighborhood. In this way she is able to help meet the needs of her community since community member are always in need of healing illness. She belongs to Banco Comunal “Bendicion de Dios, where she obtained her first loan of 300.00 soles, which allowed her to buy beauty products on sale in order to stock her business. With the 1000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in four moths, she will buy a variety of medicine direct from the labs and that are guaranteed, as well as a large display case where she will display her products. Ms. Lizet dreams with expanding her business and setting up another pharmacy in other places that need one.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lizet U. M. tiene 21 años de edad, estudio la carrera de Químico farmacéutico. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir, Provincia de Trujillo Su negocio se inicio con la venta de productos de belleza le iba bien pero decidió emprender otro negocio, su propio negocio en el que pueda ejercer su carrera. Con esfuerzo y dedicación inicio una botica en la que ofrece productos medicinales. Este negocio lo inicio pensando en su comunidad ya que por la zona donde vive no existe una botica. De esta manera ayuda en las necesidades de su comunidad ya que la mayoría de gente siempre necesita aliviar sus males. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con lo cual compro productos de belleza que estuvieron en oferta para así tener en stock. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses, comprará una variedad de medicinas en las diferentes distribuidoras que traen directo de laboratorio y están garantizados, así también una vitrina grande para allí exhibir sus productos. La señora Lizet sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, instalando otra botica en otros lugares que lo necesiten.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para su venta

loans.name: Carita De Arcilla Group

texts.es:
Making yogurt, cheeses, and ice cream is the main activity of the "Carita de Arcilla" (Face of Clay) association, which is made up of 16 women, who are sure to triumph in their businesses. They start their days very early. They first leave food cooked for their families and then dedicate themselves to making cheeses, yogurt, and exquisite handmade ice cream. They say that with better training in terms of sales and distribution of their products, they could sell them in larger quantities. This is why they need a credit to improve the quality of their products in terms of the packaging, presentation, and distribution. This way they will be able to sell more and to improve their income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La elaboración de yoghurt, quesos y helados es la actividad principal de la asociación “Carita de Arcilla” formada por 16 mujeres, seguras de triunfar en sus negocios. Ellas empiezan su día muy temprano, primero dejan sus alimentos cocinados para la familia y luego se dedican a la elaboración de quesos, yoghurt y exquisitos helados artesanales. Afirman que con una mejor capacitación en cuanto a la venta y distribución de estos podrían vender mayores cantidades de sus productos, es por eso que necesitan crédito para mejorar la calidad de estos en cuanto a empaques, presentación y difusion de sus productos, de esta forma, al vender mas mejoran sus ingresos, para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: Capital to purchase supplies and also to pay for professional courses

loans.name: Marcela Victoria

texts.es:
Ms. Marcela Victoria M. V. is 50 years old, and she finished grade school. She has two children who no longer depend on her. She lives in the El Porvenir District, in the Trujillo Province, in the town of La Libertad, Pero. Since the opening of the Miguel Grau market in the district of el Porvenir she has sold products such as vegetables, groceries, and fruit at a stand. She has increased her sales during the entire time there. In the afternoons she sell food out of her home. She makes salchipollo (a chicken dish), hamburgers and other dishes.

She is a member of Banco Comuna” Bendicion de Dios, where she received her first 300.00 soles loan and with that money she bought whole sale priced vegetables at “La Hermelinda” market in the Trujillo district. With the 1300.00 soles loan, which she will pay back in four months she will buy a potato cutting machine, which will make her job of cutting potatoes easier. She will also buy groceries and vegetables. Her dream is to have her own restaurant in the downtown area of El Porvenir.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcela Victoria M. V. tiene 50 años de edad, estudio primaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total que ya no dependen de ella.Vive en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Desde que se fundo el mercado Miguel Grau en el distrito El Porvenir ella vende por las mañanas en un puesto verduras, abarrotes, molidos y frutas. Todo este tiempo ha ido incrementando su negocio. Por las tardes vende comida en su domicilio, prepara salchipollo, hamburguesas y otros platillos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro una variedad de verduras al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” en el distrito de Trujillo. Con el préstamo de S/. 1300.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará: una maquina cortadora de papa el cual disminuye el trabajo de estar cortándolas a mano, así también comprará abarrotes y verduras. Su mayor sueño es tener su propio restaurante en el centro de El Porvenir.

loans.use: to purchase products in order to sell them

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
Ms. Maria Marlene P. V. is 52 years old. She lives in the Paijan district, Ascope province, in La Libertad Peru. She has four children and one of them is still dependent on her. She was able to complete a secondary school level. She has liked doing business since she was a young girl. She began selling beauty products and with the earning she was able to set up a stand in her home to sell soda, beer empanadas (turnovers) and candy. Her aunt invited her to join Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” and the previous loan she obtained was very helpful since she was able to increase her income and above all she was able to stock her store with a variety of products.

With the 1200.00 soles loan that she will repay in six moths, she will buy, a sack of rice, sugar, oil, snacks, beer and soda. She will also buy beauty products at a lower price to have on hand. Ms. Maria dreams with adding to her business and set up a restaurant to sell Creole food.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Marlene P. V. tiene 52 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad - Perú; tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depende de ella. La señora María estudió secundaria completa. Desde muy pequeña le gustó el negocio, empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y con las ganancias que obtenía puso en su casa una mesa pequeña para vender gaseosas, cerveza, empanadas, caramelos. Una tía le invitó a integrar el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” y con su anterior préstamo que obtuvo le fue de mucha ayuda ya que así pudo aumentar mas su capital y sobretodo tener mayor variedad en su bodega. Con el último préstamo de S/.1200.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará: un saco de arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, cerveza y gaseosas, además comprará productos de belleza aun precio cómodo para tener en stock. La señora María sueña con implementar más su negocio y también con poner un restaurante para vender comida criolla.

loans.use: To purchase supplies in order to sell them

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Ms. Marta L. D. Cordoba is 59 years old and she studied the vocation of administrative assitant. She has three children who live indepentendly. She lives in El Porvenir district, province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. When she began her business she started off with a few milkproducts, and she had a few sales. After a while she began to meet people and has since increased the amount of products and she takes in a lot of orders from the districts of Trugillo and Lared. Sometimes she sells intimate apparel and household decorations upon request. She travels to Lima to buy news product at a good price.

With her first 300.00 soles loan obtained from Banco Comunal “Bendicion D. Dios” she purchased Dulce D. leche, yogurt, cheese and some sausages. With the 1000.00 soles loan that she will repay in fourth months, she will buy a dozen pieces of intimate apparel, 10kg of cheese, half a dozen of yogurt, mortadella and other cooking ingredients since on occasion she is called upon to prepare dishes for events. Martha’s dream is to secure a spot in the new market that is about to open near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sand Juarez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha León D. Córdova tiene 59 años D. edad, estudio hasta el nivel superior, la carrera técnica D. secretariado. Tiene en total tres hijos pero ninguno depenD. D. ella.Vive en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con pocos productos lácteos, tenía pocos pedidos. Con el tiempo se fue haciendo conocida actualmente a incrementado sus productos y le hacen varios pedidos por los distritos D. Trujillo y Laredo. En algunas ocasiones venD. ropa interior y adornos para el hogar solo cuando le hacen pedidos viaja a la Provincia D. Lima para traer novedades y precios cómodos. Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “Bendición D. Dios” compro manjar blanco, yogurt, quesos y algunos embutidos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará: varias docenas D. ropa interior, 10 Kg. D. queso, media docena D. yogurt, natilla, mortadela y algunos ingredientes para cocinar ya que en ocasiones la llaman para preparar un platillo en algún evento. La señora Martha tiene un gran sueño que es el D. conseguir un puesto en el nuevo mercado cerca D. su casa que pronto se aperturará

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to sell it

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto, you will find the main group Villa Tejada, to which the "Divinas" (Divine Women) association belongs. It is comprised of 18 women who are willing to work with much persistence. The majority of them are married, and with an average of 5 children, they say that the wages of their husbands aren't enough, which is what obliges them to search for other means of income.

The main activity of this group is sewing or making clothes (leather and cloth jackets, pants, and dresses), sheathes, curtains, and sweaters woven by machine. They need better capital to buy raw materials, and in this way to obtain a larger stock of products and more income for their own benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Tejada al cual pertenece la asociación “Divinas” compuesta por dieciocho mujeres dispuestas a trabajar con mucho empeño. La mayoría de ellas casadas y con un promedio de 5 hijos, afirman que el salario de sus esposos no les es suficiente, lo que les obliga a buscar otros ingresos. La actividad principal de este grupo es la costura; confección de ropa (chamarras en cuero y tela, pantalones, vestidos), confección de fundas, cortinas y la confección de chompas tejidas a maquina. Necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima, de esta manera conseguir un mayor stok de productos y por consiguiente mayores ingresos para su propio beneficio.

loans.use: Capital for the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ms. Nelly Elizabeth S. is 35 years old. She studied up until 5th year in secondary school. She has to dependent children. She lives in la Campina Sucipe in the district of Paijan, Ascope province, in La Libertad, Peru. When she began her business she started of with few intimate apparel products, and she only had orders placed by her neighbors and acquaintances. She slowly began to fix a place in her home where she sells underwear for men women and children.

Currently, aside from selling underwear she also takes advantage of the school year to sell school supplies as well as paper and notebooks. Her first 300.00 soles loan obtained from Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” was used to buy a dozen pieces of women’s underwear, and another dozen fof men and children’s underwear. With the 400.00 soles loan, which she will pay back in four moths she will buy a variety of intimate apparel and school supplies.

Nelly is the treasurer of the “Ana Lucia de la Torre” mother’s group. Her dream is to have a boutique in her home, were she can sell many products.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly Elizabeth C. S. tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en la Campiña Saucipe del distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando inicio su negocio empezó con poca mercadería en lencería, al principio solo tenia pedidos de sus vecinos y conocidos. Poco a poco con el tiempo ha ambientado un lugar en su casa en la que vende ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Actualmente a parte de vender ropa íntima también aprovecha la campaña escolar para vender útiles de escritorio así como también papeles y cuadernos. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lo invirtió en la compra de una docena de ropa interior para dama, una docena de ropa interior para caballero y para niños en general. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará: lencería en variedad y útiles escolares. La señora Nelly es tesorera del club de madres “Ana Lucia de la Torre”. Su mayor sueño es tener una boutique en su casa en la que venda varios productos.

loans.use: Purchase items to sell

loans.name: Santos Edelmira

texts.es:
Santos Edelmira Florián C. is 40 years of age, and completed up to the first year of middle school. She has four children, but only three still depend on her. She lives in the Paiján district in the province of Ascope in La Libertad, Peru.

She started her business selling television stands and entertainment centers. She started selling one or two according to how she received orders and afterward started increasing production. She also sells meat, manjar blanco ( a pastry filling made from milk) and roscas (ring-shaped pastries) that are sent to her from the Sierra Liberteña, which she offers and sells in the different markets. Currently, she is launching a new business selling woven tablecloths, rugs and ponchos. She is buying the necessary material to create these items.

She is a member of the communal bank “Manos Unidas” (United Hands), where she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00, which she used to buy shelves.

With the loan of S/. 1700.00, which she will repay in a 6-month term, she will purchase different kinds of threads to do her weaving and buy some furniture.

Her greatest wish is purchase a motorcycle so that her son may use it for work, and that way, obtain additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Santos Edelmira Florián C. tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el primer año de secundaria. Tiene cuatro hijos en total pero tres aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio se inicia con la venta de muebles para televisores y equipos, empezó vendiendo uno o dos de acuerdo a como le hacían pedidos posteriormente fue incrementando, así también se dedica a la venta de carne, de manjar blanco y roscas que le envían de la sierra liberteña el cual ofrece y vende por los diferentes mercados. Actualmente esta iniciando un nuevo negocio que es de tejidos de manteles, tapetes y chompas, para ello esta comprando los materiales necesarios para su elaboración.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con los cuales compro estantes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 el cual pagara en un periodo de seis meses comprará hilos de todo tipo para hacer los tejidos y para comprar algunos muebles.

Su mayor sueño es tener una moto en la cual trabajará su hijo, de esa manera tendrá otro ingreso.

loans.use: Purchase different kinds of threads for her weaving as well as some furniture.

loans.name: Zulma Selena

texts.es:
Zulma Selene Altamirano León is 20 years old and completed her studies up to middle school. She is considering pursuing a specialized career, but she is still saving up to make this happen. She is a single woman without children, and lives in the El Porvenir district in the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Perú.

Since she finished her middle school studies, she started a business selling processed meats such as bologna, hot dogs, canned ham, cheese and other products of that variety, and distributed them among the different footwear manufacturing workshops. She also creates shoeboxes, purchasing cardboard and cutting it according to the requests she receives. She then sends them to print and finally, she builds them. She receives orders from the owners of these footwear workshops.

She is a member of the communal bank “Bendición de Dios” (Grace from God). From this bank, she received her first loan of S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase several cases of bologna and ham and another part to purchase a display case where she could exhibit some candies outside her home to sell to neighbors.

With the loan of S/. 900.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase on a weekly basis: a package of hot dogs, two cases of bologna, cheese and prime materials to create the boxes such as cardboard, staples, raffia, etc.

Her greatest wish is to attend school and complete her nursing degree successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Zulma Selene Altamirano León tiene 20 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa, esta pensando en seguir estudiando una carrera tecnica pero todavía esta ahorrando para realizarlo. Es una joven soltera y sin hijos. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Desde que termino de estudiar en el colegio emprendió un negocio, se dedica a la venta de embutidos tales como mortadela, hod dog, jamonada, quesos y otros productos de ese origen, reparte por los diferentes talleres de fabricación de calzados. Además se dedica a elaborar cajas para calzados, compra el cartón y lo corta de acuerdo a como se requiera, luego las manda estampar y finalmente las arma, tiene pedidos de los dueños de los talleres de calzado.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” en este banco recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro algunos conos de mortadela y jamonada y con otra parte del dinero compro una vitrina para exhibir algunas golosinas afuera de su domicilio para vender a los vecinos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 900.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará: semanalmente un paquete de hod dog, dos conos de mortadela, queso y material para elaborar las cajas tales como: cartón, grapas, rafia, etc.

Su mayor sueño es estudiar y terminar con éxito la carrera profesional de enfermería.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her store (a package of hot dogs, two cases of bologna, cheese and prime materials to create shoeboxes such as cardboard, staples, raffia, etc.).

loans.name: Rosa Perputua

texts.es:
Rosa Perpetua L. T. is 48 years of age and completed her studies up to middle school. She has 6 children, but only one depends on her. She lives in the Salaverry district in the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Perú.

Rosa started her business when a group of teachers gave a workshop to a group of mothers in their sector. There, she learned how to create lingerie and sportswear. With time, her work has become well-known and her neighbors and relatives place several orders.

She is a member of the communal bank “JERID – Camino al Éxito” (Path to Success). With her previous loan, she was able to create various garments and holiday ornaments, thus taking advantage of the campaign which she has done very well with.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, which she will repay in six months, she will purchase spun polyester, spandex and other materials used to create winter clothing being that it is right around the corner.

She is very happy with her business because the earnings have allowed her to complete the construction of her home.

Rosa is the president of the Mother’s Club ““Purísima Concepción” (Immaculate Conception). Her greatest wish is to purchase a mending machine to provide a more sophisticated finish to her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Perpetua L. T. tiene 48 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 6 hijos pero solo 1 depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Rosa inicia su negocio cuando un grupo de maestros fueron a enseñar al club de madres de su sector, allí aprendió a confeccionar lencería y ropa deportiva. Con el tiempo se ha hecho muy conocida, le hacen varios pedidos sus vecinas y sus familiares.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “JERID – Camino al Éxito” con el anterior préstamo que recibió pudo confeccionar varias prendas y adornos navideños de esa manera aprovecho la campaña la cual le ha ido muy bien.

Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 que cancelará en seis meses comprará tela polar, tela alicrada y otros materiales para confeccionar ropa de invierno ya que se aproxima.

Está muy contenta con su negocio porque con lo que le permite ganar a terminado de construir su casa.

La señora Rosa es presidenta del club de madres “Purísima Concepción”.Su mayor sueño es comprar una remalladota para dar mejor acabado a sus confecciones.

loans.use: Purchase prime materials to create winter clothing.

loans.name: Nila

texts.es:
Mrs. Nilla is a member or the Communal Bank "Las Triumfadoras de Nicrupampa". She sells candy for a living and her business is located at the "Tola Pasquel" school, of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With this loan of $375 USD, which will be paid off in 4 installments, she will puchase: 10 boxes of cookies, 4 boxes of chocolate, 3 bags of lollipops, 4 packs of soda, 5 boxes of gum, 6 packs of bottled juice, 4 boxes of juice in boxes. She is 34 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Her husband works in construction and both work in order to educate their children and support the household.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nila, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, su negocio queda en el colegio Tola Pasquel del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.
